Combining the economic reach of Genoa with the industrial and population strength of Savoy, they are a significant rival for the leadership of the Italian states. Most relevant is the direct threat which their geographical position poses to Provence proper. Bringing them under our control, however, will make our power in Italy all but unassailable.
End the Hundred Years’ War

For centuries, the House of Valois-Medici has barricaded themselves within Provence, plotting against us – as if they were still a serious rival, rather than a pathetic remnant of their former might. France belongs to the House of Plantagenet, and no one else! The time has come to conclude the absurd charade of the “King in France” and put an end to the feud between our houses once and for all. Provence has lived long enough!
Sell Avignon

We hold the Comtat of Avignon, but its political significance is no longer of relevance to our nation. Rather than continue to expend resources supporting an enclaved city-state, we should seek to part with it on favorable terms with the enclaving power. It was originally purchased by the Papacy, so selling it back is only fair.
A Nation Under Papal Interdict

The Pope has placed $COUNTRY$ under interdict, excommunicating us from the Church. All Catholic priests within $COUNTRY$ are forbidden from allowing public celebration of sacred rites, and the Catholic faithful of Europe scorn us.
The Inca claimant

Quiso Yupanqui was destined to rule the Inca empire as the first born of Huascar III. However his cowardice in the battle of Lima saw him discredited at court, many blaming him for the defeat. He was thus exiled and his uncle Huayna Capac IV was crowned in his stead. For 11 years we have hosted him in Camelot, granting him a small allowance but recently he has grown restless about taking back the throne of the Inca. Reports talk about unrest from the chieftains following the reforms of the Imperial court, and the ilness of the usurper. Quiso has demanded we help him arm his supporters so he could take back what is ours, and ensuring a more friendly, if not open to new ideas neighbour.
Arm the partisans of the true Inca
Place him under guard, we must not trouble the peace
The coup of Quiso Yupanqui!

After years of exile in Beornia, the coward son of Huascar III who commanded the right wing of the Incan army in the battle of Lima and who fled following the charge of the Herrera cavalry has come back to the capital with Beornian guns. Striking by surprise he hopes to take back the throne with the support of many conservative nobles.
The coup succeeds
Quiso Yupanqui and his partisans are stopped and killed
The coronation of Quiso Qapac

The coup has succeeded. Quiso himself slaughtered the usurper and his son despite the formidable defense of the Chinu guard and its commander, the Ronin Oishi Chikara. All administrators were interrogated, with the Qingqiuan Yiang Jujiu minister and first preceptor of the Prince executed for betraying the Empire in favour of the foreigners. The country soon rallied around his true ruler who has promised to uphold the natural balance of the Andine society, reverting several modernization reforms of his predecessors
Long live Quiso Qapac!
The Great Andine Famine

The Inca empire in the Andes is suffering from a great famine following an outbreak of potato blight. Potatoes have suffered in the past from diseases, but never on such a scale and the inefficient and closed governement of Quiso Capac has only worsened the situation. All around the empire the peasants turn to the God of the Sun to relieve them of their pains but so far no sign of amelioration has been seen.
Why is this happening to us ?
Famine spreads
The potato blight has spread to another part of the Empire
Inti preserves us!
Uraycusta Riots

As the famine spreads to Antisuyu the port of Uraycusta, the "gate of the Empire" has seen the local Aimara inhabitants riot against the foreigners accused of harboring grain to make a profit. The Qingqiuans, the more numerous were the most hit with the Chinese quarter reduced to ashes with hundreds of its inhabitants. Japanese and Anglois traders were also targeted in the attack, the crowd nearly attacking the diplomatic quarter before the intervention of the local police and foreign guards opened fire on the crowd.
Will the disasters never end ?
Opportunities in the West

The disastrous administration of Quiso Qapac has led to a grave famine in the Andes. The empire of the Inca is weakened as bodies pile throughout the Andine villages and their soldiers are weakened by their hunger. Back in the XVIIth century the adventurer Edward Pitt had tried to conquer a port in the Pacific only to be met by death but now we can win!
Beornia will seize the opportunity
We can't use their distress to gain new lands
Beornian demands

An envoy from Camelot has traveled to the Imperial capital to deliver a simple message : cede the southern provinces to the Beornians or they will be taken by force. The famine and unstability have weakened Tawantinusuy and it might be better if we caved in rather than try to delay the invasion.
We have resisted these colonizers before !
We must abandon the South
The Andine war
The Inca has refused our demands, we must rally our troops to enforce them!
For King and Saint George!
Colonization of the Andes

The conquest of New-Mercia was followed by an intense propaganda by the Beornian state to show the rest of the civilized world that they had 'saved' the Aimara inhabitants of the Southern Andes from the famine. New-Mercia proper and especially the port of Edward's Landing were targeted for propaganda actions as they hosted several foreign communities, and shipments of food flooded the port. However the campaigns outside never saw much of it as Beornian bureaucrats took lands by force from the inhabitants. In the mountains, far from international observations, the Beornian army was free to destroy villages and accaparate land for future colonization with countless tribes pushed to the North. When the Beornians did not act, entire villages were left to starve, resulting in one of the most brutal massacres of the XIXth century.
Beornia has nothing to excuse for!
Claim the Andes
The famine has allowed our army to finally take the upper hand over the weakened Inca troops. It is time we claim the spoils of war !
The Shameful Treaty
The famine has allowed the Beornians to shatter our armies and force us to negotiate. We are forced to give them Antisuyu, Kuchichay and Catamarca
The empire lies shattered...
Colonization of the Andes

The conquest of New-Mercia was followed by an intense propaganda by the Beornian state to show the rest of the civilized world that they had 'saved' the Aimara inhabitants of the Southern Andes from the famine. New-Mercia proper and especially the port of Edward's Landing were targeted for propaganda actions as they hosted several foreign communities, and shipments of food flooded the port. However the campaigns outside never saw much of it as Beornian bureaucrats took lands by force from the inhabitants. In the mountains, far from international observations, the Beornian army had used the war to destroy villages and accaparate land for future colonization. Countless tribes were pushed to the North while entire villages were left to starve, resulting in one of the most brutal massacres of the XIXth century.
Beornia has nothing to excuse for!
The first Imperial assembly

One of the reforms pushed by Pachacuti II was the establishment of an Assembly to represent the people of the Empire in governance. It first convened in $YEAR$, with a Lower Chamber elected by the various Ayllus of the Empire and a Senate appointed by the Emperor. The campaigns voted by villages with no individual votes cast, while in the Imperial cities only those who payed the 'poll tax' could vote. The first Inca constitution while deeply influenced by the European and Japanese models, retained several of the particularities of the Empire and established the so-called era of the 'advised Sapa Incas'.
The voice of the people is the will of the Inka!
The gate of the empire

Following the loss of the Inka homeland to the Spanish, the Empire strenghtened its hold on the South. In the southern valley of the new Antisuyu the bay of Uraycusta was first developed by Dongese who had acquired trading privileges following the establishment of the Chinu guard. Following the crossing of Land's End and the treaty of Bordeaux that saw the Anglois gain access to Potosi silver, Uraycusta grew even further. Eventually by the XVIIIth century and the arrival of the Japanese traders in the region, it had been nicknamed the 'Gate of the Inca' by outsiders as this was the only port accessible to foreigners. The reforms of Pachacuti targeted the city the city plan was reorganized and the city was given self governance like the Imperial capital, free from the Southern Apu (governor) as to encourage foreign investments and settlement.
Let the world come!
Rice farming in Antisuyu

Rice was brought to the knowledge of the Inca following the arrival of Dongese merchants and adventurers in the late XIVth century but cultivation was sporadic as few Ayllus and administrators wanted to cultivate this new plant. But in Antisuyu the climate has revealed itself as a good match for the plant and the Asiatic and Qingqiuan presence in the city meant that the cereal was in demand. In the 1840's Pachacuti II, who was a well known consumer of rice, developed great infrastructure projects to enlarge the production of rice in the South. This effort led to an increase of food that allowed the Empire to avoid disaster during the Potato blight of the late 1840's.
Rice for the people (and the Inka)!
The last Silver fleet

The only diplomatic tool that the Empire had following the conquest of Cuzco was the great silver mines of the Andes and especially Potosi. While payments to the Spanish were stopped as soon as the Colombian wars began, the Anglois fleet still continued to come every 4 years to take its due. Pachacuti II arranged following his coronation for a diplomat to be sent to Paris to end the treaty to show its regained independence. The Anglois accepted as their reliance on silver had been reduced thanks to Atlantian and Qingqiuan gold flooding the markets with only the payment for $YEAR$ to be done. Now the Silver fleet has left the port of Uraycusta for the last time, with a day of celebrations in the empire for the end of European colonialism.
Tawantinsuyu will not be exploited anymore!
The last Silver fleet

The Dual-Monarchy had gained access to the Potosi silver in the XVIIth century, securing payments of silver in exchange for guarantees of the Inca Empire continued independence. As silver became less of a necessity thanks to the various Gold rushes, the interest of the Silver fleets declined for Anglois elites. Following the accession of the new Incan emperor Pachacuti II, diplomats agreed to end the old treaty of Bordeaux in exchange for a last shipment and preferential relations with the new 'civilized state'
It was good while it lasted!
The Great Land Reform

Before the arrival of the Conquistadors the Incan economy was not based on individual property and markets, but on the basis of reciprocity between individuals, but also inside the Empire as a whole. The corvée, or mit'ma, was in theory based on the fact that in bad times the emperor would help the communities who worked for him. This system was brutally changed by the Conquest and the spread of European thoughts as the chieftains acquired more lands from the community for themselves. Pachacuti invested several administrators to the creation of a modern cadaster and the end of nobility hegemony on land possession. The mit'ma was also formally abolished. The Ayllus were left with a choice : the lands were divided between the various families of the villages or instituted as common land possessed by the entire village. A mixed system of landowning prevailed after the reforms, granting far more power to the peasant communities than before and ensuring a greater food production.
Lands owned by communes, what a strange idea.
Feeding the empire

The various reforms of Pachacuti and the adoption of foreign and modern agricultural techniques allowed the Empire to grow far more food than before, accompanying the growth of population. The Empire while not controlling the food market as before still exerted great influence over the merchants, instituting maximum prices during times of hunger and ensuring redistribution of food for isolated communities in periods of drought.
Our people is fed and growing!
Ending the colonial system

The reconquest of old imperial lands up to Quito proved to be a major problem for the Empire of the Sun. The economy was controlled by the Granadan and catholic Quechua elites who abused the rural communities to gain more wealth. In the same time the Catholic faith proved to be hard to manage as bishops rallied the masses against the 'Heathen invaders' adoring idols and devils. To counterract both of these problems, the land reform that had been instituted in the Southern Andes was extended to Peru, with the resisting landowners being put to trial or even murdered in riots where the injustice was the worst. Meanwhile the Catholic masses grew less poor thanks to the Inka, securing the loyalty of the rural communities. The land reform disrupted the economy of the Central Andes for nearly two decades as production had to be reorganized.
Colonization has ended
Renew the Chinu alliance

The relations between the Qingqiuese and the Empire of the Sun go back to the XVth century when a Dongese ship landed near Quito, bringing the lost Chinese colonists in contact with their first non-hostile state after the disaster of Acapulco. Soon after disgruntled mercenaries from Dong Guo arrived to settle in the empire bringing variolation, gunpowder and mettalurgy to the Empire and forming the 'Chinu Guard', critical to the continued independence of the Inca Empire. After his accession to the throne Pachacuti II sent several ambassies to San Bao to rekindle their long friendship and secure a renewed alliance.
The Alliance must be reforged!
We don't need the Qingqiuese
Embassy from the Empire of the Sun

The Inca empire was the first non-hostile state the Chinese colonists encountered in the New-World, with Dongese ships avoiding the coast of Mexico following the slaughter of several crewmen in the bay of Acapulco. The Inca Empire brought food and ressources to the lost colonists, and many settled there, with also plenty of sailors marrying with Quechua women during their trips. The new era of Pacific navigation in the XVIIth century allowed the Qingqiuese to transport the Inca silver to China, greatly securing their trade adventures and ensuring the development of Qingqiu as it exists today. The reasons for allying the Inca are numerous and their ambassadors are ready to sign it as soon as we want it done.
Long live the Pacific alliance!
We don't need them.
Humala Mission

The Humala Mission or Humala Embassy was an Inca diplomatic journey to Japan, initiated in $YEAR$ by the Imperial court. Although it was not the only such "mission", it is the most well-known and possibly most important for the modernization of Inca and the establishment of lasting relations between the two Empires of the Sun. It was first proposed by the influential head of the Chinu Guard Oishi . The purposes of the mission were twofold: To negotiate commercial treaties to increase trade in the Pacific and to gather information on education, technology, culture, and military, social and economic structures from Japan who was considered as a model of successful and independent modernization.
The Humala mission

In $YEAR$, $COUNTRY$ hosted the Humala mission, an embassy from $FROMCOUNTRY$ that aimed to negotiate new trade treaties and gather knowledge to assist them in their modernization. The chief of the embassy, Huascar Humala received an imperial audience and attracted great attention during his stay. While not the first Quechua to set foot in the Home Islands, nor the first embassy sent by the Empire of the Sun to the Empire of the Rising Sun, it sponsored growing ties between the two powers and became a symbol of their modernity for the Japanese elites.
Two empires closer under the Sun!
Creation of the Liwru

By $YEAR$, the Inca state had transitioned into a dominated monetized economy. The economy minister implemented the creation of a paper-money backed by the huge silver and gold reserves gathered over the centuries. The money soon proved to be resilient and strong as the local population adopted it and international merchants used it for their Amerigan endeavours
Let the money flow!
Religion in the new Inca state

The cult of Inti, the sun god, has been the basis of the Inca religion since the foundation of the Empire. The emperors claim descent from Inti, with an old legacy of inbreeding to keep the blood of the god pure. Each ayllu worships huacas, mummified ancestors kept in the Imperial capital, and several other deities of the Andine pantheon. The relocation of the Empire to the South didn't change much as Christianity never truly took because of the tales of Spanish brutalities against the colonized populations of the western provinces. Pachacuti II guaranteed freedom of religion in the hopes of securing the loyalty of the Quechua in Granada and to please the European powers. This created some backlash from some of the religious elite but Pachacuti left all religious decisions to the Willaq Umu, the High Priest of Inti who spent the following years consolidate the Imperial religion.
Is this still the empire of Inti ?
The Inti state religion

While the Sapa Inka officially left all religious affairs to the priests of Inti, only performating the rituals required by the tradition following the decision of Pachacuti II, this only strenghtened the cult in the long term. The various Willaq Umu, chosen by the Sapa Inka and reserved by tradition to members of the Imperial family, formalized the relationship between the gods and the Sapa Inka who became even more in the Imperial ideology a divine being who was separate from the rest of his subjects. The various cults of the Andes were left untouched by these changes, as the official religion only took care of the Imperial cults and especially the shrines of Inti. The Inti faith was reenforced by this new movement as the people took part in Inti ceremonies to demonstrate loyalty to the Empire while honoring their huacas and offering sacrifices to their local divinities.
The Inca preserves balance!
The Inti Raymi

The first task the Imperial officers prepared for after the reconquest of Cuzco was the preparations for the Festival of the Sun, the greatest ceremony of the Empire performed by the Sapa Inca himself on the winter solstice. Crowds gathered in the Imperial capital to celebrate the renewed festival since the Conquest.
On the 24th June $YEAR$, the empire was truly reborn!
The Koricancha

Back in the days of the old empire, the Willaq Umu performed their rituals in the golden temple, close to the Imperial palaces and in the true centre of the Empire. The Spanish demolished the temple, only leaving the foundations to build a church on it. While freedom of religion had been proclaimed and the Catholic cult was not persecuted anymore, the Imperial governement demolished the Church of Santo Francesco and planned a new Koricancha to be built. This act while heavily justified to the eyes of the Inti followers was met with rage by the Catholic faithful. The temple took nearly 15 years to be rebuilt, shining with gold and silver and being acclaimed as the herald of the new imperial architecture.
Catholics will accept it or face our wrath!
The Cuzco university

The return of the Imperial court to Cuzco saw numerous great works to embellish and make the old city a worthy capital for the Empire of the Sun. Among these works was the University of Cuzco, which soon became the centre of knowledge for the Empire as the first centre of higher learning of the empire. Several others spawned over the years but none as prestigious as the first Inca university.
Independence through knowledge
The Mountains of Death

For decades the conquest of New-Mercia had been heralded as a great humanitarian project that had allowed civilization to flourish into the uncivilized Andes. But a recent report from a Burgundian missionary, Jean Casemer, who has spent 5 years in Native communities from the Andes has torn this facade apart. Collecting the tales of the great famine and the atrocities done by the Beornian army, he has personally scouted several abandoned villages 'meeting only death' for miles. His report was a blow to Beornian prestige although it did not amount to much as the Beornians never apologized or changed their stance about their Western provinces.
So much for the humanitarian facada
The legacy of Nina-Chumbi

Tales from the old empire tell how Tupac Yupanqui sailed to spread the Empire of the Sun across the sea, finding the islands of Nina-chumbi and Hahua-chumbi. As our mastery of the sea progresses, our contacts with the isolated island of Rapa Nui have grown, and many think that they are truly the islands of the myths. Even if that isn't true, the possession of this island would strenghten our mastery of the South-Eastern Pacific.
Annexing Easter Island

With our control of the Western Pacific coast we are now able to project our fleets far into the Pacific to defend our rightful place in the Southern Hemisphere. The island of Rapa Nui, or Easter Island as we know it, is an isolated island whose population suffers from their condition. It is time we hail the Beornian flag high over the island and civilize its inhabitants!
Treaty of Uraycusta

The war has gone long enough. $COUNTRY$ has defeated the Mapuche rebels and occupied their territories without any Scandinavian intervention capable of relievingthem. Scandinavia will have to accept our rule over the Mapuche.
Force Beornia to come to terms
The Beornians could not face our navy and with our blockade in place, we will show them that they must accept our demands.
Rename Land's End
With our colony in Southern Ameriga, it is time to give proper names to these lands
Annex the Mapuche tribes

The South of the Empire has always been our most difficult frontier to maintain even before the Europeans stole half of the 4 corners. It is thus not hard to understand why we call the Mapuche, 'purun awqa', savage people. After centuries of warfare we finally were able to end war withthe southern tribes, while pledging to not enfringe on their lands. But as the Southern Andes become contested, it is time we end their autonomy.
Rename the land
We have taken several lands that need a proper English name
Renaming the South-Eastern frontier
We must erase the trace of Beornian settlement of the region we know by other names.
Organize Chiri

We should organize our new Amerigan territory of Chiri to better reflect both a local structure, as well as set up the possibility for autonomous rule--dominated by our benevolent colonial administrators, of course.
Rename the Frontier
Now that we have taken control of the Beornian frontier, it must be given civilized Beornian names.
Lars Heyerdhal

The Mapudungun people have always fiercely resisted centralization, only coming together in timesof war to protect themselves from the invaders. As years go by, we have seen times changing. When we could resist the ‘Inka’, be they Quechua or Beornian, seems like a long time ago. The tribes accepted peace, even if it meant to see our enemies grow stronger. But now has come a formidable man, Lars Heyerdhal, a great explorer and commander who has heard of our plights and propose to wage war to recover our lost lands. A council of the main tribes of our country has declared him ‘toqi’, our leader.
Long hail our savior!
Reports from the South...

Troubled reports come from the Mapuche tribes. A man called Lars Heyerdhal coming from Scandinavia has seemingly been able to rally the tribes against our rule. Our contacts in the European embassies know nothing of this man who apparently was just a disillusioned immigrant in Camelot a few months ago. The Scandinavian attaché in Uraycusta pledges that he will get an official statement from his country, but he seems as lost as us on the situation. Our Foreign department is not so pleased by Scandinavian intervention. From their base of Tapt O, they have over the years sent several expeditions in the Southern Cone, and while there has been no official attempt to settle the place, the revolt of the Mapuche could very well be a pretext for Copenhagen to intervene.
What does this settler intends to do ?
The Kingdom of Araucania

Strange news come from Southern Ameriga. In two days we have received a demand from clarification from our representative in the Incan Empire and a letter of friendship from the so-called ‘King of Araucania and Patagonia’, Karl-Lars von Heyerdhal. Reports seem to indicate that Lars Heyerdhal was months ago just a worthless subject of the Crown, but he has apparently taken over the Mapuche tribes as their king and want to expel the Incas from their lands. While he seems like a madman, he could serve our interests. Numerous tribes inhabit the Southern Cone : let them unite under a King of our obedience while we settle the Magellan strait. Or we could let the Southerners deal with this delusional King.
Recognize his kingdom
Assure the Incas we have nothing to do with this
Scandinavian recognition!

The letter from the King Karl-Lars has been received warmly by the Foreign department of Copenhagen who has recognized our state as sovereign and rightful. This has been a great honor for the King, who still apparently doesn’t know that a toqi is not the same thing as a King, but translation problems will have to wait for the end of the Inka claims on their territories.
For the Mapuche!
Scandinavian intervention

What we thought was just a farce has now become a matter of state. The so-called kingdom of Araucania and Patagonia, instituted by the mad Lars Heyerdhal, has been recognized by the Scandinavians who now ask us to retire our troops from the Araucanian territory. Either we recognize the Mapuche claims to independence and risk to see a Scandinavian colony on our southern border in a few years or fight but that will surely means that we will have to face the Scandinavian armies and also navy, along with the resistant Mapuche.
We will end the Mapuche threat!
We must abandon this Southern endeavor...
The Araucanian War

The Incans have decided to fight for their Southern territories. We must swiftly intervene : it will be hard to justify to the public a long war on the other side of the world if we don’t score a few victories and protect our allies.
To the far side of the world!
The Treaty of Uraycusta

With no victory in sight, it is hard for us to get more credits for the war from home. We must accept that the Mapuche are subjects of the Incans and abandon any claims we could have on the Amerigan cone.
Farewell my Amerigan dreams !
Victory in the South

With the Scandinavians letting us deal with the Mapuche at last, we can formally annex the Southern provinces into our state. Lars Heyerdhal has been sent back to Scandinavia and forbidden to set a foot into our Empire.
The South is ours for good
Victory against the Inka
The Mapuche have secured their independence thanks to Scandinavia!
Long may our nation lives!
Halting Beornian advances

We have been in a conflict with the Beornians for years over the archipelago of Tapt ø, which they claim we took from them. Besides this conflict, the Beornians have claimed over the years lands in Patagonia despite their old treaties with the Mapuche tribes. With the victory of the Kingdom of Araucania in the West, numerous tribes have proclaimed Karl-Lars their toqi as well in Patagonia. He now asks of us to help him free these tribes from Beornian influence.
Send a squadron to Camelot!
A Scandinavian envoy

We have received a message from the Scandinavian ambassador in Camelot that asks us to accept the claims of the Kingdom of Araucaunia over Patagonia by giving back any lands belonging to the Mapuche tribes we may have annexed in the previous years and settle our border at the Graham river. While crushing the Araucanians seems easy enough for our state, Scandinavia is another beast and it might be better if we accepted this treaty…
What is valuable in the South anyway ?
We will not surrender without a fight
Patagonian convention

Scandinavia has propelled the unlikely adventurer kingdom of Araucania to independence and as the rightful owner of the Mapuche lands in Southern Ameriga. Beornia has been forced to cede any landssouth of the Graham river and their settlers have been evacuated from Mapuche lands. Now the rule of the adventurer Karl-Lars von Heyerdhal extends over all the Mapuche lands, while Scandinavia has moved to occupy the Magellan strait to ‘safeguard it for international trade’.
Long live the Mapuche people!
Patagonian convention

Scandinavia has propelled the unlikely adventurer kingdom of Araucania to independence and as the rightful owner of the Mapuche lands in Southern Ameriga. Beornia has been forced to cede any landssouth of the Graham river and their settlers have been evacuated from Mapuche lands. Now the rule of the adventurer Karl-Lars von Heyerdhal extends over all the Mapuche lands, while Scandinavia has moved to occupy the Magellan strait to ‘safeguard it for international trade’.
Another addition to our collection
Victory for Beornia!
The foolish Scandinavians could not break our will and might, we are free to expand south as we were meant to be !
For England and Saint George!
The treaty of Copenhagen

The Scandinavians have vanquished us, shelling our ports and navies while imposing a dire blockade upon us. With their armies controlling some of our lands, we were forced to sign an humiliating treaty that cedes any lands we held across the River Graham to the so called Kingdom of Araucania.
A day of shame for the English
Beornia cedes its lands
Our lands have been returned to us thanks to Scandinavian involvement!
Glory to Heyerdhal
The Treaty of Copenhagen

Our victory over Beornia has cemented the rule of our protectorate in Araucania over the whole Amerigan cone. In exchange for this, we have occupied Land's End, giving us a great deal of influence over any ships that cross the Horn.
A good investment!
The Incan retreat
Great celebrations have erupted in Mapuche lands as the Incas have retreated from our territory following the news of Scandinavian protection.
Long live Heyerdhal!
The Mapuche rebellion
The help promised by Heyerdhal will not come. We are on our own against the Inka invader.
Liberty or death!
Deposition of the Toqi
Deposition of the Toqi

The rule of Karl-Lars was always more important in his mind than in reality. Never learning the language of his subjects, he lived in his court proclaiming decisions that never were materialized. Eventually, his behaviour clashed with the Mapuche elders that organized a great gathering in the capital and deposed him as toqi, and sent him back to his homeland. Now they have decided to end the Kingdom of Araucania to proclaim a Republic of the Mapuche people.
Farewell Karl-Lars!
The establishment of the Araucanian protectorate ?

Eventually Karl-Lars ideas clashed with his subjects habits. Our ‘good ally’ was ferried back to Copenhagen where he has spent the last days in an apathic state. We could easily convince him to give his royal rights to the King, settle him in a Norwegian fjord and move to annex the Mapuche into our colonial empire. After all, we control their military with their officers trained by our men and supplying them with weapons and ammunition. Or we could recognize the new Republic they have created so that it could serve us as a buffer in Ameriga : after all, the land down there is not that important.
Annex the tribes
We prefer a buffer Mapuche council
Establishment of the Araucanian protectorate

After the deposition of the adventurer King Karl-Lars by the Mapuche tribes that had elected him, the former sovereign settled in his natal Norway, abdicating his rights to Scandinavia who swiftly decided to impose a protectorate on the Mapuche. Resistance was easily crushed : Scandinavians had explored the territory for years, and knew whose elders could help them in controlling the territory. This brought an end to the shortlived attempt at Mapuche independence as Scandinavia extended its Ildmark colony.
The end of the Mapuche dreams.

column1: ##### Aragon and the Latin Empire (Coded by DeNuke, Localized by Various) ##############

column2: The “Third Rome” Speech

”Your Majesty, that all the Christian kingdoms came to an end, coalesced into your realm, two Romes have fallen, the third stands, and there will be no fourth. No one shall replace your Christian Kingdom as according to Revelation 17:10”\n\nAn speech has just been delivered in the Iberian Cortes by a noble claiming to have apparitions of John the Apostle - stating that Aragon is the sole and legal heir to Rome, owing to its likeness to the Roman Empire of old. He proceeded that as Rome’s heirs, Aragon must expand and unite all Latins under one realm. To say this speech is divisive would be an understatement. While the idea of this newfangled “Panlatin” movement piqued many commoners, intellectuals and the Royal Court, the rich and the powerful nobility scoff at the idea, especially the part where they would submit under one crown. This is becoming an issue we cannot ignore any longer. How shall our King respond to this idea?
”Panlatinism shall be a role model we shall aspire to...”
”I like the idea but we can’t commit to this…yet.”
”This is a preposterous idea that shall only tear us apart!”
Italian nationalist activities intensify

With their recent acquisition of both Genoa and Corsica, Savoy has announced the creation of their new Grand-Duchy of Piedmont. While we wouldn’t usually care about the affairs of Turino the effect on our Italian lands has been noticeable. Italian nationalist activities have recently increased as they see Piedmont as a potential unifier for the Italian people in contrast to the revolutionaries in Etruria. Work is being done to stamp down on these groups but it seems that our problems are only increasing.
If they move against us we will crush these upstarts.
Conservatives succeed in Etruria

Etruria, the home of the revolution in Italy, has now finally snuffed the revolurary flame. A new consertaive government has taken hold in Florence and the revolutionaries that once called Etruria home have either been purged or renounced their old ideals. In fact the government does not even seem to hold the idea of a republic dear as there have been talks in having Duchess Margherita of Lucca return as the Duchess of Tuscany. However, this idea faces resistance in Florence and it is uncertain whether Margherita will be able to reclaim her duchy yet.
Good to hear that the Etruscans can see sense.
Liberals succeed in Etruria.

We had hoped that the flame of revolution in Etruria had burnt out, if not, only glowed dimly. However, after recent events in their country it appears that the fire of revolution burns brightly in Etruria. This news has reached many Italian republicans and nationalists and already groups are starting to organize even in our own Italian lands. It’s very clear that Etruria will not stop toward their goals of Italian unification and we must be prepared to stop them should they move against us.
The Revolutionary Hydra roars again, we need to prepare for war and revolution.
Etruria falls to dictatorship

After the failure of their agents in spreading their revolution the libeal government of Etruria has fallen. In its place is a dictatorship, supported by the moderates in their military. Already the revolutionary organizations that Etruria once patronized are being purged and it seems that nationlist activities in our Italian lands are also starting to calm down. It looks like we will no longer have to fear Etruria destabilizing Italy anymore.
The Revolutionary Hydra lies defeated
Nobles demand action against the Santamarians

Back during the start of the XIXth century in response to Revolutionary Etruria’s invasion of Naples, the Santamarians, peasant bandits, rose to fight against the revolution as well as liberal and anticlerical forces both real and perceived. While they aren’t as powerful as they once were, the Santamarians still cause trouble from time to time. In the time since they also started seeing themselves as the protectors of the Catholic Church. To this end when some liberals were protesting the powers and privileges of the church, a band of Santamarians suddenly appeared and a riot broke out. Debate is being held if we should move against the Santamarians, as while we don’t like the liberals at least they currently aren’t destroying things. However, It is believed that the Santamarians are in contact with the Pope who may be giving them tact support. Not only that but local nobles seem indifferent if not supportive of the Santamarians. If we move against the Santamarians chances are it will put us against the Pope, and hurt our standing with the nobility. What should we do?
Demand the arrest of the Santamarians involved
Look the other way
The Santamarians petition us.

We have received a surprising petition from an agent claiming to be working with the Santamarians. He said that the Santamarians are appreciative of us not moving against them and have come with a proposal. They want official support to move against anyone who threatens or goes against the Catholic Church, liberal or noble alike, as well as granting the church some privileges that would infringe on that of the nobility. Naturally, this proposal is sure to anger the nobility and there is no telling what the ramifications could be in giving the church more power than they already have. The Santamarian agent is waiting for a response, should we accept the proposal?.
Yes we find this arrangement acceptable.
No this is too far, reject their proposal.
Santamarians escape into Benevento

It appears we underestimated the support the Santamarians have. When we sent police to arrest the Santamarians involved in that riot it appears that they were tipped off by someone. After some investigating it appears that they were assisted by some Borgist legitimists and have sought asylum in the Papal enclave of Benevento. Our demands to extradite the accused men have been rebuffed by the Papal Legate who seem intent on protecting the Santamarians. We have come so far. Should we drop the case and let the Santamarians go free or should we cross over onto Papal land and take them in by force? Doring this will surely anger the nobility as well as the Pope who is sure to respond harshly to our trespassing.
Respect the Papal asylum
Move in, brigands should not be welcomed by the Papal authorities
The Excommunication of Aragon

We knew that going after the Santamarians in Benevento would anger the Pope but in a shocking declaration the Pope has excommunicated King Josep. The Pope has stated that his reason for the excommunication is not only Josep’s trespass on Benevento but also his attack on the faithful sons of the Santamarians. This news has predictably spread unrest not only to the nobility but also the common folk throughout the Crowns.
Father, forgive us for our tresspasses.
The Nobility wishes us to dismiss Panlatinist ideals

Our actions handling the Santamarians have helped to endear us to the nobility. However, the nobility has decided to petition us on refuting any support of the Panlatin movement.The nobles in Naples are the most powerful force in the realm, using the local Parliament to enshrine their privileges into laws. The Panlatinist theorists and their supporters throughout the Crowns support a complete reform that would centralize and overhaul the political structure into a modern state rather than the archaic confederal Kingdom we rule. The nobles have thus made it clear that they will not tolerate any change to the old contract between the Monarchy and each Crown, and demand an official repudiation of Panlatinism.Even if we dismiss our support of Panlatinism this doesn’t mean the end of our attempt to centralize the kingdom, just the end of this approach. How should we respond to the nobles?
Their time has passed
For the sake of stability they are right
The Representative from Zaragoza

Another day another representative from the nobility, this time from the Cortes of Aragon in Zaragoza. They have a fairly typical petition, the nobility wants reassurances that their old privileges will stay. While we would usually use honey words to try and soothe them over this time is different. This petition is also signed by the King of Navarre, who has been frequenting the Cortes in Zaragoza, which means we will actually have to make a decision. The King of Navarre has become concerned especially after the talk of Panlatinism and the rising tensions over Italian unification. If we wish to commit to the centralization of the Crowns we will have to dismantle their old privileges. While the King of Navarre is technically a vassal of Aragon they run their own affairs and may not wish to remain a part of our realm if we threaten his power. This isn’t even accounting for the potential reaction amongst the various political factions such as the liberals. It is time to make a decision that will affect the future of our kingdom are we going to keep the old privileges.
Aragon cannot survive like it is currently, the old privileges will be phased out.
Our Kingdom is too fragile. A decentralized realm is best for everyone.
Liberals support Centralization

Unsurprisingly, our plan to centralize our kingdom is hated by the nobility, However, to our surprise liberals in Valencia have announced their support towards our centralization plans. Apparently they are hopeful that this centralization will standardize the legal system throughout the kingdom as well as ensure that the same political freedoms apply to our subjects regardless of where they live. This support has soothed our usual stressed tensions with the liberals, for now at least.
A surprise, to be sure, but a welcome one.
Liberals demand we support centralization

To our surprise liberals in Valencia have come forward to announce their dislike of our current decentralization policies. Apparently, they want a centralized kingdom as it will unify both our legal and political system throughout our realm. This presents us with an opportunity. With the support of the liberals we should have enough political capital to maneuver around the nobles, however this will of course anger the nobles as we will be going back on our word. Should we agree with the liberals demands or should we stay the course?
I can’t believe we agree with the liberals on something
Like we said our kingdom is too fragile we need this stability
Revolutionaries in Sassari?

We have recently received reports of possible revolutionary activity in the town of Sassari on the island of Sardinia. We've had trouble with Sardina before, as a popular revolt years ago spiraled out of control and resulted in the creation of the so-called Republic of Arborea. By the time the Aragonese army arrived to defeat the Republic all except for the towns of Sassari, Alghero, and Cagliari were under Arborean control. It also didn’t help that the Arboreans forced out whatever Catalan settlers they could find in the interior of the country, forcing them into the major towns. We cannot let history repeat itself. We have already drawn up plans for a massive crackdown on suspected revolutionaries and it should nip and rebellion in the bud. However, such a brutal display will most likely offend our other Italian holdings in Sicily and Naples and threaten the stability of the kingdom as a whole. Instead we could just ignore the revolutionaries as they are currently suspected to be few in number, and just station some troops on the island in case anything should break out.
Take no chances, begin the crackdown.
A few revolutionaries cannot take an island ignore them.
The Second Republic of Arborea

A revolt has broken out in the town of Sassari. Led by Luciano Buonaparte, cousin of Gastone Buonaparte of Corsica, they have proclaimed the Second Republic of Arborea in the northern half of the island of Sardinia. We must move fast and destroy this rebellion before they can fully seize control of the island.
ugh, not again, well at least it’s just one town this time.
The Treaty of Cagliari

We have failed to defeat the Republic of Arborea and not only that but we have lost all of Sardinia to their revolt. Figures are being pointed everywhere as to how we could have lost but regardless of why it happened it bodes poorly for the future of Aragon.
This is a black eye for our reputation.
A futile revolution

The second Republic of Arborea has been defeated and its leaders captured. While we have won this time it is clear we need to do something to prevent a possible third Arborea from happening. To accomplish this we have expanded the rights and protections of the Sardinian people in order to placate them, while at the same time removing any troublemakers who might act against us. These two measures should firmly put the island under our control and ensure no further revolutionary revolts happen here.
This time we will learn from our mistakes
The Consequences of a united Italy

The formation of a united Italian government poses a significant threat to the stability of our realm. Already liberal and separatist sentiments have been growing in our Italian possession and most likely continue to grow so long as this Italian government remains
It’s just one headache after another
The Italian Confederation

One of the worst fears the government of Aragon had was the formation of a united Italian government. While the creation of the Italian Confederation should spark panic it has actually produced the opposite. This government is only united in name and is otherwise fractured and weak. This dysfunctional government has only helped to reduce support of a united Italy in our lands. While the Confederation could become a threat later on, it is currently a useful tool in keeping our Italian holdings in their place.
We have nothing to fear from this weak government.
People doubt our legitimacy.

With our fall from great power status, and other nations superseding us, our people are starting to doubt whether or not Aragon can survive to the end of the century. Already Italian nationalists have returned with a newfound energy and are causing trouble in our Italian lands
Everybody’s a critic.
Order restored in the Southern Italians crowns

The Southern Italian revolt that threatened to throw us out of Italy has been defeated. The revolutionaries and their allies have either fled or have been arrested. Our victory has reassured many in our country and brought more support to the government of Aragon.
We are here to stay.
The Borgist revolt defeated

The revolt by Borgist legtimatists to try and hand our Italian lands to the former queen, Maria, has been defeated. Once again the rightful rule of King Josep has been reasserted and not only that but the threat of Italian nationalists seems to have been weakened as well.
How many times do we have to tell you that Josep is the King?
The opening of the Valencian Conference

”My subjects, our long national nightmare is over. We must now begin a sincere and steadfast co-operation in promoting such a reconstruction of our political system as would provide for the permanent stability and happiness for all of Aragon” King Josep I \n\n An extraordinary session of the Valencian Cortes was called today by the King. The King, in his speech, announced that over the next seven days the future of the Aragon political system will be decided here. There are many factions at play here from all over the crowns, the Panlatinists, the liberals, the conservatives, and even some closet separatists will be partaking in the debate. Our recent actions, as well as the various outside political factors, have all been leading to this moment and now it is out of our hands. Soon we will know if Aragon will endure.
The suspense is killing me
Status quo, Aragon will endure

After a week of debate it has been decided that Aragon will continue under its current system with a few minor reforms. The main reason for this conclusion comes from how well we have handled each crisis that has come our way proving that this system is strong enough to survive internal strife. While this outcome has disappointed many who hoped for the creation of a new political-scape, Aragon for now will continue to survive as it has been for the last couple of generations.
Sempre endavant mai morirem
Panlantinism wins out at the conference

After a week of heated debate it has been decided that Aragon will embrace the ideas of the Panlatinist movement. The reason for this decision comes from how while the Aragon Crown has withstood the crises thrown at it, it has become apparent that it will most likely not survive more crises under its current system. The prevalence of the Panlatinist movement quickly found support in the conference as the best alternative to the current political landscape. While this is a triumph for the Panlatinists, the unenviable task of applying it must be carried out by us. Aragon may have avoid collapse for now, but can we guarantee Panlatinism will save it?
Audentes fortuna iuvat.
The conference collapses

The Valencian Conference has failed to come to a conclusion on how to save Aragon. The members of the conference clearly see that Aragon has not done well handling the crises thrown at it, but they are split on what should be done to remedy this instability. The nobles still want to continue the old system with some minor reforms, the Panlatinists want a more centralized government, and the liberals want more freedoms to go along with it. Unfortunately, what's done is done and the future of Aragon looks bleak. Already reports are coming in from all over the Crowns about secessionist movements which at this point seem all but a certainty.
Comença el malson
The Kingdom of Naples secedes

To our shock the Parliament of Naples has decided to secede from the Crown of Aragon and elect another king in place of Josep.The new king is none other than Josep’s brother, Alfons who, while not being a legitimate bastard of Joan IV, has endeared himself to the Neapolitan nobles. While we would like to restore our rule through military force, it would just just throw the Crown into complete chaos. All we can do is let Naples go and do our best to try and keep our realm together.
How can we recover from this
La Divisione

The secession of Naples was only the beginning of our problems. People in our Italian holdings have named the loss of Naples as “La Divisione”, the division. Many in our territories now seem interested in carrying out their own division in their lands. Our government is paralyzed trying to fight these sentiments and an emergency draft has been called to try and restore order. Naturally such chaos is encouraging many people to flee the country and is only serving to weaken us further. There is no telling how this will end, but it is clear that it is only going to get worse.
Dark days are upon us.
Sicily and Sardinia leave Aragon

Inspired by the Cortes of Naples, the Cortes of both Sicily and Sardinia announced that they would be seceding from the Aragonese Crown and electing their own kings just as Naples did. The on-going crisis, which is now formally called La Divisió—the Catalan form of La Divisione-–prevents us from committing resources to bring them back into the fold. If we survive this we can work on trying to bring them back, but for now let us just focus on our African and Iberian holdings.
Et tu, el meu amic?
Africa revolts!

Sensing blood in the water the Berber tribes of Africa have once again risen up in revolt against our rule. While we are barely staying afloat, we must respond to this revolt and, just like all the other Berber revolts, we must put it down.
How many times do we have to keep teaching you this lesson?
Catalonian nationalists organize

Out of all our holdings our lands in Iberia have always been the most loyal and stable. However, La Divisió has changed all of that and now Catalonian nationalists have gathered in Barcelona to organize their own revolt against the Crown. They see the idea of Aragon and the monarchy as a whole as a failure and instead want to establish a wholly Catalonian nation Republic after a brief dictatorship. Time is slowly ticking down and it appears that complete civil war is on the horizon.
When it rains it pours.
La Divisió últim

It seems La Divisió has finally reached a crescendo. The Catalonian nationalists have risen up in the east and they seek to overthrow us. They seek to end Aragon and replace it with their Catalonian nation. The only way Aragon can survive is by completely defeating Catalonia, a white peace would only secure their independence. To make matters worse Navarra has revoked their oath of loyalty to the Crown and are now completely independent. And to top it all off the Cortes of Zaragoza in the province of Aragon, our namesake, are offering the title of King of Aragon to the King of Navarra. With what limited diplomatic capability we have left we have been able to convince Navarra’s potential friends to try and dissuade Navarra from taking that title. However, should Navarra take the province of Aragon we will have to fight them as well.
When will it ever end.
Zaragoza proclaims us their king.

After we declared our independence from Aragon we thought that we would only longer have to deal with them. However, the Cortes of Zaragoza have proclaimed the Bourbons of Navarra as king of Aragon, that is the province of Aragon not of the Crown of Aragon. This represents a great opportunity for us as adding the province of Aragon will more than double the size of our kingdom. However, the other great powers of Europe have come together to inform us that while they won’t stop us from taking the title they will also not support us. The Aragonese Crown has made it clear that taking the province of Aragon will start a war between us, and the Aragonese Crown promises that they will not stop until all of Navarra is under Aragonese control. How should we respond to the Cortes of Zaragoza’s offer?
