The lack of action and the preservation of the status quo by the Imperial Grand Cortes on the division of Catalan speaking Crowns has led to a surge of Llemosi nationalists. They claim that Catalan speakers from both Valencia and Barcelona are one people, oppressed by the “Italian” Empire of Rome that has betrayed its own Catalan roots and foundations, intensified with the proclamation of the Latin Empire as a whole. The conservatives and reactionaries in the Cortes have been proposing that a plebiscite is in order to decide what would be the fate of the Catalans - as a gesture of “kindness” to the unity of the Catalan peoples. The Panlatin liberals however, have shunned this, emphasizing that the Catalan language is a unique character of our plurinational state and must be preserved at all costs.
§RCatalan is just a language, not a people!§
§WWe will hold a plebiscite to appease them§
The Iberian Malaise

It was at dawn when Martí, a hardy man, set off to his place of work in the slum packed streets of Barcelona. Upon arriving, he was startled by the blood-curdling screams of his boss at the furniture workshop of C.A. Montajo, complaining to his contractor on the recent rise in prices of quality pine wood from Savoie & the difficulty of acquiring machinery from Paris due to the unfavorable tariff laws and the trade war taking a toll on Catalan businesses. Martí and his company were soon surprised to hear the unfortunate announcement of lay-offs from his Neapolitan foreman due to “bad news”. Going home, he is both unsure whether or not to tell her beloved Andrea with his five offspring about this and consider a new place of work. It appears that the Iberian Malaise has begun..
Will it be that “tragic” though?
The Catalan Renaixença

It was at dawn when Martí, a hardy man, set off to his place of work in the slum packed streets of Barcelona. Upon arriving, he was startled to the joyous screams of his boss at the furniture workshop of C.A. Montajo, welcoming the news of all-high profit margins and sales in his company. Surprisingly, the Neapolitan foreman announced a salary increase. Going home with a smile on his face, he is both grateful and perhaps even lucky that he would continue to provide as much to his dear Andrea and their five children. Martí’s eldest son has gained a deep interest in Catalan literature in his language class, becoming deeply invested in Garcia’s and Fontanella’s works and anecdotes at school. At their household, Andrea warmly waits for Martí’s arrival to bug him in sparing at least a couple of denario to get the newest novel by that “amateurish fool” from Guinardó taken out of state censors. It appears that the Catalan Renaixença has begun, due to efforts in deregulating Catalan industry and promoting the arts.
What a touching story.
The Catalan Miracle

Martí is pleased at his job. His boss just keeps showering him with praise and generosity thanks to his hard working character, and his prospects of beating that pesky Neapolitan foreman at his game seems near due to a possibility of a promotion anytime soon. After all, he’s not pleased with the money nor the wealth his job brings. To him - his kids, and his dear Andrea, at the kitchen joyfully whipping up a full three course meal in years, are the only ones that make him glad, as he believes that sooner or later things are going to get better, for the best. The Catalan Miracle has begun, providing immense economic growth and prosperity to all of Catalonia, perhaps even the Empire.
The taxman will bring Martí to tears anytime soon…
A Sudden Twist?

Approximately a month after the dreary trade war took place, both the Catalonian and Valencian Cortes are always at their throats - arguing every minutiae of law or piece of legislation they could throw at to leverage their aims or even goals to get the other side to fold. Despite this childish game of tit-for-tat among the lawmakers, the fighting seems to have subsided and things are slowly going back as they were before. It seems that they have understood the monarch’s providence over State affairs despite childish meddling…
They should know their place.
Approaching the Papal Question

We have decided to try and reach out to the Pope with the hopes of beginning a series of negotiations that will put an end to the Papal Question peacefully. We believe that there are three main issues that the Church could bring up during negotiations. The issue of Papal independence, the repayment of confiscated Church property, and the quality of education in our empire. We hope that the Pope will also be interested in solving these issues and agree to negotiate in whatever way he feels would facilitate a lasting peace.
”Holy father, we’ve come to bargain.”
The Pope agrees to negotiations

We have reached out to the Pope and after some back and forth we have settled on how the negotiations are to proceed. Negotiations will take place in the Lateran Palace, the former residence of the Pope and while the Pope will not be there in person, a delegation will be present to present his demands and to negotiate with us. The Pope has made it clear that these negotiations are not a formality and we will have to make concessions if we expect him to sign the final agreement. Regardless we will begin setting up everything in the Lateran Palace and hope that we can resolve the Papal Question in a manner that is satisfactory to everyone.
Let’s begin the Lateran Negotiations.
The Problem of the Papal Question

Our adherence to Panlatinist ideals have brought us into constant conflict with the Pope. As a result the Pope likes to pretend that we don’t exist and Church officials constantly seem to be working against us. We need to end this state of affairs one way or the other and since we are good Christains we will reach out and try to negotiate with Papal officials. We have found a sympathetic legate and will ask him to present the Pope with our offer of starting negotiations between him and us. We believe that there are three main issues that the Church could bring up during negotiations. The issue of Papal independence, the repayment of confiscated Church property, and the quality of education in our empire. There is no guarantee that these negotiations will take place and if they should fail we will have to resort to other ways to curtail the power of the Church which may only cause more problems for us.
Reach out to the legate and present our offer.
Meeting the Legate

We have reached out to the Papal legate and after some back and forth we have settled on how the negotiations are to proceed. Negotiations will take place in the Lateran Palace, the former residence of the Pope and while the Pope will not be there in person, a delegation will be present to present his demands and to negotiate with us. The final treaty will then be presented to the Pope and if he finds it adequate we will sign it. While the legate has found these conditions to be satisfactory he admitted that there is no guarantee that the Pope himself will agree to start negotiations. Regardless we will begin setting up everything in the Lateran Palace and hope that we can resolve the Papal Question in a manner that is acceptable to everyone.
We will await in the Lateran Palace, we hope the Pope sees reason
The Issue of Papal Autonomy

The Lateran Negotiations have begun and the first and most pressing issue is the matter of Papal Autonomy. The Papal delegate recognizes that the Papal States will not be returned in full and has instead asked that the Vatican Hill in Rome and the Palais dei Papas in Avignon be given fully under control of the Pope. While the Papacy being in Rome makes sense, the Papal claim in Avignon is more tenuous as Papal influence has been in steep decline in that region and it is commonly accepted that there is no reason for the Pope to be there. Not only that but accommodating these demands will most likely reduce the productivity of these cities by half. We could accept the Papal delegates' demand, or we could push for a compromise and only give them the Vatican while granting them some control over some of the historic churches in Rome along with some more concessions down the line. We could also flat out reject the demand that the Pope should have any independence, however this will most likely doom these negotiations, but it is still an option we could pursue.
The Pope will get Avignon and Vatican
The Pope will have Vatican and some privileges like the Lateran cathedral
The Pope must abandon ideas of sovereignty
Restitution to the Church?

The Church has brought forth another demand during the negotiations at Lateran. They demand restitution for the seizure of Papal land that occurred during the creation of our Empire. The cost they demand is frankly insane and there is no way we can be expected to pay it. However, in order to try and satiate the Papal delegate a compromise plan has been formed. The Catholic Church will receive an annual stipend of money from the Empire. This stipend will come from a special tax on the people at a rate of 0.8 percent of their annual income. While this tax will negatively affect our own income and the living standards of our people it is the best worst idea we have to try and meet the Church halfway. Should we propose our compromise to the delegates?
Eight per thousand tax is best we can propose
The Church is rich enough.
The Matter of Education

With the Lateran Negotiations wrapping up the Papal delegates have finally brought forth the final expected issue. The Church feels that the education system of our empire is promoting heretical beliefs and is turning people away from God’s light. To this end the delegates have demanded that we reform our education system and mandate Catholic lessons into our curriculum. This includes bringing priests into schools to teach classes, mandatory Bible reading, and the suppression of any topics the Church finds disagreeable. Effectively, this would turn all our schools into Catholic schools. Some members of our government feel that this is a ploy to indoctrinate our youth and, while it will most likely help with literacy in our lands, it is very possible that it will damage our research capabilities. Unfortunately, we don’t have time to debate on this topic and the success of the negotiations may rest on this decision. We must either accept this demand in full or reject it outright.
Accept, at least our people will be able to read better
The Church has no business controlling our school system
The Lateran Treaty

After many hours of debates and compromises we have finally reached an agreement with the Pope. The Catholic Church will recognize the legitimacy of our government, in return we will follow the stipulations decided during our negoatations. The Lateran treaty has already been signed by both parties and with this the Papal Question has finally been put to rest.
A great day for Catholics everywhere.
The Negotiations Fail

Negotiations between us and the Papal delegates have been tense for a while as the Papal side has made it clear that they feel like we have not been willing to compromise with them. This finally came to a climax today as the Papal delegates walked out of the Lateran Palace declaring the negotiations a farce that only sought the submission of the Church. It appears that any chance of resolving the Papal question peacefully has been dashed and now our only option is to try and break the power of the Church by whatever means necessary.
I guess peace was never an option
The Fight Against the Church

Our attempt to reach a negotiated settlement with the Pope has failed and it seems apparent that there is no way to reconcile the Church with the State. Our only option now is to try and destroy the influence the Church holds over our people. This is going to be a long fight, but first we must consider what we can utilize with our war against the Church before we begin our campaign in full force.
Render unto Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and unto God the things that are God's
Pardon the Republicans of Etruria?

One of the defining aspects of the Etruria Revolution was its aggressive secularization policies against the Catholic Church. Now that we find ourselves against the Church it makes sense to try and copy the Etrurscean model of secularization to remove the influence of the Church on our people. We could go a step further and pardon the republicans of Etruria, who were the first to advocate secularization and bring them into our campaign. While this would greatly help our campaign the republicans have also made it clear that they do not support the Empire as it stands and may only create more problems if we were to release them. Should we gamble and give the republicans amnesty or go with our secularization policy alone?
Pardon the republicans we share a common enemy
No, the enemy of my enemy here is still our enemy
Should we Secularize the Empire?

Catholicism is the dominant religion in our empire which makes fighting the Catholic Church a herculean effort. Since Catholicism is effectively one and the same as the Church one proposal for removing the power of the Church is the secularization of the empire. This would remove all aspects of religion from our government and devastate the Church’s hold over us and our people. However, going against the Church like this will greatly anger the people, especially as we have constantly built ourselves as God’s chosen ruler of the Empire. We could just focus on limiting the power of the Church but that would take a longer time than the secularization plan. No matter what we do it will anger the Church so should we secularize the empire?
The Church and State must be separate.
The Church and the State are all but one.
The Death of Giuseppe I

Josep I as he was known in Iberia, Giuseppe I in Italia has peacefully passed on the evening following $DATE_LONG_1$. His death was both melancholic and impactful on the daily lives of Imperial citizens, especially as he had worked on his last days to resolve the issue of the nature of his Empire. The Grand Cortes and the Consell-General at the wake of his death had immediately passed a resolution granting him the unspoken title of “The Magnanimous”, in light of his unwavering love of the Latins and his “unmatched” contributions to the betterment of the Empire. Despite continuing to be the ruler of a new, vast family of Latins, he eventually knew that his time would come. A state funeral shall be held, and his son Balduin Cesare, shall succeed the throne of the Mediterranean’s most feared hegemon.
The Emperor is dead, Long Live the Emperor!
The Edicts of Milan

The Latin Empire has become a solid “community” of states and entities with interweaving laws and customs guaranteeing Imperial stability. Many archaic laws have been revised, in part or whole, to better fit the Empire’s current character and outlook that guarantees the rights of the Crowns and its citizens. The Edicts of Milan, coinciding with the Emperor’s coronation at Rome, were rigorously codified and signed by reformists and liberal-minded statesmen alike, despite severe backlash from traditionalists and the old nobility.\n\nMay the year of our Lord, $YEAR$, mark the dawn of boundless prosperity of the Emperor’s most noble subjects for the forthcoming years and decades to come, someday leading the march to the beat of progress with the world. May we serve true to our purpose of becoming Europa’s guardians. Long Live Emperor Cesare I!
A Federal Empire of Crowns
The Edicts of Milan

The Latin Empire has morphed into a patchwork of assorted political entities of all sizes and kinds along with their own customs and traditions. In spite of the obvious bureaucratic quagmire the Realm has become, has also guaranteed the numerous traditions and respect of its constituent entities to the Imperial Seat of Rome, passing these in turn to the promotion of industry and commerce - a new form of “mercantilism”. The edicts of Milan, coinciding with the Emperor’s coronation at Rome, is a “pact” signed by the numerous nobles, princes, bishops, statesmen, etc. swearing oaths of “eternal” fealty to the Latin Emperor..\n\nMay the year of our Lord, $YEAR$, be a testament to our Sovereign’s divine right and guidance over the countless resplendent crowns and lands of his Serene Highness. May his subjects exercise his wise and just rule to the fullest extent for the benefit of Mankind, for God’s Providence is with us. Long Live Emperor Balduin I!
As expected of an Empire with 400 types of spaghetti.
The Indomitable Power of Faith and Crown

The Latin Empire has taken on a uniquely “religious” character. With the clergy always having the final say in the affairs and matters of state, it has become remarkable for its bleeding edge bureaucracy and the rigid centralization of the empire’s provinces. In all accounts, the Empire has become one and whole with the Church. The Emperor’s Coronation by the Pope has guaranteed that this current state of affairs shall last for years, with the “unity” of the Faith and Crown being a hallmark of the Latinist ideal.\n\nMay the year of our Lord, $YEAR$, be a testament to our Sovereign’s most serene rule. Along with the Church and the Vicar Of Christ’s guidance, the Empire shall guarantee the safekeeping of the Roman and Catholic faith as its most sacred mission. May God’s grace give our wisest Sovereign the courage he needs to defend and uphold the Catholic faith with his Temporal power and the Pope’s Spiritual might. Long Live Emperor Balduin I!
Nobody expected that either!
Renovatio Imperii Romanorum

The Fates are in our favor. After two millennia of disgrace and dishonor, we have successfully woven once again what could've been ripped apart forever in the vast thread of time. After decades of strife and jostling with states that dotted the entire periphery of Italia, after struggles with the puny Aragonese nobility, we have prevailed. In the year of our Lord, $YEAR$, his Serene Highness Cesare Baldui Serna, at the behest of the Latin Empire’s many princes and fiefdoms, was bestowed upon the title of Imperator of not just Romania, but Romanorum - an Emperor of All Romans.n\nMay the world tremble and gaze at the resurgent and ever-glorious Roman Empire that made Civilization as we know it. And may this glorious day be one of the greatest of all mankind has ever experienced! Aeternitas shall sing our praises until the end of time, and historians will look back in awe of what seemed impossible having been brought back to life.
Salve Romana! Salve Cesare I!
$YEAR$, The Year of Disgrace

A shame. Our attempts at formulating edicts upon edicts, laws upon laws and countless concessions given to our vassalages and subjects, a couple misguided and blind fools even had the gall to outright condemn, reject and even scorn our ways. Despite all our struggles and sacrifices to uphold the spirit of a revived and civilized Roman ideal - championing the ever-formidable value of auctoritas, some just fail to see the light and at worst openly mock our attempt to restore Rome. Our spies have received reports of various insurgent cells arming volunteers and fomenting dissent among the populace - all with the aim of undermining Roman rule.\n\nWe must be prepared for the worst, for this year - and the years to come be might be the death knell for all Romans.
It can not be helped.
The Crisis of the 19th Century

Instances of massive uprisings have been reported by magistrates and informants in our empire. Imperial garrison forces have been overwhelmed by local insurgents, all wishing to be freed from the “cruel”, “deluded” and “unjust” fool  - that is, allegedly, our own Emperor. Mass reprisals, deportations and even reports of massacres of Latin citizenry and nobility are rampant. Nationalist sentiments have reached a boiling point, without any chance of fizzling out.\nThe Crisis of the 19th Century, a sign of turbulent times to come, has commenced. Despite these grueling reports, many loyalists have rallied across our empire, proclaiming their allegiances to the new Roman ideal. Fools may run and cower - to live another day, but the valiant never taste of death but once. Like in the annals of history we shall be victorious once more, like it has always been..
Ita Est.
Piano “Vittoria”

The unthinkable has happened. During the early morning of this day, rouge army battalions led by traditionalist anti-Latinist officers and nobles stormed key Imperial government sites in Rome: the Palatium Quirinalis, the Imperial Grand Cortes Building, and the War Ministry headquarters. Despite the fierce resistance of pro-Imperial forces it was all for naught, given the ample preparation and effectiveness of the rebels thanks to a vast network of informants that were present months prior. The Emperor presumptive Caesare Baldui was held under house arrest, with the arrest or death of other key state officials. Moments later, the coup leaders gathered at the podium of the Imperial Cortes proclaiming the death of the Latin Empire and with it the Panlatin ideal. Plan “Vittoria” was a success, irregardless of all odds.
Dark times are ahead.
The Proclamation of the Roman Republic

The sudden development in Rome seems to have caught the attention of foreign observers and the citizens of the former Empire. One of the coup leaders, Lt. Giulio de Caserta, belonging to the “moderate” faction, has made a quite daring move. With the support of battle-hardened veterans, defectors, and local liberal Roman volunteers, they swiftly crushed the anti-Latinists. Rome was once again saved, taking on a new face: The Roman Republic. Giulio Caserta was proclaimed Consul of Rome also taking on the title of Dictator during the duration of “civil distress” to instill order and civility in the turmoil-filled Republic.
Salve Vittoria! Salve Caserta!
The Latin Turmoil

The issues and efforts concerning our governance of the Empire’s countless crowns and holdings appear to have borne fruit. Our internal policies and governance prior to this date may have been successful to some degree in wresting effective control over our countless Latin holdings and crowns, but as the threat of unrest is unavoidable, we must be ready at the immediate sight of dissent in our lands, come what may. By the passing day and the succession of unfortunate events, Roman flame dims ever further…
Post tenebras spero lucem
The Lombard Secession

Enraged at the actions unfolding in Rome and coupled with the unpopular sentiment surrounding Roman role, The Lombard territories have unanimously seceded from the Latin crown following a resounding 260-0 vote by the Cortes of Lombardy. Roman forces in the area have either defected to the Lombards or reported to have fled to friendly Imperial territory. Accounts of barbarism against Roman sympathizers are not uncommon despite “official” orders from Milan not to harm Roman citizens. With anti-Imperial sentiment in our Italian holdings running ever intensely high, it is of certain possibility that the sons of the Messiogiorno and Corsica are soon to follow their Lombard brethren-in-arms.
We must deal with this swiftly and at once!
The Neapolitan Betrayal

Napoli's relationships with the Aragonese Crown and recently, Rome have ebbed and flowed over the centuries. In spite of often amicable relationships, conflicts involving Napoli have impeded their overlord’s capabilities to manage their crowns well. Currently, our relationship with Napoli has ebbed: rippling effects of land reform have taken a toll on the nobility, adversely affecting their relationship with the once-Latin Emperor. The majority reactionary Napolitan Cortes has unilaterally seceded from Rome with their accursed Italian brethren in Lombardy. Rumor has it that due to an “compromise” between the Lombard rebels and the Neapolitan scum, a royal of Gonzagist lineage was selected as the new titular ruler of the Lombard and “Italian” kingdom. War with the Neapolitans seems inevitable, and a highly motivated Neapolitan army on the gates of Rome seems eager to have a taste of its spoils in the coming conflict
Still banding together eh? Maybe they’re the real cowards!.
The “Cuor di Leone” of Corsica

In a shocking turn of events, General Tiroligero the “Cuor di Leone”of Corsega has brought us the saddest of news: Despite all his efforts in subduing the Brigandagios and revolutionary sentiment in the island, the Year of Disgrace seems to have rendered this task nigh impossible due to a renewed and relentless rebel offensive that led to the capture of Ajaccio just recently. Instead of planting his feet firmly on the ground, fighting to the last man like a real Roman, he turned tail and fled on an Army sloop bound for Roma.
A shameful display!
The Neapolitan Secession

Napoli's relationships with the Aragonese Crown and recently, Rome have ebbed and flowed over the centuries. In spite of often amicable relationships, conflicts involving Napoli have impeded their overlord’s capabilities in managing their lands and fulfilling their ambitions. Currently, our relationship with Napoli has ebbed: rippling effects of land reform have taken a toll on the nobility, adversely affecting their relationship with the once-Latin Emperor. The majority reactionary Napolitan Cortes has unilaterally seceded from Rome, with a temporary Regent in place to allow an open discussion to whom shall take the title of King. War with the Neapolitans seems inevitable, and a highly motivated Neapolitan army on the gates of Rome seems eager to have a taste of its spoils in the coming conflict.
Hopefully we shall make amends… on the battlefield.
The Corsican Secession

The landed clans of Corsica have broken off from Rome. Their steadfast adherence to tradition, despite being a huge slump to island’s continuous development and progress, has actually proven beneficial as a whole, managing to stem the tide of Italian nationalism due to the often “effective” relief programs brought by the landed nobility that promoted the idea of “work for bread” to the locals. Despite these good news the nobility, wishing not the bear the economic impact of the Crisis the Corsicans have seceded from our authority for the meantime whilst maintaining its neutrality in the unraveling conflict .
As it should be.
The Hydra Resurfaces Once More

For the third time, the Etrurian revolutionary old guard have gathered at the city Florence to discuss their plans to seize the opportunity of reigniting the old flame of 1808 and the Revolutions of the 40s.Their plans have apparently been sped up due to the immediate and unfortunate succession of events at Rome and the Roman government being virtually incapacitated to swiftly purge any dissent on its soil.\n\nThe Revolutionary Hydra has re-emerged from the abyss, poising to bring the intoxicating idea of Italian revolutionary nationalism to our lands once more.
Perhaps the third time shall be their last.
The Secession of the African Holdings

Our African holdings on the Mediterranean coast have been affected tremendously by the abrupt disruption of Roman rule. With the Peu-Vermells worrying over the potential loss of their fledgling enterprises and the gradual entrenchment of the Peu-Vermell identity, the local government has seceded from Rome to “save face” while keeping themselves within Rome’s graces by refusing to take a side in any potential internal conflict within the Empire.
We shall expect their loyalty once we emerge from this mess
La Despedida

When the cat is gone, the rats dance. - Catalan proverb\n\nThe most troubling news has reached the shores of the Eternal City. The Catalan Cortes at Barcelona, with the support of a certain ambitious and popular army corporal named Rodier Ascaso, has gained a large gathering of disgruntled city and country folk which were badly hit by the side effects of the Tariff Wars. The economic situation in our Catalan holdings, compounded with Rome’s various troubles in restoring order to its lands ennobled the reemergence of a Catalonian identity  if not dealt with with haste can lead to our immediate loss of our Iberian holdings that we held so dearly from our descendants.
What of them?
The Bello Civili of $YEAR$

The air of vengeance draws nigh. Civilizations have fallen not to massive invasions nor conquest, but from the internal meddling of its subjects. As such, Ancient Rome’s pluricultural character, while having its merits, was one of its major faults. Combined with severe economic and internal repercussions, said dilemma is a recipe for rebellions and other conflicts in the once mighty ancient power. Mirroring the tragedies of old, it appears that the same fate has befallen upon the revived Roman state, much very less subject to a magnitude of these calamitous events.\n\nShall the reborn Rome stand united against the bands of traitors upon traitors and barbaric “nationalists''- emerging as the heralds welcoming the dawn of a new Roman era? Or shall history prove as our best teacher once again - a result of our reckless ambitions coming historians will scrutinize and lament in their texts? The battle lines are drawn. the Legions march again, ranks formed, unfurling their standards and firmly gripping their rifles with Elysium’s oath: the Bello Civili has begun.
Alea iacta est
The Roman Menace

The time of action is upon us. Our deluded enemies have drawn their swords and await us in the fields of battle. There is no “Roman” civilization - a fallen and dead idea incompatible with the current times. With other nations finally free from the “Roman” yoke, open conflict is inevitable. Foolishingly enough, may this be a lesson to those who play a deranged game of make-pretend without taking reality and rationality to account.
We shall feast upon Roma’s corpse.
Damnatio Romanum

The Fates have abandoned us. Rome’s sons have struggled against all odds, fighting tooth and nail, filled with tales and feats of heroism that will be sung by generations to come. In spite of all these valiant efforts, it was all for naught. The Eternal City was now a former husk of itself: a lifeless and decrepit corpse. Rome’s maidens wail in the loss of their sweethearts, spouse and offspring alike, forgotten in the fields of Latium for eternity. Violent and bloody reprisals against Roman citizenry en masse have spared no one in spite of pleas of mercy from the International Concert.\n\nCybele wept and wailed endlessly for the carnage her children have been subjected to, while the departed long for Venus’ embrace. With the Roman government virtually shattered by the continuous onslaught and rendered nonexistent, the Roman idea is effectively dead.
Mors Vincit Omnia
The Roman Triumph

An atmosphere of awe dominates the mood of the vast crowds gathered at Rome. The victorious outcome of the Civil War has defied even the expectations of foreign observers. Foreign officials all over the world and commoners have gathered at Rome for this momentous occasion. The Triumphalis Romani is one of the most elaborate and extravagant processions held in the history of mankind. A three hour military parade followed by an elaborate procession showcasing the beauty of the Latin Peoples and achievements, ending with the conferral of titles of Augustus and “Restitutor Orbis” to our beloved ruler.\n\nThe magnanimous Romans have reclaimed their place as the rightful heirs of Romulus’ legacy. May this victory be a testament to the tenacity of all Romans, unflinching at the sight of adversity
Gloria Romae!
The Revival of the Lega Lombarda

The Liga Lombarda, or the Lombard League was an historical pact of Northern Italian states formed in 1167, opposing the encroachment of the Holy Roman Empire into the Italian peninsula. Ever rising tensions with the Lombards, combined with the wave of nationalist Romanticism among the Lombards stirred the feelings of animosity of Latin expansionism and clerical hatred made an old idea anew. One by one the Lombard territories have seceded from Rome’s grasp culminating in a joint declaration by Lombard secessionists in Milan establishing a confederal “Lega” of Lombard states. With reports of mass expulsions and violent clashes between Latin citizens, it seems that our hold on the North has slipped away. The faithful must be ready, as Satan’s spawn has come down on the lands beyond the Po.
There shall be gnawing and gnashing of teeth.
Damnatio Romanum

The faithful soldiers of God, filled with never-ending courage and vigor in their struggle for the Roman ideal and the Catholic faith, lie vanquished despite their efforts. Rome lies in ruins: a husk of its former self, with the ever-sacred grounds of the Holy See left not unspared. The faithful are united in sorrow and outrage over the news of “anticlerical terror” perpetrated by radicals and anticlericals alike, resulting in the death of countless innocent faithful and Catholic clergy, along with the plunder and desecration of many Christian artifacts. .\n\nThe Pope has called upon the intercession of the Virgin Mary for the fallen, while the departed long for prayers to spare them from purgatory and the horrors of hell. On the bright side, The Holy See has been given immunity thanks to foreign intercession, but the Pope nonetheless is in chains once more, reduced to a mere prisoner of his vanquishers. With the Latin government virtually shattered by the continuous onslaught and rendered nonexistent, an idea of a Catholic Latin state is effectively dead. It appears God has abandoned us.
Blessed are the mournful, for they shall be comforted
The Catholic Triumph

Here ye, all you faithful, for our dear Sovereign has preserved our Lord’s sovereignty over the Earth’s nations. The choirs of angels on high exalt their praises for our victory over Satan itself - the wretched Lombard horde sent by Lucifer to ravage His lands and evict the children of God from whom have toiled endlessly these lands as stewards of his Creation. Our warriors have proven their mettle, going stronger day by day against all adversity - until the enemy is crushed, and to this we shall bask in glory for centuries to come.\n\nWe extol praises to you, O Lord, for this day we have restored civilization to the world. As King of all Nations we are eternally grateful for this most blessed day that marked the dawn of a new Catholic Empire thanks to the efforts of the Vicar of Rome's spiritual guidance and the Emperor's formidable temporal power exercising Your will. We stand triumphant and ready to serve you until the ends of the Earth, for God has willed it!
Gloria Excelsis Deo.
The Estranged Cousin

Occitania has always had deep ethnolingustic and cultural ties with the peoples of our Empire, yet centuries of foreign rulers, bloodshed and hersey has drove the Occitanan’s apart from the faithful.\n\nWith the lands of southern France now within the Empire’s control, maybe it is time to crusade against the injustice which has drove our people’s apart. We could ‘convince’ the Protestant majority to revert back to the true faith by clamping down on the heretical churches and their preaching ceremonies
column3: which will strangle the main form of political power these heretical priest’s have. This may ruffle a few feather’s amongst the masses but if implemented, they shall know where the true faith resides: under Rome and under our protection.

column2: Occitania has already known a Crusade, why not another?
A crusade? What’s this, the 1000s?.
A Plea from the Archbishop of Aix
We have received a telegram from the Archbishop of Aix earlier today, a catholic and a mediator in the Occitan community
column3: he has sent a warning to the local Imperial government that any further provocation of the Protestants will lead to violence. The Archbishop has further called for that the local Occitan Protestants be allowed to practice their Christain faith in peace, as cited in the bible to love thy neighbor or there will be violence.\n\nWe have the chance to grant these heretics a special status in the Empire, which will be seen as a victory for heretics across the Empire in favour for peace or to carry on with the rightful Catholicization of the Occitans.

column2: Clamp down on these heretics.
Grant them autonomy to exercise their faith.
Occitan Protestant Agitation

Cities in the Midi have broken out into riots and general disorder. Cities such as Toulouse (and many others) broke into protest and strike action against our crusade against the Protestant church within Occitan. Although troops and local police have been able to contain these strikes and general Occitan backlashes, the agitation seems to have spread amongst the whole populace.\n\nWine bars in Occitan have seen the removal and burning  of the portrait of the Emperor. Graffiti now lines the walls across Occitan, calling for revolution
column3: inspired by the great German revolutions to liberate Occitan and even strike against Rome, the Emperor and the Papacy itself. Such agitation has been countered with arrests against ringleaders, additional catholic sermons and parades celebrating the unity of the Empire. However, no amount of imperial propaganda and catholic preaching will hide the cracks beginning to form in Occitan .

column2: Give it time… They’ll learn eventually.
The Desert

Despite our clamp down on the heretic clergy and even the banishment of the openly critical pastors, the Occitan show no sign of abandoning their faith in mass. In secret, they gather in the open countryside, in “Desert assemblies” for they have begun to compare their persecution to the Exodus and the travel of Moses throughout the Desert. There, prophets speak to the assembly of the need for resistance. A certain Daniel Mazel has thus said to have received a vision from God to cast away “the fat black bulls who feed upon the cabbages of the holy garden”, and a day later, a Jesuit priest from a neighboring village was nearly lynched to death.
”Nearer my God to thee, Nearer to thee…”
The Liga de la Jove Republica

Reports from the chiefs of the Imperial police in Occitan have highlighted a new political and revolutionary party in Occitan. This new Protestant socialist party has become a rallying point for the agitator’s, revolutionaries and Protestants within Occitan who oppose our rule. The name of this party is the ‘Liga de la jove Republica’- the league of the Young Republic.\n\nThe League has called for the removal of Imperial rule from Occitan
column3: the abolishment of Catholic supremacy over Occitania and most frighteningly of all, a secular socialist republic to be formed within Occitan. Already flocks of socialist’s have seeped from abroad,  into Occitan to help the league fight against the ‘Catholic Jackboot’. The local authorities have also highlighted that no matter the amount of arrests and crackdowns, the League seems to bounce back ever stronger thanks to local populist donations and support from the middle class.

column2: Formation of the Liga de la jove Republica
The Occitan Federation of Communes

The Occitanian ‘League of the Young Republic’ has declared earlier today, that the shackles of Imperial rule shall be cast off and a new socialist republic based on a federation of local Communes shall be the sole legal and federal authority in Occitan. The declaration was made in front of a Young Republic mob, which stormed the Cathedral in Marseille and lynched the govenor of Marseille within its holy walls. Luckily the Archbishop was able to flee, but scenes of violence against imperial governance alongside desecration of Catholic grounds have happened across the whole of Occitania.\n\nIn Tolon, local garrisons of Occitan descent have turned against Imperial troops, helping mobs to storm arsenals and stockpiles designated for our troops. These mobs have thus created the first units of a ‘revolutionary guard’ which during the day have multiplied across Occitan, fighting the ragtag units of local police and garrisons still loyal to the Emperor and the faith. A full scale revolutionary war has emerged, one which can shake the foundations of the Empire apart..
Holdfast in the name of God and Order!
His Holiness’ Demands

We have received a telegram from Vatican City demanding we prevent the ascension of a socialist government. The pope fears that this new government will encourage atheist and anti-christian organizations around the country, which he considers a betrayal of the faithful.
A relief for the messenger of God
Rerum Novarum

The Pope has recently issued a new Papal Bull called Rerum Novarum or The Rights and Duties of Capital and Labor. While it rejects Socialism and encourages workers to refrain from violence and disobedience the Bull still advocates for the formation of trade unions and for the introduction of collective bargaining. Not only that but the Bull goes further and says employers should ensure their workers health, safety, and the right to a living wage. The Bull does speak out against collective ownership saying that it is the natural right of man. In the end this Papal Bull has rewakened the need for moralism within capitalism within our people, however for others they see this Bull as a call for further Socialist action and already they have begun organizing.
I’m getting some mixed signals here.
The Latin Spring

Our attempts to create a united empire of the Aragonese and Italian peoples have failed, the instability caused by the many revolutions and our overly ambitious attempts to centralize the country has led to a disastrous revolution, one too big to put out, leaving us nothing else to do but sit and watch as our dreams of an empire vanish before our eyes, like ashes upon the wind.
§RFINITA EST§!
The Imperial Remnant - Catalonia
We have lost control over Italy, the dream of a united Aragon and Italy is over, it is time we accept our fate and move forward, as we return to our roots and proclaim the nation of Catalonia.
§RFINITA EST§!
The Imperial Remnant - Italy.
We have lost control over Catalonia, the dream of a united Aragon and Italy is over, we should accept reality as it is, that we can no longer call ourselves Aragonese, but are now Italian.
§RFINITA EST§!.
The Counterpapal Decree

With the success of the Republic we have decided to sideline the Pope and remove the undo Catholic influence over the our politics. With this we will no longer be bound to the church and can now seek an accord with all the religions in our lands without one dominating all of them.
Finally we are free.
Revocation of the Lateran Treaty

With the success of the Socialist Revolution we have decided to revoke the Latern Treaty that was created between the old Royalist government and the Papal authorities. We have made it clear to the Pope that we are no longer beholden to the terms of the treaty and will henceforth conduct our business independent of the church.
And may His Holiness not haunt us forever.
Restore the Lateran Treaty

The Revolution has been defeated, and we should seek rapprochement with the Cathloic Church. We have announced that we shall restore the Lateran Treaty and abide by the terms within it. While it won’t make up for the suffering the church as endured we hope that they will see we are working in good faith.
As it should be.
Papal autonomy granted in Rome
With Rome under our control, we must adhere to The Lateran Treaty and grant the Pope autonomy on the Vatican Hill within Rome.
We abide by the Holiness’ wishes.
Papal autonomy granted in Avignon
With Avignon under our control, we must adhere to The Lateran Treaty and grant the Pope autonomy within the Palais dei Papas.
We abide by the Holiness’ wishes.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ claims the protection of pilgrims in Jerusalem
$FROMCOUNTRY$ diplomats have demanded we give them a special status in the Holy Land.
Big talk for someone far away.
The Jerusalem Riots

Jerusalem is mostly a tranquil place, with the Jews, Western Christians, Armenians and Muslims living at peace with each other. But yesterday, an incident between an Italian pilgrim, a priest called Giulio and a Muslim mufti escalated into a full blown massacre after a Muslim was killed by a pilgrim wielding a gun. The killer escaped to a nearby Church, claiming he only drew his weapon for protection and after the refusal of the priest to give him to the authorities, a week of troubles erupted throughout the city that spared no communities, with even the local Jews caught in the middle of the riots. The local authorities have counted for at least 75 dead but it has created resentment abroad, notably among the Christian powers of Europe..
Can't we all just get along?
The Jerusalem Massacres

”'The Christian inhabitants were put to the sword under circumstances of unparalleled barbarity, the assailants being Muslims under the command of the local commander Ismail-al-Atrash. The aged father Carlo, from the Franciscan order was brutally murdered after refusing to give information about the blessed father Julio, who the Mohammedans claim was responsible for the violence. The only worthy course for the government of $COUNTRY$ should be an intervention to cause the rights of justice and humanity to triumph.” - The Valencian Herald\n\nViolence in Jerusalem has erupted last month, although reports are contradictory about who was the cause of the riot that led to nearly a week of troubles in the Holy City. This gives us the perfect excuse to demand for a special province to be created in Palestine, with special rights for our agents to avoid such a thing to happen again..
Yes a Palestine Mutasarrifate is the solution
We don’t need to
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Demands Autonomous Palestine.

Following the troubles in Jerusalem, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has demanded we establish a special Mutasarrifate in Palestine. While the province will still formally remain under our ownership, $FROMCOUNTRY$ also demands that a special representative from their country be put into a position of power in order to protect the Christian people in those lands. This would give $FROMCOUNTRY$ great influence in the running of the Mutasarrifate and it could even lead to them completely detaching Palestine from us. $FROMCOUNTRY$ has made it clear that if we do not agree to these demands then military intervention will most likely follow.
We will create this Mutasarrifate
Let them come!
The Establishment of the Mutasarrifate

”Art. I. Palestine will be administered by a special governor, named directly by the sultan. This civil servant will be invested with all executive power and will seek to maintain order and public safety in the whole of the Palestine Mutasarrifate. He will preside the local Medjlis which will be composed of 6 Muslim, 1 Maronite, 2 Catholics, 1 Greek Orthodox, 1 Armenian, 1 Jew members alongside the representative of $COUNTRY$, who will represent the rights of the Christian pilgrims in Palestine. This Medjlis will….” -Protocol of Jerusalem\n\nThe Mutasarrifate has been created at our behest and with our special representative we have ensured that it is currently under our influence. We are already making contacts with local groups and laying the groundwork for further integration of the Mutasarrifate with our country.
For a better world than has ever been seen.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has annexed Palestine.

In flagrant violation of the Protocol of Jerusalem $FROMCOUNTRY$ has taken control of the Mutasarrifate of Palestine with the help of local Christains. They claim that this move is the result of discrimation towards Christain pilgrims and that under their rule they will ensure that all pilgrims will be treated equally. By all rights we should move against them and recover the province of Palestine, however reports from $FROMCOUNTRY$ have stated that their country is stronger than ever following their conference at Valencia. Are we ready to take on one of the major powers of the Western Mediterranean right now?
We must accept this situation
Mobilize and call our allies!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Moves to retake Palestine

Despite our thorough seizure of Palestine, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has attacked us and are attempting to regain control of the province. While this is not the outcome we wanted, we have to fight back in order to keep control over Palestine. Victory here could lead to us gaining even more in the region while defeat would only make us a laughingstock.
Let this be our last crusade.
The treaty of $CAPITAL$

We have lost the war against the Catholics and we are forced to adhere to the terms that they have laid out. We are to lose our territories in the Levant and allow them to also have protection over Christian minorities in our lands. This is a dark day for the $COUNTRYADJ$ people, but we shall weather this storm as we did before.
Our hearts go out to our brothers in Jerusalem.
The treaty of $CAPITAL$

We have lost the war against the Catholics and we are forced to adhere to the terms that they have laid out. We are to lease the port of Alexandria to them in perpetuity and install their agents in key positions of our government. This has effectively made us nothing more than a protectorate and once again we are in chains to another power.
One day we will be truly free
The Protectorate of Egypt

After our successful war against Egypt we are able to enforce our demands upon them. They are to lease the port of Alexandria to us in perpetuity and install our agents in key positions of their government. With this we have made Egypt our protectorate and with it we have now firmly established ourselves in the Eastern Mediterranean.
A triumph worthy for the faithful!
The $MONARCHTITLE$ visits Jerusalem

Our $MONARCHTITLE$ visited the recently secured lands of Jerusalem as part of a sightseeing tour. However, this tour soon became a pilgrimage for the $MONARCHTITLE$. Upon reaching the city he entered by foot and followed a route traveled by many pilgrims. He then visited the Church of the Holy Sepulchre where after our $MONARCHTITLE$ kissed the cross offered by the auxiliary-bishop of Jerusalem he was subsequently crowned the King of Jerusalem. The $MONARCHTITLE$ spent the rest of this time in the city visiting the churches of various Christain denominations, synagogues, and even Al-Aqsa Mosque. Our $MONARCHTITLE$ did this to try and reassure everyone that Jerusalem will remain open to all brothers of the abrahamic faith and their rights to practice will not be infringed. However, many are unconvinced by this, due to reports of mistreatment of jews in our European lands, and mistreatment of muslims in our African lands.
We will never forget you, Jerusalem
$FROMCOUNTRY$ refuses our demands

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused our proposal to settle problems within Jerusalem, it is clear that the only course of action to solve the issue of Jerusalem will be military intervention. We fight not just for the Christains in Jerusalem but all Christains in $FROMCOUNTRY$ and for their sake we will be victorious.
We gave them every chance for peace
Forging a new state

Now that the Coronation is over, there is much work ahead for the Imperial government. The decentralized nature of the Aragonese Monarchy, sometimes called 'the pactist monarchy' by scholars was a hindrance for the Royal Power alongside strenghtening the nobility from each Crown. With the Emperor now crowned and the basis of our state established, it is time for the government to handle the creation of this new Realm by handling the issues plaguing each Crown. The Emperor is eager to §Rcentralize the Realm§ by reducing the autonomy of each Crown but many ask to keep the §Ykeep the decentralization§ so that it is enshrined within the Empire. Too much centralization will easily provoke revolts and issues but the decentralization may not allow the Empire to truly wield its power in this new age.
I thought forming this new state was the end of our problems ?
An Opportunity in Etruria

The Valois-Medicis have always yearned for the return of their birthright. The Duchess of Lucca, Margherita de Valois-Medici, an ally of Aragon, has insisted on the need for the return of the old order in the rogue state of Etruria, once known by its classic name, Tuscany. Having brought Etruria to our influence, our covert agents and informants can now subvert the Etrurian government without any need of force and forcibly install Margherita and her clique as a ruse to further our ambitions in Italy.
Treaty of Sardinia
The Aragonese have been unable to wrest control of our island from us, we should now be able to bring them to the negotiating table. Glory to Sardinia!
End the Latin Abomination

Seeking to bend us to their will, the Aragonese have proclaimed their dominion over the whole of the Italy and occupied Rome, once the center of the mighty Roman Empire, this occupation ends now, let our liberation of this proud, ancient city remind the Aragonese that only Italians are to rule over Italy.
The Papal Question

After the end of the Papal states the Pope has refused to acknowledge our rule over Rome and in effect has refused to recognize the legitimacy of our country. As a result he has virtually reduced to a 'prisoner' within the St. Peter's Basilica. The debate of the future of the Pope has become known as the Papal Question. In order to solve this question we will send out a representative to the Pope to hopefully begin negotiations towards a peaceful settlement.
The Latins and the Church

After the end of the Papal states the Pope has refused to recognize the legitimacy of our country. As a result he has become a virtual prisoner within St. Peter's Basilica. The debate of the future of the Pope has become known as the Papal Question. While the Pope won’t deal with us directly we can reach out a Papal legate with the proposal of beginning negotiations for a settlement on the Papal Question. We can only hope the Pope agrees to this.
Defining $COUNTRY$

Our most noble subjects have been shaped and crafted rigorously to the various machinations of Imperial authority. A new national consciousness has taken shape among our Latin subjects, waiting for a brighter future for their posterity to witness.\n\nLet us hope that our efforts to further $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule have brought the needed stability and weal for our subjects to reaffirm their oaths to the aging $MONARCHTITLE$ in Rome.
The Triumph in Roma

The Romans have successfully retained their role as the sole hegemon of Italy and the Mediterranean. At the same time, our esteemed statesmen have scrambled left and right drafting plans to reintegrate and exact our sovereignty over our lost territories that have seceded from our grasp during the Civil War. The world basks in glory at the reborn paragon of all civilization, and countless flock to witness and take part in our glories. A new golden age is upon us!
The Reconquest of Africa

The lands of the Peu-Vermells and Northern Africa had broken away unilaterally from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ to escape the brunt of the Bello Civili. Despite having sought recognition internationally to recognize their rule, most of the Peu-Vermells and African settlers upon hearing the news of our Triumph, have sought to reconcile with $COUNTRY_ADJ$ authorities and rejoin Rome.
The Institutio Catholica Decrees

The open threat of Socialism prys on the Latin student, such ideas threatening to corrupt their minds and may undermine the Catholic nature of our Empire. Clerical officials have suggested making vast alterations to our curriculum and educational system to combat this threat, prioritizing faith and values above reason and rationality in teaching.
The Venetian Question

Venice was one of the leading trade and maritime rivals of the early Aragonese crown, but in the 19th century it is now a shell of its former self. With the Venetians under firm $COUNTRY_ADJ$, the citizens of the former Serene Republic still not firmly under are role, perhaps it is time to reintegrate the former Venetian lands to our realm.
The Savoyard Holdings

The Duchy of Savoy is historically attached to Italy. Despite years of conflicts with the Burgundian crowns and Piedmont-Savoy, control over the Savoyard lands are ideal in further projecting our interests in Northern Italy given their strategic defensive value. It is necessary we secure Savoie before the Burgundians and the perfidious Anglois could beat us to it!
The Annexation of Provence

The lands of Provence traces its origins to the 9th Century Franks, a valuable buffer state for any potential invasions from France to the Italian peninsula, recent times being held by the self-titled “King in France”, a mere remnant of the old order that once dominated France. The port city of Marseille also offers us the ability to intensify our control over the Mediterranean. Provence must be a part of $COUNTRY$!
The Crusade for Occitania

The Occitans, our faithful Latin brothers, have been led astray by the errors of Luther, succumbed to the heresy of Protestantism. We mustn’t allow this to continue! To them we shall bring God’s through the sword - we shall purify the entirety of Occitannia from Marseille to Bordeaux and crush this sniveling abomination.
The Reclamation of Narbonensis

The lands of Southern Gaul were a stepping stone in Caesar's ambitions in Gaul, and have been decisive in opening a route to the subjugation of Hispania and Gallic lands up until the Rhine. Attempting another campaign to reclaim these lands is sure to gain the ire of European powers, but must we stoop down so low to their words of “mediation” and “compromise”? Occitania is a part of $COUNTRY$, and it shall always be!
The Cartagena Dispute

The unclear status of the territories of the once Kingdom of Mercia were a source of tensions between Spain and Aragon for centuries. After the said kingdom’s conquest, Jaume II of Aragon brokered a treaty with the Castilians delineating its frontiers in 1304 but were repudiated the following year with the treaty of Elche, transferring the strategic port city of Cartagena to the then Crown of Castile. However, with our resurgence we can now rectify this mere mistake through force of arms.
Secure Vasconia-Navarre

The control over Vasconia-Navarre has always been a priority for most Aragonese monarchs. Now that we have over control of the once-fleeting holdings of the Navarrese Kingdom, we can now further project our influence beyond Navarra and onto its claims in Vasconia with our newfound $COUNTRY_ADJ$ identity and the prior kingdoms’ claims as casus belli to reclaim our lost lands.
Reaffirming the Consolat de Mar

For centuries, the Crown of Aragon has been hellbent on obtaining supreme naval dominance over the Mediterranean. Despite having made inroads controlling key naval ports and attempts at acquiring maritime holdings through diplomacy their efforts amounted to little. As such, Albania and Ragusa were sought after by the Aragonese in their quest of reaffirming their might over the Mare Nostrum. With our might and status as the foremost Mediterranean power we can invade Epirus without garnering too much attention from the international community.
The Reclamation of the Gallic Provinces

The provinces of Gallia have always been a core part of our once-ascendant Imperium. However, with our newfound strength and military might, the $COUNTRY$ can once again bring order to the rest of the Gallic lands up north, avenging the disaster of 476!
The Reclamation of Hispania

The lands of Hispania were known for their vast mineral and natural wealth. Roman soldiers have fought relentlessly for centuries to establish Roman rule over these lands, but were forced out by barbarians at the end of the 5th century. Now with the $COUNTRY$ on the rise again, we can now embark on a new campaign to take what’s rightfully Roman.
Proclaim our Supremacy over the Papacy

The Papal lands should be brought under firm Aragonese control. Given our newfound Latin authority and total control over the Papacy’s domestic and territorial affairs along with the matter of Italian revolutionary nationalism in the bin, we can now proclaim our supremacy over the Papal lands without any bloodshed and bring the Prisoner back to fold!
Securing the Papal Lands

The Papal lands should be brought under firm Aragonese control. With the Italian revolutionary flame of the Etrurians extinguished and our hegemony over Italy secured, we must restore order to the Papal Lands through force, and bring the Prisoner back to the fold.
Proclaim our Supremacy over Tuscany

Tuscany should be brought under firm Aragonese control. Given our newfound Latin authority and total control over Tuscany’s domestic and territorial affairs along with the matter of Italian revolutionary nationalism in the bin, we can now proclaim our supremacy over the Tuscany without any bloodshed.
Slaying the Etrurian Hydra

The lands of Tuscans must be brought under Aragonese control. With the Italian revolutionary flame of the Etrurians extinguished and our hegemony over Italy secured, we must restore order to Tuscany through force!
Proclaim our Supremacy over Lucca

The Papal lands must be brought under firm Aragonese control. Given our newfound Latin authority and total control over the Lucca’s domestic and territorial affairs along with the matter of Italian revolutionary nationalism in the bin, we can now proclaim our supremacy over the Lucca without any bloodshed.
The Unlucky Luccans

Lucca must be brought under firm Aragonese control. With the Italian revolutionary flame of the Etrurians extinguished and our hegemony over Italy secured, we must restore order to Lucca through force!
Proclaim our Supremacy over Ferrara

The Papal lands must be brought under firm Aragonese control. Given our newfound Latin authority and total control over the Ferrara’s domestic and territorial affairs, we can now proclaim our supremacy over Ferrara without any bloodshed.
The Romagna Claim

The Princedom of Romagna is held dearly by the Crown of Aragon. It was once held by Duke Cesare Borgia, an ancestor of the current ruling dynasty of Aragon, but was abruptly given up in a matter of years due to Papal meddling in the 16th century. With the Italian revolutionary flame of the Etrurians extinguished and our hegemony over Italy secured, we can now reclaim our birthright!
Putting the Farnese in Line

The lands of the Farnese - Parma and Modena should be brought under firm Aragonese control. Given our newfound Latin authority and total control over the Parma and Modena’s domestic and territorial affairs along with the matter of Italian revolutionary nationalism in the bin, we can now proclaim our supremacy over the Farnese lands without any bloodshed.
Proclaim our Supremacy over Genoa

Genoa must be brought under firm Aragonese control. The once major trading power of Genoa has often colluded with Aragonese ambitions, but was gradually outshone by the more preeminent Venetians. With our immense sway and clout over Genoese enterprises and bankers coupled with meddling in their internal affairs, we can now proclaim our supremacy over Genoa without any bloodshed.
Proclaim our Supremacy over Milan

Milan has been a major obstacle to our Northern Italian ambitions, with the ruling Gonzaga-Borgia family also plotting in the struggle for Italian dominance. With these matters taken care of through a combination of political persuasion and our sheer influence in Mlianese affairs, we can now secure control over this “problem Duchy”.
Proclaim our Supremacy over Savoy

Savoy should be brought under firm Aragonese control. Given our newfound Latin authority and total control over Savoy’s domestic and territorial affairs along with the matter of Italian revolutionary nationalism in the bin, we can now proclaim our supremacy over Savoy without any bloodshed.
Destabilize the Confederation

The Italian Confederation has been a huge setback to our ambitions of achieving total dominance over Northern Italy despite the constant interference of other Great Powers. With luck, we somehow have managed to gain virtual control of the country’s sovereignty due to our immense clout in their economic and internal affairs. With a bit of trickery and political meddling we can force the Confederation to fall in line in $CAPITAL$’s grasp.
Binding Occitania

For a while now, we have been able to consolidate our control of Occitania and tame the people within our new provinces. With provinces within the Empire being granted local autonomy for greater unity and brotherhood between people
column3: it’s now time to grant these certain rights and the privileges to the citizens of Occitania. We shall grant regional autonomy and cultural preservation to Provence and its people to assure their place within the Empire..

column2: Bring the Romands to the flock

The poor Romands have been dominated by other powers for centuries, who never accepted them. While, we of course won't give them a nation to call their own, we can ensure that they are properly integrated into our nation. Granted, most of them are Protestants, but what shepard would willingly cast aside his flock when they are merely lost and need a home?
Proclaim the Empire of the Latins

For centuries now, the Crown of Aragon has been a dominant power on the Italian peninsula. But since the Revolutionary Wars, the prospect of unifying the North into another Crown ruled by the Kings of Valencia has faded notably because the Italian nationalists have proclaimed us foreigners and imperialists..\n\nJosep Serna will not repeat the mistakes of his forefathers and rule Italy in personal union with Aragon, like Sardinia, Sicily, Naples and the other Crowns. The defunct Imperial Crown of the 12th-century Latin Empire will be the means to forge a new realm of Latins, uniting Italy and Aragon under a single Emperor!
Claim the Protection of the Holy Places

With the advent of faster transportation, the number of pilgrims to the Holy City has increased in the last few years and with them the number of incidents with local authorities. Currently, there is no unified policy in the Holy Land, the pilgrims depending on Capitulations made with the Ottoman Sultans by various European courts, although the Dual-Monarchy has long had a privileged status among the Catholic monarchies. To that we say no more, we will claim the Protection of all Christians pilgrims as the most important European power.
Annex the Mutasarrifate of Palestine

The special governorship of Palestine has served its purpose. With our agents already holding most of the power offices in Jerusalem, Palestine can be annexed without bloodshed so as to greater our influence in the Middle-East. However, their overlord will not stand idly as we annex the Holy CIty and we must prepare
Santamarian Dominance
A variety of concessions and agreements with the Santamarian Society has led them taking over, influencing, and at times having the final say in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ affairs.
The Papal Interdict of $YEAR$ - Aragon

We have been excommunicated by the Pope! Our Catholic subjects have grown distrustful and have expressed their open dissent to the Aragonese crown. Such actions have taken a toll on our Church-run academic institutions and have put a dent on our diplomatic relations with fellow Catholics abroad.
The Valencian Conference - Status Quo
The Valencian Conference has insisted on the preservation of our Aragonese traditions, avoiding any drastic policy change so as not to enrage the peoples of the constituent Crowns of Aragon.
Papal Dominance
The Papacy has a dominant sway in our state affairs, at times becoming a major problem in managing the state.
Papal Interference
The Papacy has been intervening in state affairs, affecting our ability to govern our subjects well.
Prisoner in the Vatican

Our unfavorable relations with the weakened Vatican state continues to bring ripple tides within Latin society. The Prisoner, while weak, could still bite back and leave a mark. Potentially even a hard, painful one.
Catalonian Stress
The Valencian-Catalonian “tariff wars” has flared up, devolving into a trade war that has severely impacted Rome’s ability to extract tariffs efficiently from Iberian businesses and enterprises.
The Catalonian Malaise
The Valencian-Catalonian “tariff wars” has intensified, to a point of no return. With many key industries reeling in from the disaster it seems Catalonia’s economic future is bleak
Institutio Catholica

The deep entrenchment of the Catholic faith in academic circles and schooling has led to a resurgence of Catholic values among the young at the expense of our intellectual capabilities and educational efficiency
de Privilegiis Indulgentiis
In agreement with the Holy See, the Catholic faithful are obligated to pay the “Eight per thousand” tax to reimburse the Papacy’s loss of territory and various other properties
Secularist Acts in Force

Our open association with secularists in the government to stem the Pope’s “unceasing influence” in state affairs has garnered negative attention among the majorly Latin faithful, ever becoming more dismissive to the Emperor and the government
Magna Exercita Res Publica Romana

A combination of state incentives to soldiers, reforms to the draft, an overhauled general staff, better tactics and training led to the rise of a new and revolutionary Grand Army to crush any foe it may encounter
La Battaglia Culturale
Our policies against the Protestants in Occitania have led to a true culture war against the faithless Neo-Cathars, angering most of the Occitan population in the process
The Brigandagio Wars
Our often aggressive policies against banditry in the Tyrrhenians and by extension Sicily sparked the intensification of the Brigandagio conflict between internal law enforcement and the banditry
The Neapolitan Land Reform

The land reform policies in Southern Italy have led to the growth of the agricultural and labor sectors. This came at the expense of losing landowners' support, which hold immense political sway in the region
The Southern Exodus
The Empire’s failure to mediate the troubles in the Mezzogiorno has led to an exodus of dozens of Southern Italians seeking greener pastures in the New World.
A Clanic Society

The Corsican society has embraced wholly its clanic identity, adhering to a pseudo-feudal that promotes stability and a “stagnant” standard of living, maintaining its close ties to Rome at the cost of giving it greater autonomy.
The Catalonian Miracle
The Latin Emperor’s personal intervention in the trade wars has led to the blossoming of Catalan industry, which has long failed to keep up with the rest of the Crowns
The Lateran Treaty of $YEAR$

The Treaty with the Papacy guarantees a “mutual” agreement with the Pope and the $COUNTRY_ADJ$, in which each side would refuse intervening in the affairs of other, ushering in an new era of Papist affairs
Spain and Pamplona

Now that we have secured our interest in the Pyrenean nation of Navarre against those of the Crown of Aragon, the time has finally come to integrate the various institutions of the formerly Bourbon Kingdom into our own to establish a subservient nation to guard our national security and to serve as a buffer between both Spain, Aragon and even England-France. Under our watchful eyes, the Basque people will surely be accepting of their new status as loyal servants to the Spanish nation!
Paris and Pamplona

As the formerly Bourbon Kingdom of Navarre has been acquired via marriage ties for the House of Plantagenet, the time has finally come to integrate the various institutions of the Basque nation on the side of the Pyrenees into our own to establish a subservient nation to guard our national security and to serve as a buffer between Spain, Aragon and England-France. Under our watchful eyes, the Basque people will surely be accepting of their new status as loyal servants to the Anglois nation!
Integrate Navarre!

With the unfortunate death of the last Bourbon King of Navarre, the royal crown of Pamplona has been ceded to the Crown of Aragon and Aragon only, a fact that has been confirmed with our humbling of the Spaniards and the Anglois. Our centuries-long history of deep dynastic and cultural ties allows us to integrate the Basque nation into our country as part of our shared destiny to defend Roman Christendom from those who tarnish its reputation, further allowing us to have access to the Atlantic Ocean through Basque ports, further diminishing our dependence on Spanish "benevolence". Truly a great day for all Romans!
Integrate Navarre!

With the death of the last Bourbon King of Navarre, the Kingdom of Pamplona has ceased to exist as a nation with purpose. After recent hostilities in the Pyrenees, the time has come for the ever-growing nation of Spain to integrate its Basque brethren in faith as a result of a centuries-long history of deep dynastic and cultural ties between our two nations. Indeed, the integration of Navarre will justify our name is heirs to Hispania, a nation for all Iberians! Truly a great day for all Spaniards!
Liberate Navarre

With the wife of our Dauphin in line for the throne of Navarre, we can push the claim and outright annex the entire region, integrating it into our core states. However, this action draw ire from both Iberia and the international community, wishing to preserve the status quo.
Integrate the Basque
With Navarre under our control, preparations can be made to accept the Basque people as citizens of our country.
Basque Independence?

Navarra is at the centre of influence conflicts since the Renaissance. Forsaken by the Spanish Crown which pursued its exploration policies, Navarra was both coveted by the king of Aragon and the Anglois Dual Monarchy. Aragon attacked first and invaded Higher-Navarra in 1508. The queen from Navarra fled to her possessions in Aquitaine, Lower-Navarra. Before war erupted, a compromise was found between Aragon and the Dual-Monarchy in Perpignan: The Anglo-French would annex Lower-Navarra while the queen of Navarra would pledge fidelity to the king of Aragon. Over the centuries, the political setup did not change much, with Navarra using its three neighbours against each other to preserve some independence, like with Henri III who took part in the Wars of Religion. But now, Aragon is the shadow of itself, not even considered as a Great Power by many. The king Henry IV thinks he can profit from it, by pulling his Anglo-French and Spanish allies to help him. What will possibly happen??
We will contact the Anglo-French for help!
We will contact the Spanish Crown for help!
We are no vultures. Aragon has our loyalty!

column2: The Dual Monarchy Threatens War

The Anglois are furious at our refusal to grant them passage into Spain. Now their representative has reminded us of the old Plantagent claim to the Kingdom of Navarre...a claim they may pursue if we continue our defiance. Some members of the cabinet wish to reaffirm our defiance, but others see an opportunity to use the Anglois' threats as an excuse to dissolve our ties to Aragon - even if we may only end up replacing them with the Dual Monarchy.
An opportunity is an opportunity.
We've fought the Anglois for centuries and we won't stop now!
A call from Pampelune...

The king of Navarra has asked us to help him in his dreams of independence. He reasoned that Aragon is decaying and through our historic and cultural ties with the Pamplonan Crown, it is our duty to intervene on his behalf. Yet, our advisors are alarmed: Aragon might be decaying but it is still not dead and might retaliate. Nonetheless, Henry IV awaits an answer. Our strength might be enough to scare off Barcelona, but they nonetheless might escalate it into a war. If we don't help Henry IV, Spain might use this chance alone to finally free the Basque from the Aragonese yoke. But we could use this opportunity to gain a client state in Euskadia, although this would anger our long-time friend and ally Spain.
Of course, Navarra should become our puppet!
He must know what his place is, and it is under the Aragonese yoke!
We will support the Spanish claim without directly intervening.
Navarre Recognizes our Claim

The Navarrese have unexpectedly recognized our claim to their kingdom! They made it clear that they would not accept integration into the Plantagent realm, but they have still invited Henry IV to take up the Navarrese crown so long as we respect Navarrese autonomy. It seems they recognized that their situation was hopeless, and that they prefer our protection to that of Aragon. Hopefully once this Spanish matter is solved, we can work to...revise the agreement. Needless to say, Aragon will not be pleased by all this.
Navarre will be free!...in a way.
A Chance at Freedom

The Dual Monarchy is locked in conflict with Spain, but they have not sought passage through our lands. This gives us the chance to make a bid to break free of Aragonese hegemony! It may be risky, but who knows when the major powers of the Pyrenees will all be occupied with other affairs again? We must dare to be bold!
Expel the Aragonese representative! Freedom awaits!
Independence of Navarra!

With the backing of the Anglo-French, Navarra has proclaimed its independence. The Aragonese legate, who was there to ensure the loyalty of the kingdom was expelled along with all Aragonese officials. Henry IV has been acclaimed by the crowds of Pampeluna, however what will be Aragon's reaction?
Let them come!
Reaction from Barcelona

Navarra has proclaimed its independence! They have expelled our representatives with the support of the Dual Monarchy. We could always intervene militarily and annex this kingdom we have coveted for centuries. But if we do so, we will have to face the Dual Monarchy, a foe we might not be able to bring down...
We will reluctantly recognize the independence of Navarra...
Declare war! We will remove Navarra from the maps!
A new ally?

Our cowardly allies from over the Pyrenees have refused to help us! Without allies our plan is sure to fail but there is still someone who could help us. The kingdom of Spain holds a dynastic claim on our little kingdom and they would be pleased to help us against Aragon, at least that is what some of our advisors and diplomats believe...
Call the Spanish king!
Well, it may be time to give up this folly...
A call from Pampelune

The king of Navarra has asked us to help him in his independence's will. Aragon might be decaying but it is still not dead. A war is likely, but nonetheless, Henry IV de Bourbon awaits an answer. If we help Navarra, it might trigger a war in this rather peaceful region, but if we back down, Navarra might very well be lost to the regime in Barcelona.
Of course, we will help Navarra!

column2: We aren't ready for a war against Aragon...
Proclamation of Independence!

With the backing of the Spanish, Navarra has proclaimed its independence. The Aragonese legate, who was there to ensure the loyalty of the kingdom was expelled along with all Aragonese officials. Henry IV has been acclaimed by the crowds of Pampeluna, however what will be Aragon's reaction?
Let them come!
