Due to the contemporary tense atmosphere, the Danubians have begun to use these three words as a slogan against the Bohemian authority and to end their arbitrary rule over the lands of the Danube.
Sorrow for Nuremberg, rage against Prague, and hope for Danubia.
The Nürnberglied

The Nürnberglied, the Nuremberg Song, is an anthem written by Gottfried Wilhelm Eisler as a reaction to the Great Fire of Nuremberg. The first line, "Deutsches Blut, geflossen in der kalten Nacht" (usually translated into English as "German blood was shed in the cold night"), was an appeal to the various German monarchs to give the creation of a constitution that respects the individual human a higher priority than the independence of their small states. In the third stanza, with a call for "Gleichheit, Einheit, Freiheit" (equality, unity, freedom), Eisler expressed his desire for a united and free Germany where the rule of law, not monarchical arbitrariness, would prevail. Due to the contemporary tense atmosphere, many $COUNTRY_ADJ$ liberals and intellectuals have began to use these three words as a campaigning slogan against the lacking guarantee of rights for the people of $COUNTRY$.
A dream reborn.
The Nürnberglied

The Nürnberglied, the Nuremberg Song, is an anthem written by Gottfried Wilhelm Eisler as a reaction to the Great Fire of Nuremberg. The first line, "Deutsches Blut, geflossen in der kalten Nacht" (usually translated into English as "German blood was shed in the cold night"), was a thinly veiled insult and exclusion of the Bohemian people to the German cultural group and was not long after its first publication in Leipzig banned in the Kingdom of Bohemia. And yet, this ban only made this forbidden song, in the wake of recent events in Franconia, more popular among our youth and beyond our borders as more and more liberal secret societies are forming around a single, unifying line of the Nürnberglied.
Gleichheit, Einheit, Freiheit!
The Bayreuth Constitution of $YEAR$

In the years after the Great German War, the Electorate of Brandenburg-Bayreuth, formerly a staunch reactionary stronghold who allied with Wenceslaus V and received Nürnberg as a reward, transformed itself into a beacon of liberalism and hope for the peoples of Germany. Prince-Elector Leopold IV, Duke of Brandenburg-Bayreuth, and his almost obsessive sponsorship of various intellectuals and creative artists are among the reasons behind the proclamation by the chancellor August von Rixdorf of a charter granting basic rights to the subjects of the Bayreuth throne, and introducing a democratically elected parliament with actual legislative powers. With the obvious inspiration taken from the Zeil Oath, concerns are raised over a potential interference by Sigismund V of Bohemia who warned of such actions in the wake of his ascension to the crown of Bohemia.
Reformation is better than a new revolution!
The Fall of von Schwarzenberg

History would first remember Karl von Schwarzenberg as the Architect of Europe, having navigated Bohemia to its present esteem despite the inconclusive Great German War, then as Imperial Regent for Sigismund V following Wenceslaus IV's untimely death, then as Chancellor of the Holy Roman Empire. Despite his many titles, however, his former charge would prove no large amount of them can quell an Emperor incensed when he released the now-former Chancellor from his duties following the dismal outcome of the Hungarian Conference. Sigismund later appointed as his new Chancellor Josef von Nostitz-Drzewiecky, an old family friend, to neither fanfare nor outcry.
Such is the Emperor’s will.
Following the Bayreuth Constitution

Exile poets, would-be revolutionaries and other such liberal apologists have streamed to Brandenburg-Bayreuth in increasing numbers ever since its lunatic chancellery enacted reform after reform under the Bayreuth Constitution's remit. While this is a clear affront to Imperial authority over Germany, normally resolved through a ‘thorough restoration of the status quo', the Emperor had granted von Nostitz-Drzewiecky his blessing to resolve ‘the situation in Bayreuth’ as he saw fit. Those beseeching clemency for the liberals were countermanded by those who claim the Charter’s continued existence undermines the Empire’s stability, leaving it vulnerable to Burgundian and Scandinavian infiltration. Yet the Ewiger Landfriede, strengthened by the Treaty of Paris, forbids using military force to solve internal Imperial disputes - except in cases of dire emergency. Having considered both perspectives, the Chancellor said…
Their ‘Constitution’ will make fine boot scrubbers for our men!
Germanos omittamus. Now is no time for bloodshed.
The Emperor Intercedes

The Prince-Elector of Brandenburg-Bayreuth... whose dictums invite chaos and discord upon his own dominion, and in so doing threatens to breach the Eternal Public Peace of the Empire beyond all tolerable bounds... Now I, Sigismund V, Holy Roman Emperor by the grace of God, King of Bohemia, King of Germany, &c., &c., do hereby subject Prince-Elector Leopold IV to an Imperial ban : and that the person aforesaid is as free as a bird until his offending laws are revoked forthwith...\n\nSigismund V retracted his blessing shortly after hearing of von Nostitz-Drzewiecky’s lenient stance towards the Bayreuth Constitution. His subsequent ultimatum is unlikely to be obeyed and thus he has argued that the Ewiger Landfriede must temporarily be suspended so that the Reichsarmee can protect the security of the Empire. Noticeably, he has not consulted the Reichshofrat to do this, let alone the Reichstag…
The Son of the Lion shall make one example among many!
The $YEAR$ Great Fire of Nuremberg

The days that followed the tragedy were rife with finger-pointing. The aggrieved of Nuremberg cast theirs at a squad of Bohemians who’d set fire to a bakery after shooting everyone within : the Imperial Army denies such malice aforethought. Whichever the truth, its resulting facts lay clear in three quarters of a once-proud city in cinders, and thousands of charred corpses to come along with. While the good Duke Leopold nurses his wounds in Londres and his more conservative brother Hermann III bears the onerous task of rebuilding his capital, Sigismund returns to Prague having lit a fire not just in Nuremberg but in the heart of every German from the Danube to the Rhine.
Let the city light our way to order.
A Headless Lion

His Imperial Majesty the Emperor has begun to reconsider his neglect of the foreign office. Up until now it was the opinion of our sovereign that it represented a needless drain on the treasury, and that he and his cabinet could handle things by themselves. The disaster in Nuremberg, however, has thrown that into question. Emperor Sigismund has begrudgingly come to terms with his relative inexperience in orchestrating foreign policy, especially after numerous reports of anti-Jagiellon sentiment flaring up across southern Germany the likes of which have not been seen since the days of Marinus Dahlke. Thus he has reinvested new funds into the foreign office and reappointed Karl von Schwarzenberg as Chancellor, awarding Josef von Nostitz-Drzewiecky a substantial sinécure as compensation.
We can still undo the damages!
The Obvious Demand

The Burning of Nuremberg has shocked all of Germany but what worries Wilhelm IV goes beyond this incident. The Emperor has, on his own initiative, broken the Ewiger Landfriede and removed a prince of the Empire, and not just anyone, but one of the seven Electors. This unparalleled assault upon the rights of the Imperial Princes of the Blood cannot be tolerated! We must defend the rights of the Electors, and of our fellow Danubian Germans. To this end, Duke-Elector Wilhelm has taken two actions. First he held a meeting of princes and bishops from across the German highlands to draft a petition to the Emperor demanding a convocation of the Reichstag to hold a vote on the fate of Bayreuth. He has also organized a broader council meeting of German princes to be held in Munich whether or not the Emperor permits the Reichstag to be convened. If the Reichstag fails us then we may need to take extreme measures to protect the rights of our people from the Emperor…possibly including a new union of princes to defend against him.
We shall not be led like sheep to the slaughter!
An Envoy from Bavaria

The Emperor’s dissolution of the Electorate of Bayreuth has sent shockwaves throughout the Empire. Nobody knows where the sovereign’s autocratic streak will end and few are interested in finding out. Now Duke-Elector Wilhelm IV of Bavaria has decided to take action. He has petitioned for an immediate Reichstag vote on the fate of Bayreuth, but he has also announced the convening of a pan-German council to discuss possible measures to defend against further Imperial encroachment. None of our ministers can say where such discussions may lead but it is obvious that further German unity is necessary if we are to survive Sigismund’s predations.
Of course we will attend the meeting.
The Second Imperial Incident : The Danubian Petition

Our dissolution of the Electorate of Bayreuth and the subsequent Fire of Nuremberg has raised hackles along the Danube, and no German realm is more angered by our actions than Bavaria. This act of royal interference in defiance of the Ewiger Landfriede has especially angered the Danubians as it was an attack on one of their own cultural kin. Thus the Bavarians and other Danubian princes and bishops have demanded an immediate convocation of the Reichstag to hold a vote on the fate of Bayreuth. Ominously, Duke-Elector Wilhelm IV of Bavaria has also organized a pan-German council in Munich to rally German nationalism against Imperial control. Thus the Emperor is tempted to reject the petition in order to demonstrate his displeasure at Bavaria’s actions, but von Schwartzenberg has urged him to at the very least withdraw all Bohemian troops from Bayreuth as an act of goodwill. Allowing the vote will almost certainly lead to the princes voting in Leopold’s favor and will humiliate us before our own vassals.
Hold the vote, if the princes want Leopold to be an elector again.
Hermann shall remain Elector of Bayreuth, but without our bayonets.
§RBohemian troops will remain in Bayreuth. (NOT ADVISED)§
The Third Imperial Incident : The Land Diet of Bohemia

The Kingdom of Bohemia has had a long-standing Diet, known as the Land Diet, which has permitted the Czech Upper Class, most notably the Nobility, to have considerable influence over the internal workings of the Kingdom via the advising of rulers on what policies they should enact. Supported by the Liberals and the general public (who mistakenly think the aristocracy represent them in good will), the nobility has once again called for a Diet, something not seen since the crowning of King Wenceslaus V. Now Sigismund V, in his capacity as King of Bohemia, must decide on whether to hold the Diet, or take this opportunity to abolish the practice altogether. Rumors are swirling that the Czech nobles’ first priority will be to reduce Sigismund’s powers to make war, in light of the Bayreuth fiasco.
§RAbolish the Diet! Defeatism is unacceptable!§
Host the Diet, we must relieve pressure on the Crown somehow.
The Land Diet - The Matter of German Representation

With the Diet now being organized, King Sigismund now has a choice to make regarding its composition. Chancellor von Schwartzenberg could draft a plan on how best to include the Germans living in the long-held possessions of Saxony and Brandenburg in the new Diet. This would not only make him many allies within the German Nobility, it would also dilute the power and influence of the old and deeply rooted Czech Aristocracy. However he could also pander to the Czech aristocrats by providing them vast privileges within the new Diet that will forever entrench the Czechs as the ruling force of the Kingdom, granting him a strong power base with which to pass policies. Naturally, the Chancellor has urged him to avoid such chauvinism, reminding him that he is “king of the Bohemians, but Emperor of the Germans.”
§RVon Schwartzenberg is right, representation for ALL citizens.§
Czechs are the foundation of this kingdom, not Germans.
The Land Diet Convenes

For the first time in over a generation, the Land Diet of Bohemia has been convened in Prague, with nobles gathered from across the realm to represent their lands before the King. In the Diet, the Bohemian nobility expressed their contempt for Liberalism but also declared further war a threat to manorial society. During the Great German War, Wenceslaus drafted a law exempting any family from robota (serfdom) if their son volunteered for the army. This led to a surge of recruitment in the Czech countryside and practically ended serfdom in Bohemia, with the rest being freed during the Regency of Sigismund. Thus the Czech nobility, fearing further instability and empowerment of the peasantry, tabled several measures to curtail the King of Bohemia’s war powers. However all such measures were thwarted by the German nobility. Aghast at the specter of liberalism and nationalism now haunting the Danubian lands, they have demanded that we stand ready to crush any further assaults upon the ancient foundations of the Empire.
Truer words were never spoken!
The Land Diet Convenes

For the first time in over a generation, the Land Diet of Bohemia has been convened in Prague, with nobles gathered from across the realm to represent their lands before the King. In the Diet, the Bohemian nobility expressed their contempt for Liberalism but also declared further war a threat to manorial society. During the Great German War, Wenceslaus drafted a law that exempted any family from robota (serfdom) if they had any son volunteer for the army. This led to a surge of recruitment in the Czech countryside and practically ended serfdom in Bohemia, with the few remaining being freed during the Regency of Sigismund. Thus the Bohemian nobility, fearing further instability and empowerment of the peasantry, tabled several measures to reduce the ability of the King of Bohemia to make war without their consent, such as by curtailing his authority to levy troops or raise war taxes. We have been able to water these measures down but we could not stop their passage entirely and it seems that we will continue to struggle to operate our military.
Damnation!
Death of Rudolf von Hesse-Kassel

The Margraviate of Hesse-Kassel is one of the last remnants of feudalism and split inheritances in the Empire, ruling over four disconnected fiefs : the Landgraviate of Kassel, the county of Hanau-Schlüchtberg, the county of Lippe and the county of Nassau-Wiesbaden. Our margrave, Rudolf von Hesse-Kassel, is currently bedridden with typhus and doctors believe that he is not long for this world. Unfortunately he is also heirless and every power around is trying to get him to nominate their prince as heir. While the lands themselves are no more valuable than most in the region, their unusually muddled legal status has offered the German princess of the region an unprecedented opportunity to expand their power at little cost to themselves if they can get their claimants in position. Ominous reports indicate that the Kingdom of Burgundy is “investigating” an old claim by a western Rhenish count under their protection to the County of Nassau-Wiesbaden. If they press it then the matter may escalate into a crisis.
Death, be not proud…
The Hesse-Kassel Opportunity

The Margraviate of Hesse-Kassel is one of the last remnants of feudalism and split inheritances in the Holy Roman Empire, ruling over four disconnected fiefs : the Landgraviate of Kassel, the county of Hanau-Schlüchtberg, the county of Lippe, and the county of Nassau-Wiesbaden. Its margrave, Rudolf von Hesse-Kassel, having never produced any children, chose Duke Konrad von Nassau to succeed him shortly before dying of typhus last night, but the inheritance is still being contested. Our bureaucrats in the Rhine have discovered that the archbishopric of Mainz held several small fiefs in Wiesbaden that, while currently dormant, were never officially relinquished. Thus we now have a pretext to occupy the county of Nassau-Wiesbaden and integrate it into our own Duchy of the Rhine. Needless to say the Duke of Nassau will not be pleased but we should not pass up a chance to consolidate our eastern frontier.
Make it so.
The Fourth Imperial Incident : The Fate of Hesse-Kassel

The Margraviate of Hesse-Kassel is one of the last remnants of feudalism and split inheritances in the Holy Roman Empire, ruling over four disconnected fiefs : the Landgraviate of Kassel, the county of Hanau-Schlüchtberg, the county of Lippe, and the county of Nassau-Wiesbaden. Its margrave, Rudolf von Hesse-Kassel, having never produced any children, chose Duke Konrad of Nassau to succeed him shortly before dying of typhus. However Burgundy is seeking to claim the county of Nassau-Wiesbaden, citing the “ancient rights of the archbishop of Mainz.” Now Duke Konrad has appeared before the Reichstag to demand that the Margraviate of Hesse-Kassel be given to him as Rudolf wanted - including Wiesbaden. This has in turn caused the lords of Darmstadt and Lüneburg to protest that they, too, hold claims to Hesse-Kassel lands, and therefore deserve their fair share. §RHowever we choose to settle the matter, if we have previously promised to respect Burgundy’s presence in the Rhine then betraying them may be unwise…§
§RThe Duke of Nassau is the inheritor, end of discussion!§
Ignore Wiesbaden so long as the Duke of Nassau receives his due.
Darmstadt, Lüneburg, and Nassau must all share the inheritance.
The End of Hesse-Kassel

The Margraviate of Hesse-Kassel is one of the last remnants of feudalism and split inheritances in the Holy Roman Empire, ruling over four disconnected fiefs : the Landgraviate of Kassel, the county of Hanau-Schlüchtberg, the county of Lippe, and the county of Nassau-Wiesbaden. Its margrave, Rudolf von Hesse-Kassel, having never produced any children, chose Duke Konrad of Nassau to succeed him shortly before dying of typhus. However Burgundy has laid claim to the county of Nassau-Wiesbaden, citing the “ancient rights of the archbishop of Mainz,” and have supported the rest of the Duke’s claims on the condition that he cede Wiesbaden to them. It appears that another piece of Germany has been lost.
We will not forget this…
The Braunschweig Crisis

Duke Karl von Braunschweig is quite hated by his subjects for his dubious personal choices. Despite being over forty years old, he has remained single all of his life, and entertains various artists and actors with ducal funds rather than invest it into the realm. Duke Karl has praised the Thuringian model of decentralization though his court is filled with Scandinavian advisors who would prefer his distant relative and heir, our Elector Friedrich von Lüneburg, take over his estates. Now the plotters have finally struck - Duke Karl was taken unaware in the early morning while still in his bed, forced to abdicate and to flee abroad. We are thus the leading candidate to assume control over Braunschweig, but not all is well. Karl is building support for his restoration to the throne while in exile. If the Jagiellons possess the means and the resolve to do so then there is little that we could do to stop them.
Let us hope that matters proceed without further issues.
The Braunschweig Rout

Restorationist sentiment amongst Karl’s few remaining influential supporters ultimately did not amount to much. The Bohemians, having expressed little interest in the Ernestine duchies union, were similarly apathetic at the ousted duke’s plight. A few elderly officers of the ducal army attempted to take back the royal castle along with the small amount of the soldiers that they were able to cajole or browbeat into obedience, but this farcical band was rapidly disarmed with minimal violence, and the rest of the military supported the coup. With no further resistance in sight, Elector Friedrich von Lüneburg has been proclaimed Duke of Braunschweig!
Es lebe der Herzog!
Failure in Braunschweig

Karl’s plan to court outside intervention to restore him to the throne has unfortunately borne fruit. After a small band of elderly Braunschweiger officers and some nervous-looking young soldiers under their command was driven away from the royal castle, a much larger force arrived from Anhalt : the Reichsarmee, led by famous Bohemian general Klement von Fucík. Our own forces were rapidly expelled from Braunschweig after a brief struggle and the whole duchy is once again in Karl’s hands. All is not lost, however : Our Elector remains the far more popular candidate for the throne and we are prepared to take this matter before the Reichstag to attempt to gain by parliamentary vote what we could not through force.
We must not give up!
The Fifth Imperial Incident : The Braunschweig Crisis

Duke Karl von Braunschweig, loathed for his effeminate profligacy, was recently the target of a coup attempt by loyalists of Elector Friedrich von Lüneberg, who wished for him to take up the throne instead and merge their realms together. While we were able to deploy the Reichsarmee to protect the Ewiger Landfriede and restore Karl to his throne, this crisis has shown the weakness of the Duke of Braunschweig, and the charges against him cannot be denied. Now the Reichstag has been convened to arbitrate the matter, and the Emperor must decide whether to force him into the Saxon Duchies union or to let the Elector of Lüneberg proceed with his assumption of the ducal crown. Von Lüneberg could easily be swayed to cast out the Scandinavian advisors which Karl filled his court with in exchange for Braunschweig.
§RVon Lüneberg must expel the Nordics if he wants the throne.§
Duke Karl had his chance. We will not intervene.
§RNo usurpations! Karl will rule within the Saxon union.§
The State of the Reichsarmee

A report demanded by Sigismund over the armed forces at his disposition has highlighted several problems : by the War of the Second Coalition, the Imperial armies needed men, with many conscripts hidden by their families or even their masters who wished to increase their robota (corvée) labor. Wenceslaus declared that any family whose son volunteered for the military was released from robota, which led to a surge of rural Czech recruitment and practically ended serfdom in Bohemia. The few remaining serfs were freed during the Regency of Sigismund. The Czech manpower helped Wenceslaus who also hoped that their service would Germanize them, to no avail - the few remaining soldiers after the initial battles served as translators for new recruits. Now the report says that recruitment has dropped down to prewar levels, and worse, training standards have been repeatedly lowered to attempt to bring more men in. Furthermore the Czechs remain bitter at being forced to learn German to communicate with their commanders.
Something must be done about this.
The Sixth Imperial Incident : The Reichsarmee Reform of $YEAR$

The Reichsarmee has become degraded. The main issue is that most soldiers are Czechs, but most officers are German. Mandatory German lessons have focused only on the most critical military terms, and communication errors have persisted. This in turn drives men to avoid military service, forcing us to slash training standards just to meet our quotas. Three possible solutions have emerged. The simplest measure would be to demand that all units battalion size or above possess dedicated translators, a temporary measure at best that would still leave problems unresolved. The Germans want us to mandate German as the army’s language. The Czechs, Sorbs, and Jews meanwhile would prefer that we organize units along ethnic lines and only assign translators to division leaders and generals. Siding with either group will embitter the other, but without decisive action the military will never be able to modernize.
§RDas Militär spricht Deutsch! (The military speaks German!)§
Open a Military Translators’ School and assign them to the army.
§RAt Ceši mluví cesky. (Let Czechs speak Czech.)§
The Seventh Imperial Incident : The Salzburg Riot

The Electorate of Salzburg is rife with unrest since the end of the Great German War and the dual sovereignty agreement between the Prince-Archbishop and Bavaria. Many Salzburg inhabitants would prefer the end of Church rule. The Archbishop was forced to sequester himself in the Hohensalzburg fortress after a popular revolt denounced the lack of participation of the Elector in the so-called “German Council” in Munich, alongside heavy taxes and other grievances. However the Austrian and Bavarian governments have accused each other of creating this crisis to bypass the Ewiger Landfriede and gain both the Salzach river valley and a better hand for future negotiations. While guaranteeing the rights of the Archbishop-Elector would strengthen our position, declaring its mediatisation to either Munich or Vienna could also sour relations between both and thus make the planned union of the Danubian princes less likely. §ROf course, if we previously promised to support Austria then betraying them would be unwise…§
§RAustria must annex Salzburg.§
Let the princes resolve this matter themselves.
§RBavaria must annex Salzburg.§
The Ulm Incident

During the Mediatisation, the territorial restructuring of the Empire in the time of Marinus Dahlke’s Imperial Republic, the Free Imperial City of Ulm was awarded to Württemberg. In the subsequent coalition wars, it was annexed by the Electorate of Bavaria. As both powers were among the victors at the Congress of Paris, Ulm was restored under Bavarian supervision to appease the Swabian princes. However this has resulted in both Bavaria and Württemberg seeking to push candidates favorable to their interests for every local office to induce the city to return to them, paralyzing the government. Ever since the last mayoral election ended in a bloody street battle in 1835, we have stationed troops in the city to protect our citizens - and, Württemberg alleges, to enforce our will. Now it seems that Württemberg has struck back, as a recent protest against our continued presence in Ulm escalated to a riot. Pro-Swabian sentiments are increasing in Ulm every day, no doubt fomented by Württemberg. The Jagiellons may be forced to intervene…
Ulm is rightfully Bavarian!
The Eighth Imperial Incident : The Ulm Question

During the Mediatisation, the territorial restructuring of the Empire in the time of Dahlke’s Imperial Republic, the Free Imperial City of Ulm was awarded to Württemberg. In subsequent coalition wars, it was annexed by Bavaria. Both powers were among the victors at the Congress of Paris and so Ulm was restored under Bavarian supervision to appease the Swabians. However this turned the city into a focal point of Danubian-Swabian tensions, with both Imperial Estates squabbling over it. Bavaria stationed troops there permanently in 1835, and now a protest demanding said army’s removal has escalated into a riot. The matter is now before the Reichstag, with Württemberg demanding the return of Ulm, Bavaria that they be allowed to sort out the matter themselves (making their annexation of Ulm inevitable), and Ulm that their independence be upheld. §RIf we have previously ruled against Bavaria then this matter will only further embitter them, but if we previously promised to support Austria over Bavaria then betraying them would be unwise.§
§RThe Free City shall be mediatised to Württemberg.§
Let the Bavarians handle the matter.
The current status quo shall remain in place.
Die Hungerjahre

The Great German War had drastic effects on Germany as a whole. The war increased urbanization along pre-established city centers while leaving the countryside sufficiently desolated. Increasing dependence on Burgundian, Bohemian, and, on a smaller scale, Scandinavian investments, both in the rebuilding of towns and cities led to industrialization at the hands of foreign investors. Meanwhile in the countryside the powers of landlords were strengthened, as they gained more rights to control labor. While serfdom was officially outlawed, the power of the lower aristocracy was stronger than before the Revolution. In most of the countryside, the tenants were forced to rely on potato harvests to feed their family, while growing cash crops for their landlords. In the middle of the 1840 decade, the Empire saw the first ripples of this new economic structure, as a potato blight appeared and the threat of famine loomed.
It will pass, we’ve had blights before…
Die Hungerjahre

The Great German War had drastic effects on Germany as a whole. The war increased urbanization along pre-established city centers while leaving the countryside sufficiently desolated. Increasing dependence on Burgundian, Bohemian, and, on a smaller scale, Scandinavian investments, both in the rebuilding of towns and cities led to industrialization at the hands of foreign investors. Meanwhile in the countryside the powers of landlords were strengthened, as they gained more rights to control labor. While serfdom was officially outlawed, the power of the lower aristocracy was stronger than before the Revolution. In most of the countryside, the tenants were forced to rely on potato harvests to feed their family, while growing cash crops for their landlords. In the middle of the 1840 decade, the Empire saw the first ripples of this new economic structure, as a potato blight appeared and the threat of famine loomed.
It will pass, we’ve had blights before…
The Graubünden Seek Unification

The Grey League Cantons (Graubünden) and Switzerland have had an amiable relationship over the centuries, sharing many cultural and religious ties. The strong Burgundian influence in Zürich and Bern, however, made the Grey League hostile to a unification of the Alemannic peoples of the Alps. Now the looming threat of hunger on a level never before seen has persuaded the members of the Grey League that a unified confederation with Switzerland might allow them to suffer less in the coming years. Therefore a new measure lies before the league’s collective council which would, if passed, petition Switzerland to form a united confederation.
Pass the measure! Together, we shall endure!
§ROn second thought…§
The Graubünden Seek Unification

The Grey League Cantons (Graubünden) and Switzerland have had an amiable relationship over the centuries, sharing many cultural and religious ties. The strong Burgundian influence in Zürich and Bern, however, made the Grey League hostile to a unification of the Alemannic peoples of the Alps. Now the looming threat of hunger on a level never before seen has persuaded the members of the Grey League that a unified confederation with Switzerland might allow them to suffer less in the coming years. Yesterday a measure was passed by the league’s collective council to petition us to form a united confederation. Given the greater economic development of our own confederacy, this will effectively result in our annexation of the Grey League. Many of our councilors are excited at the news but the more pessimistic ones have cautioned their colleagues that this will all need the consent of the Emperor to be finalized.
Unus pro omnibus, omnes pro uno!
The Ninth Imperial Incident : The Graubünden Question

The Grey League Cantons (Graubünden) and Switzerland have had an amiable relationship over the centuries, sharing many cultural and religious ties. The strong Burgundian influence in Zürich and Bern, however, made the Grey League hostile to a unification of the Alemannic peoples of the Alps. Now the looming threat of hunger on a level never before seen has persuaded the members of the Grey League that a unified confederation with Switzerland might allow them to suffer less in the coming years. Yesterday a measure was passed by the league’s collective council to petition Switzerland to form a united confederation. This territorial change requires the consent of the Reichstag, and ultimately of the Emperor. Sigismund is hesitant to permit this due to Switzerland’s strong economic and religious ties to Burgundy - it is feared that an enlarged Switzerland would become a Burgundian playground. Refusal however could very well push Switzerland to seek Burgundian protection anyway.
§RDenied! This is a breach of the Imperial order!§
The Confederation may expand east with our accord.
The Graubünden Annexation

Previously, the Reichstag and the Emperor would have had to approve the unification of one member of the Empire with another. However, the Empire has already passed into the realm of history, and thus there is no one to question the Graubünden’s decision to confederate with us.
Lang lebe die Eidgenossenschaft!
The Exigent Diet Convention on the Reichsbodenreform Act

An “exigent” diet put forth by liberals and other “extremist” factions in the Imperial Diet in order to address an issue of the utmost importance : that of land reform. A notion that has gained scorn among conservatives and the landed elite in the Diet, has now been re-addressed in lieu of “extraordinary circumstances'', some reasons being cited are the accounts of potato blight in various parts of the Reich and the monopoly of the aristocracy over the agricultural sector which has severely impacted the Empire’s capabilities in addressing food security. Despite being outnumbered, liberals and intellectuals in the Diet are involved in heated, cutthroat debates with landed and conservative elements alike, unflinching in their defense of God-given “property rights”. In the end, their can only be one conclusion to this affair, and this decision may mean life or death for the esteemed servants and citizens of the Reich and our dear Emperor Sigismund.
§RThe Liberal Clique succeeds in forcing the reform through!§
The bill is killed by conservatives and the landed aristocracy!
The Exigent Diet Convention on the Kleinereichsbodenreform Act

An “exigent” diet put forth by liberals and other “extremist” factions in the Imperial Diet in order to address an issue of the utmost importance : that of land reform. A notion that has gained scorn among conservatives and the landed elite in the Diet, has now been re-addressed in lieu of “extraordinary circumstances'', reasons being cited are the accounts of potato blight in various parts of the Reich and the monopoly of the aristocracy over the agricultural sector which has severely impacted the Empire’s capabilities in addressing food security. Our liege’s current falling out with prominent members in the Diet, among them prominent intellectuals and experts on the matter who are direly needed in the bill’s success, meant that legislators can only formulate a “lesser” form of the act. Liberals and intellectuals in the Diet are involved in heated, cutthroat debates with landed and conservative elements alike, unflinching in their defense of God-given “property rights''. In the end, their can only be one conclusion to this affair, and this decision may mean life or death for the esteemed subjects and citizens of the Reich and our dear Emperor Sigismund.
§RThe “limited” reform is passed in the Reichstag§
The bill is killed by conservatives and the landed aristocracy!
Die Aushöhlung am $YEAR$

This year marks one of the most troublesome times the Empire has faced ever since its foundation. The so-called “potato blight” has consumed most of the empire’s productive farmland, along with a brutal drought. The dominance of the aristocracy in rural affairs was detrimental to the interests of German farmers and workers with agricultural harvests reaching record lows. This was exacerbated with the growth of industry in various urban areas of the empire that induced an internal “exodus” of people leaving the countryside for “greener pastures''. Many liberal and reformist members in the Reichstag now fear that we have reached a “point of no return”, with crippling food shortages on the horizon - a consequence of our inaction on the land matter for decades. This impending catastrophe is akin to the farmers’ ailing at the sight of utterly empty grain stores - the “Hollowing'' or “Die Aushöhlung'' as they coined it. Death’s scythe looms over the Empire, and one thing is certain : §RHistory shall look upon us with distress and contempt.§
”Alas! For hunger we die...!”
A Report from the Imperial University of Prague on the Hollowing

”...My trip to the countryside in Erxleben, Magdeburg was a terrible sight. I saw townsfolk there stripped down to the bone with their near lifeless bodies. Eventually, I came across a young couple with the lass weeping, Aghast I was, until I came across their wee motionless babe in the cradle, facing the same tragic fate of the damned. The grain stores were empty. This is strange enough, as decades old documents prove that farms in this area were one of the most productive in the Empire, shockingly. The roads are also laden with carts loaded with disease-ridden corpses, to which I angrily instructed to be disposed of with haste. As me and my colleagues left, I can just sum up this experience as the utter worst a man mustn’t experience in his life, a prime example of Hell on earth...”\n-An excerpt from Heinrich de Bary’s diary, Head of the Special Imperial Commision for Agricultural Affairs
May God help us all.
A Report from the Imperial University of Prague on the Hollowing

”...My trip to the countryside in Erxleben, Magdeburg, once one the most productive agricultural regions in the empire, was a horrible sight. I saw townsfolk there with their still-conscious, but near lifeless bodies wandering for scraps of food they might come across. Eventually, I came across an ailing couple with their newborn offspring, kept alive with whatever sustenance is left, a sight of hope in these trying times, perhaps? The grain stores, as expected, were empty, but thanks to our prior arrangements with local landlords, I believe that relief is on their way soon hopefully. As me and my colleagues left, I can just sum up this experience as the utter worst a man probably mustn’t experience in his life, but I’m still sure a beacon of hope would shine on these poor folk...”\n-An excerpt from Heinrich de Bary’s diary, Head of the Special Imperial Commision for Agricultural Affairs
May God help us all.
A Report from the Imperial University of Prague on the Hollowing

”...My trip to the countryside in Erxleben, Magdeburg, once one the most productive agricultural regions in the empire, was marked with mixed feelings. I saw impoverished townsfolk there jam-packed near the town hall jostling each other near the relief wagon escorted by soldiers at dawn. Eventually, I came across a young couple with their newborn offspring,  rather well fed by the relief aid that came with little food left to the couple themselves. The grain stores, as expected, were nearly empty, being kept alive with grain shipments coming from Magdeburg here and then. As me and my colleagues left, I can sum up verily, we are actually on the right track, perhaps? However it laments me that we could've done much more for these poor folk…”\n-An excerpt from Heinrich de Bary’s diary, Head of the Special Imperial Commision for Agricultural Affairs
Perhaps there is some hope after all!
A Report from the Imperial University of Prague on the Hollowing

”...My trip to the countryside in Erxleben, Magdeburg was marked with hope. I saw townsfolk there jam-packed near the town hall queued up near the relief wagons, enough to feed the entire village for a week, escorted by soldiers at dawn, eagerly waiting for rations - basic sustenance such as grain, milk and a pound of meat for families that “urgently” need it most. Eventually, we interviewed a young couple with their newborn offspring, well fed by the weekly ration dole with enough remaining to feed the rest of their family, in fact. The grain stores were half full despite widespread projections of supply chain disruptions brought upon by the Hollowing. As we left the area, our projections seem favorable at least, but we must exercise caution for any further developments…”\n-An excerpt from Heinrich de Bary’s diary, Head of the Special Imperial Commision for Agricultural Affairs
Gott in Himmel!
The Hollowing hits $PROVINCENAME$!

Accounts of intermittent food shortages have been reported in $PROVINCENAME$! Contrary to the situation in other afflicted areas hardly hit by the plague, the local government stood ready to provide timely aid to “those who need it most”. Accounts of food shortages and famine outbreaks were nearly non-existent, but administrators in the area regardless told people to “remain cautious”. Is this hopefully the end of the Hollowing in the citizens of $PROVINCENAME$?.
Gott in Himmel!
The Hollowing hits $PROVINCENAME$!

Accounts of food shortages have been reported in $PROVINCENAME$! Despite these reports, the local government stood ready to provide timely aid to “those who need it most”. Afflicted areas, like the countryside were given the most aid while the well-off and the landed gentry were encouraged to “donate” their excess food stores to their fellow citizens in need. Despite some areas experiencing severe food shortages, things seem to be stabilizing for the better, and most poor folk take this as a good omen for the times to come.
Für dieses Brot preisen wir dich!
The Hollowing hits $PROVINCENAME$!

Accounts of famine and severe starvation have been reported in $PROVINCENAME$! The local government has seen progress in providing relief to the afflicted, although rather insufficient in alleviating everyone’s suffering. The poor townsfolk, farmers and tradesmen alike have been given enough week’s rations. The rich and well-off meanwhile, set off to greener pastures. All we can do is ultimately watch and observe as the people in our midst succumb to eternal torment and damnation, the most cursed resource of nature.
Für dieses Brot preisen wir dich
The Hollowing hits $PROVINCENAME$!

Accounts of famine and mass starvation have been reported in $PROVINCENAME$! The local government has begun small-scale relief efforts, but otherwise is struggling to properly provide aid in part of Imperial negligence and the corrupt landed bureaucracy. The poor townsfolk are left to starve and rot, The rich and well-off meanwhile, set off to greener pastures. Despite some semblance of “aid”, all we can do ultimately, is watch and observe as the people in our midst succumb to near-eternal torment and damnation, the most cursed resource of nature.
Thoughts and prayers
The Hollowing hits $PROVINCENAME$!

Accounts of famine and starvation of the highest levels have been reported in $PROVINCENAME$! The local government is struggling to properly provide aid due to the famine’s adverse effects on farm yields, compounded by Imperial inaction and the inefficient bureaucracy that has plagued our state thoroughly. All we can do is ultimately watch and observe as the people in our midst succumb to near-eternal torment and damnation, the most cursed resource of nature. We must hold out and hope the situation improves.
Thoughts and prayers
The Hollowing Dies Down in $PROVINCENAME$!

Great news! Our administrative envoys in $PROVINCENAME$ report that the effects of the Hollowing have died down for good. Many remain clueless how the area had managed to recover, with many poor superstitious folk with their prayers answered as a result of clinging on to divine intervention, while experts attest to the stabilization of food prices, timely intervention from the state, even fate, and other ramblings. However, all are certain: the surviving few that weathered this tumultuous page in history are just as privileged and would boast that they have indeed, reigned victorious over Death’s brief rampage in this land
Thank goodness, the worst has come to past!
Ein Silberstreif am Horizont

”...I couldn’t grasp how even minor occurrences, happening at the right place and at the right time, would result in the most disastrous of consequences. These are my thoughts as I saw a butterfly flutter its wings across the windowsill in my study. My sleepless colleagues often joked that this famine may not have even happened after all, had the aristocrats not hogged produce, or if the potato blight had gone to some place such as Ireland instead of plaguing this already doomed Reich. All flattery aside, we have welcomed such good news: our timely intervention and precautions has led to a 70% decrease in the incidence of blight in most farmlands. This is a good sign, as crop yields may recover back to pre-famine levels, even surpassing these thanks to the spread of better farming practices, including the use of organic fertilizers. This is what we needed in these years…” - Excerpt from Heinrich de Bary’s diary, Head of the Special Imperial Commision for Agricultural Affairs.
”...a silver lining in this grim and death-ridden land.”
The Hollowing Declared Over

Newspapers, left and right, regardless of their biases and printed dialects have their headlines printed in screaming bold text : THE END OF THE HOLLOWING. As bold and pretentious this message can be to the average literate
column3: from an illiterate’s perspective - a farmer perhaps, it was a reprieve from “the greatest tragedy ever happened to man.” The lucky surviving few on the other hand relished themselves reminiscing the memories of their bereaved loved one. Most are still trying to make amends with their finances and other various struggles while the privileged few return to their old devices. Everyone, despite all the vestiges of sorrow and distraught that the Hollowing left on the Reich, are just relieved at the relative normalcy that is slowly settling in their minds.

column2: The worst has finally passed us.
A Return to Normalcy

With the Hollowing’s distraught on the Reich’s domains finally brought to the close, it seems that the sense of normalcy has finally taken shape on the various lands throughout Germany, hopefully never to experience such a Hell on Earth once more.
Finally! We shall all breathe a sigh of relief.
The End of the Dutch Famine

The Netherlands have seen much suffering in recent years, but recovery has come at last. The final remnants of the social and economic having wreaked upon the Dutch provinces are fading away. The memories shall persist far longer, and when the survivors pass away, the stories shall remain forever, but now it can truly be said that life in the Netherlands has returned to normal.
Let us give thanks for those who remain and pray for the departed.
The Tenth Imperial Incident : Panic in Prague

The Black Horseman of Famine is riding through the Empire, as the combination of a severe potato blight and years of aberrant weather conditions have devastated crops all over Germany. Not since the Great Famine of 1315-1317 has Europe seen such a cataclysm. Our subjects are clamoring for support but the weakened and divided state of the Imperial government gives us few options. One of the only things which we might be able to do is force an immediate abolition of serfdom across the Empire by Imperial decree. Serfdom has already been curtailed in some Imperial Estates as well as the Bohemian Crown Lands, so this would not be an unprecedented act. It is hoped that by releasing peasants from obligations to their landlords, we can at least prevent the worst excesses of the nobility by disabling their ability to charge rents or taxes through foodstuffs. Of course the nobles themselves will be infuriated by this unilateral action but their rage matters little if we have no subjects to govern.
§RThe Imperial throne is not powerless yet. Abolish serfdom!§
Provoke a civil war DURING a famine? Are you mad?
Damnation

”They have blown the trumpet, even to make all ready : but none goeth to the battle : for my wrath is upon all the multitude thereof. The sword is without, and the pestilence and the famine within : he that is in the field shall die with the sword : and he that is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him. But they that escape of them shall escape, and shall be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them mourning, every one for his iniquity. All hands shall be feeble, and all knees shall be weak as water.” - Ezekiel 7 : 14-17\nGermany is starving to death. No animal is heard - they were the first to be eaten. Some say that even human flesh has been consumed. Perhaps Sigismund could have prevented the worst of the famine. But he did not. He drove the Empire to ruin. Now, like a man struck dumb, he can only bear witness to the suffering, to the endless waves of death, to the Hollowing of Germany.
”I never knew you : depart from me, ye that work iniquity.”
The Death of John IV of Münster

Duke Johan IV of Münster was a strange man. He lived in Anvers during the Great German War and upon his return he filled his court with Burgundian intellectuals. He has also had tuberculosis since 1835, and refused any treatment from a German doctor. Last evening he finally passed away. His heir and cousin, Dietrich VI, whose derangement is an open secret and who lacks any political education, now must appoint a new chancellor, a task which might be hijacked by various factions. The “Magdeburg Circle” is popular among the bourgeois of Münster who seek to reconcile us with Prague to integrate the duchy’s economy into the larger Elbian landscape. The “Frisian” faction supports closer integration of Münster into the Protestant Rhineland and thus with Burgundy. A third, tiny fringe interest group is interested solely in self-preservation and wants to exploit the crisis to push for empowerment of the senate in order to eventually abolish the monarchy. All three are now squabbling and the realm under Dietrich’s “leadership” is rudderless.
As if we lacked perils…!
The Eleventh Imperial Incident : Chaos in Münster

The Duchy of Münster was formed when the Prince-Bishop Franz von Waldeck of Münster converted to Protestantism in the 17th century and was subsequently ennobled in exchange for secularizing his realm. Now the Burgundophile Duke Johan IV has died from tuberculosis. His heir is his mentally ill cousin Dietrich VI, a man with no political education, and thus the realm has fallen into disputes between political factions. The Jagiellon loyalists of the “Magdeburg Circle,” composed of Münster’s bourgeois, have requested immediate aid to suppress the pro-Burgundy “Frisian” faction and the insurgent republicans. While we could in theory scrounge up enough of the Reichsarmee to deploy to Münster, the utter devastation of the Empire would make their deployment a Herculean effort that would occupy resources desperately needed elsewhere. §RIf we had previously promised to respect Burgundy’s presence in the Rhine region then betraying them may be unwise…§
§RSend troops to support the Bourgeois petition.§
We can spare no resources for Münster…
The Münster Revolution

The Duchy of Münster has had a turbulent history, having been formed when the Prince-Bishop Franz von Waldeck of Münster converted to Protestantism in the 17th century and was subsequently ennobled in exchange for secularizing his realm. As a rare pro-Imperial Protestant he was largely left alone, but his heirs have been less shrewd. Now the Burgundophile Duke John IV, who spent the entire Great German War living in Anvers and who filled his court with Burgundians, has died from tuberculosis. His heir is his mentally ill cousin Dietrich VI, a man with no political education, and thus the realm has fallen into disputes between political factions. Now the pro-Burgundian “Frisian” faction and the insurgent republicans have incited violent rebellions against the loyalist bourgeois of the “Magdeburg Circle.” All $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence within the duchy has been eliminated.
Is there no peace to be found anywhere in Germany!?
The Fate of Münster

It appears that the Emperor has been unable to assist the Magdeburg Circle. Neither civil nor military aid has been delivered to them, and thus the bourgeois of Munster have seen their power shattered by their rivals. The imperial loyalists may have been defeated, but multiple other parties are still contending for supremacy. The “Frisian Group” is the most well-organized, but the defeat of their rivals has encouraged factional splintering amongst themselves. A group of dissatisfied ex-Frisians has formed what they call the “Free Munster Group,” looking to neither Burgundy nor the Emperor but Scandinavia to safeguard Munster from foreign encroachment. The realization that both factions are courting non-German powers has led many people to turn to the republicans to preserve some semblance of Munster’s independence.
The Frisians take power on behalf of Dietrich VI.
A pro-Scandinavian Munster is a free Munster!
Only a republic can save us from foreign greed!
The Saxon Destiny

Germany has been laid low by the cataclysm of famine, but even in the most disastrous of storms, there is always a silver lining. Not just the princes but even the lofty Emperor has suffered as of late, and the Imperial throne is now weaker than ever before. The Ernestine Union of Thuringia, that unnatural imperial project which Sigismund intended to use as a prototype for reorganizing the Empire into his personal dominion, is now vulnerable. With the Emperor enfeebled, the Ewiger Landfriede can be safely ignored. Now is our chance to unite the Saxons! Perhaps such a victory could even serve as a step towards a greater German unity…
Our new kingdom awaits!
Cracks around the Edges

The Empire is falling apart at the seams. What were once local disagreements between towns and princes now routinely explode into violent clashes. Multiple regions of the empire have begun forming defensive pacts independent of their Imperial obligations - not just against foreign threats, but even against rival princes. Now the Elector of Lüneberg has declared open war against the Ernestine Union of Thuringia to “unite the Saxon people,” an act which would have been unthinkable less than a decade ago. There will be no Reichstag vote on the matter, no deployment of the Reichsarmee to halt the chaos before blood can be spilled. The Ewiger Landfriede is but a memory. The Empire now struggles just to pull itself along from one day to the next : intervention in this matter is impossible. We must guard what little remains of our strength for the coming trials, for surely our weakness has not gone unnoticed.
”Wars, terrible wars, and the Tiber foaming with much blood…”
The Saxon Brothers’ War

All of Germany may be in the grip of the most brutal famine in our history, but even with all of the other animals long since slaughtered, vultures abound. No greater evidence of this can be found than the conduct of  the Electorate of Lüneberg, which has now attacked us in an unprovoked war of aggression! They claim that the “Ernestine Union of Thuringia” is an unnatural state conceived as some sinister tool of Imperial domination, and have set out to “unify the Saxon people” by the sword. The Emperor has grown too weak to protect us any longer through the Ewiger Landfriede : we alone must stand for ourselves.
Zum krieg!
Burgundian Outrage

We had previously signed a secret treaty with Burgundy, the Reichstadt Convention, in which we bought their support for our reclamation of Pomerania at the Congress of Venice in exchange for giving up on Hungary and permitting Burgundian influence in the Rhine region. For one reason or another we found it necessary to break this treaty. This has infuriated the Burgundians who have decided to cease all pretensions of holding anything but hostility towards the Empire. Today the Burgundian ambassador to the Empire was officially recalled, and relations between Anvers and Prague have just reached their lowest point since the run-up to the Great German War. The Burgundians are now watching us like hawks, waiting for any possible pretext to attack us.
It was just a scrap of paper…!
Austrian Outrage

We had previously made an agreement with the Archduchy of Austria to support them in all disputes with their neighbors within the Empire going forwards, chiefly with Bavaria. For one reason or another we found it necessary to break that promise. This has infuriated the Austrians who have publicly revealed the details of our agreement. The backlash against Austria’s involvement has been to an extent drowned out by the mounting fury amongst the Danubian princes, who are enraged that we ever consented to engage in such blatant favoritism and moreover that we did so in secret. None are more irate than Bavaria, Austria’s main rival. Both realms have now expelled all Imperial functionaries and appear to be on the verge of open rebellion against us.
It was just a scrap of paper…!
Götterdämmerung

Ever since the end of the Great German War, the Danubian princes - especially Austria and Bavaria - have chafed at our authority, becoming hotbeds of German nationalism. Now they have gone even further than Lüneberg dared to go. Not content to merely wage war or claim territory within the Empire, they have formed a united Danubian Confederation and announced their independence. Already all Imperial functionaries and troops have been expelled to the crown lands of Bohemia, and all border crossings fortified.\n§RThe hour of the Empire’s destiny is at hand. Accepting this development would mean accepting nothing less than the death of the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation. Ordering general mobilization will draw in foreign powers and plunge the continent into carnage.§
We have no choice. Prepare the abdication.
§RTHIS IS TREASON! ORDER GENERAL MOBILIZATION, NOW!§
The End of the Holy Roman Empire

”Who can bear this disgrace, which weighs down upon a nation which was once so glorious? - may God improve things, if it is still possible to improve them!”\nThe beloved child of Otto the Great has finally expired. The formation of the Danubian Confederation proved what everyone in Europe already knew : the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation was dead. Many feared that the Jagiellons would wage one last, desperate war to preserve it, but Sigismund seems to have finally developed a semblance of wisdom. This morning he announced his abdication as Emperor. Few electors seem willing to convene the Reichstag to elect a successor, especially considering that one of them, Bavaria, has already left the Empire. While Sigismund shall continue to rule Bohemia, never again shall he or anyone else wear the Reichskrone. It is the end of almost a millennium of Imperial history, and Europe shall never be the same again.
”Ni saint, ni romain, ni empire.” - Crown Prince Jean de Bouillon
The Emperor Proclaims a Reichsexekutionskrieg

The actions of Austria and Bavaria, and their defiance of Imperial authority, can no longer be tolerated. With firm evidence of their insubordination in hand, we have obtained a judgment from the Reichshofrat (Aulic Council), the highest Imperial court, demanding that both Imperial Estates hand over any individuals suspected of treason against the Emperor. Austria and Bavaria will of course never accept, and thus we have compelled the Reichstag to formally declare a Reichsexekutionskrieg against the Danubian princes, authorizing the Reichsarmee to enter their borders and force them to obey. This is a direct violation of Article III of the Treaty of Paris, which disavowed using the Reichsarmee to enforce internal Reichsexekutions. Word of our actions is already spreading in Anvers, Copenhagen, and Paris - in fact we have just received the Anglois ambassador, who has informed us that, due to our breach of the treaty, the Anglois-Imperial alliance is now null and void. The shadow of war is once again falling over Europe.
The Empire must be restored, §Rno matter the cost!§
Terminal Imperial Overextension

Many people, most of all the Chancellor, have repeatedly cautioned Emperor Sigismund V against delving too deeply into the local affairs of the Imperial Estates. Yet he and his followers pressed on, believing in the dream of a true Imperial restoration in defiance of liberalism and German nationalism. It is unfortunate that even emperors have limits. The recent interposition of Prague in an Imperial dispute has taxed the Imperial court’s resources to the breaking point - and beyond. Opposition to Imperial overreach is now at an all time high, as both upper and lower classes denounce the Emperor as a grasping tyrant. §RWorst of all, the Great Powers of Europe are growing to see the threat of a reborn Holy Roman Empire as unacceptable, and, if the reports of our agents in their capitals are true, are beginning to prepare to strike against us…§
§RThere is no turning back now.§
The Coming Storm over Prague

”Remember that you are a chosen people! Today I know neither German nor Czech, only blessed subjects of our most Holy Empire! The spirit of the Lord has descended upon me. I am the instrument of the Most High. I am His sword, His representative. Woe and death to all those who resist my will! Woe and death to those who do not believe in my mission! Woe and death to the cowards! Let them perish, all the enemies of the Imperial people! God demands their destruction - God who, through my mouth, commands you to execute His will.” - Emperor Sigismund V\n\nWe have completely broken the Treaty of Paris, and now the guns of Europe are turning upon us. General mobilization has been declared throughout the Crown Lands of Bohemia and all Imperial realms still loyal to Prague. The condition of the whole nation is that of a great armed camp, tense and waiting for battle.
A sword, drawn…
The Coming Storm over Anvers

”Soldiers of Burgundy! We place our faith in you. It is your valour which makes this possible, for your heroic determination shall be the indispensable condition to our success. Upon it depends our future victory. Upon the vast theatre of Europe, thanks to you, there exists a situation out of which will spring the definite triumph of our cause. We make one more appeal to your courage, your ardour, your spirit of sacrifice, your love of country. Go forth and strive with all your might to shatter the desperate efforts of an enemy already in disorder.” - Crown Prince Jean\n\nThe Jagiellons have scorned the Treaty of Paris and are preparing to wage war on all dissident Imperial princes, something we cannot allow. General mobilization has been declared throughout the Kingdom of Burgundy. A delegation has already left for Scandinavia to affirm our alliance, and a flying column has been marshaled to occupy Oldenburg to secure our flank.
A spear, hefted…
The Coming Storm over Oldenburg

”We have a proper sense of our duty, and the means to carry it out. We have mapped our own course and we intend to keep to it. Ours is a policy of enlightenment and progress, not of darkness and reversion. From this moment on, we and our allies are fighting for our national existence. I do not for a moment believe that any man will hesitate to step forward and, with a heart filled with courage, join the ranks of our defenders.” - Duke Albrecht I\nThe Emperor has disavowed the Treaty of Paris and is preparing to attack all “dissident” princes within the Empire to reunify it under his rule, something that we cannot accept. But we do not fight alone. This morning a Burgundian army arrived in the capital to support our nation against the tyrant Sigismund. Though many Oldenburgers protest that the Burgundians have come as occupiers, not protectors, our Duke welcomes their aid.
A shield, raised…
The Coming Storm over Copenhagen

“Let us realize that we are fighting as a united realm in a cause worthy of the highest traditions of our people. Let us recall the memories of the great men and deeds of the past, commemorated in the monuments of our cities. Let us recall the last triumphant words of General Sven af Mannerheim, who said, after his victory in Holstein : ‘Scandinavia has saved herself by her exertions and will, as I trust, save Europe by her example.’ Our nation gave a noble answer to his appeal, and did not sheathe the sword until the freedom of Europe was secured. Let us go and do likewise.” - Prime Minister Joel Olsen\n\nThe Jagiellons have disavowed the Treaty of Paris and are preparing to attack all dissident princes of the Empire to reunify it under their control. We cannot permit this! General mobilization has been declared throughout the United Kingdom of Scandinavia and Scotland, as we make ready to once again march south against the Empire.
...and a hammer, lifted.
The Coming Storm over Germany

The signs are unmistakable : The European mood has turned from passive opposition of the Emperor’s attempts to reunify and centralize the Empire to active hostility. Not since the days of Dahlke’s revolutionary dictatorship has despair so continuously stalked the streets and fields of our nation. While we could cling to neutrality, we would be at the mercy of whichever power prevails in the coming struggle. Thus if we want to arbitrate our own destiny then we must cast our lot either with the Emperor, or with his enemies, led by the Kingdom of Burgundy and the United Kingdom of Scandinavia and Scotland. If the Emperor prevails, then our autonomy shall surely be forfeit as the Empire is consolidated back into the unified state of the past. If the Emperor fails, then…well, who knows what will happen?
God forgive us, but the Burgundians are our only hope.
Burgundy may protect us but our hearts lie with Scandinavia.
The Emperor is our liege, right or wrong. God help us all.
Here I stand : I can do no other. God help me. Amen.
The Second Great German War

”I look on myself as an instrument of the Almighty and go on my way regardless of transient opinions and views…In the present social confusion, it may come about that I order you to shoot down your own relatives, brothers or parents but even then you must follow my orders without a murmur. There is only one person who is master in this Empire and I am not going to tolerate any other.” - Emperor Sigismund V\n\nAt the end of the 18th century, Marinus Dahlke seized the Holy Roman Empire and proclaimed an Imperial Republic. No sooner had Europe felled him than Emperor Wenceslaus V took up the cause of Imperial unification, but he, too, fell. Now his son, Sigismund V, has ignited a new, awful and terrible war to finish what his father started. As the first shots ring out across the Danube, crowned heads from Londres to Copenhagen tremble at the realization that the maw of Hell has once again opened to devour a new generation.
”Behold a pale horse : and his name that sat on him was Death…”
A New Reichskrieg

We were told that the Great German War was a unique cataclysm. We were told that the Treaty of Paris and the Treaty of Venice would inaugurate a new era of international peace and brotherhood. We were lied to. Germany is once again awash in a sea of blood, with the Emperor on one side and Burgundy and Scandinavia on the other. Naturally, the foreigners pose the greatest threat to us - if they are victorious then Germans shall be slaves to alien masters forever. As such the Reichstag has voted to declare a Reichskrieg, a state of war encompassing the whole Empire and which requires all its constituent states to fight beneath the Imperial banner against the enemy. Therefore it is with heavy hearts that we must once again take up the sword in service to the Emperor of the German Nation, and place our forces at his disposal…unless there might be a way to take advantage of this crisis?
Der Reichskrieg ist unser krieg!
Perhaps we should conserve our strength…
Saxony Reaffirms Her Loyalty to the Empire!

Although we are standing against a new coalition of enemies the likes of which has not been seen since Wenceslaus V’s reign, we may take comfort in the knowledge that there remain loyal princes within the Empire. The Reichstag recently voted to declare an official Reichskrieg against our enemies, a formal state of war across the Empire requiring all of its constituent states to supply forces for the Reichsarmee. This morning Crown Prince Rupprecht II of Saxony arrived in Prague at the head of the Saxon royal guard to take his place within the Reichsarmee, and confirmed that all Saxon forces are at the Emperor’s disposal. As the call to arms goes out across the Empire, we can only hope that other states shall show as much fidelity as the Saxons.
Thank God for Saxony!
A New Reichskrieg

We were told that the Great German War was a unique cataclysm. We were told that the Treaty of Paris and the Treaty of Venice would inaugurate a new era of international peace and brotherhood. We were lied to. Germany is once again awash in a sea of blood, with the Emperor on one side and Burgundy and Scandinavia on the other. Naturally, the Emperor poses the greatest threat to us - his victory would reduce us to a mere province within a centralized Empire. While the Reichstag has voted to declare a Reichskrieg against Burgundy and Scandinavia, a formal Empire-wide state of war which theoretically obligates all member states to consolidate within the Reichsarmee, we need not obey. As a matter of fact, it is within our interests to let Burgundy and Scandinavia’s forces pass through our realm on their way to battle. Better their men fight and die than our own, after all - §Respecially given that, since we are so hostile to Imperial power, a victory by the Emperor would not be in our interests.§
§RThere will be no foreign soldiers in $COUNTRY$.§
Good luck to them.
The Treaty of Anvers - Ruinatio Imperii

”And thou, Pashur, and all that dwell in thine house shall go into captivity : and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou shalt die, and shalt be buried there, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied lies.” - Jeremiah 20 : 6\n\nThe Second Great German War has ended in the murder of the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation. “Neither holy, nor Roman, nor an empire,” so its critics have described it, and now it is a fact. The Reichsarmee was ground into dust by the invaders and now all of Germany is in disarray. In fulfillment of the terms of the Treaty of Anvers, the Lands of the Crown of Bohemia are under joint Burgundian-Scandinavian occupation, Sigismund V has abdicated as Emperor, and the Reichstag was convened for a final time - not to elect a successor, but to vote to permanently dissolve the Holy Roman Empire. May God have mercy on the German people tomorrow, for today He has cast them into darkness.
Memento mori.
The Treaty of Londres - Mors Voluntaria Imperii

”They sent forth men to battle, but no such men return : And home, to claim their welcome, come ashes in an urn.” - Aeschlyus, ‘Agamemnon’\n\nThe Second Great German War has raged across the heart of Europe, but it has come to nothing. Neither Emperor Sigismund V nor his enemies in Burgundy and Scandinavia could prevail over the other. Both sides have now recognized this stalemate and have met in Londres to establish peace terms. While in theory neither side made concessions, there was never any doubt what the consequences of failure would be for Sigismund. With a republican revolution by the outraged people of Bohemia imminent, he chose to abdicate as Emperor. The Reichstag shows no sign of being convened to elect a successor, and therefore the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation has been the final casualty of the worst war of our era. It is the end of almost a millennium of Imperial history and Europe shall never be the same again.
The grimmest joke of all.
The Treaty of Prague - Renovatio Imperii

”Pacem sine dubio post haec, verum cruentam.” - Tacitus, ‘Annals’\n\nThe Second Great German War has ended in the complete resurrection of the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation. Europe, indeed the entire world, is still reeling from the shock of Emperor Sigismund V’s overwhelming victory against the anti-Imperial coalition led by Burgundy and Scandinavia. In a lavish ceremony in Prague, all of the princes and bishops of the Empire, as well as the rulers of Burgundy and Scandinavia, paid homage to Sigismund and confirmed his status as the undisputed sovereign of the Holy Roman Empire. His Holiness the Pope personally appointed Sigismund Knight of the Supreme Order of Christ, the highest honor which the Papacy can bestow, and even the Anglois monarch was in attendance, awestruck (or perturbed) by the festivities. It is the restoration of a truly united Empire after over six hundred years, and Europe will never be the same again.
Vivat Imperator Sigismundus V, Restitutor Orbis!
The Fall of the Holy Roman Empire

The Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation has been a constant fixture in Europe for close to a millennium - but no longer. Emperor Sigismund V has abdicated and the Electors have openly refused to convene in order to nominate a successor, resulting in the Imperial title lapsing into oblivion and the Empire with it. The Reichskrone has been deposited in the former Imperial Museum in Prague, never again to be worn, and the various Imperial states, from the tiniest Free Cities to the vast Lands of the Crown of Bohemia, have been left to determine their own destiny. While the end of the Empire means one less Great Power in Europe, the future of Bohemia and of the German people is now cloudier than ever. We must adjust our plans accordingly.
The end of an era…
The Fall of the Empire of the German Nation

The Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation has been a constant fixture in Europe for close to a millennium - but no longer. Emperor Sigismund V has abdicated and the Electors have openly refused to nominate a successor, resulting in the Imperial title lapsing into oblivion and the Empire with it. The Reichskrone has been deposited in the former Imperial Museum in Prague, never again to be worn, and the various Imperial states, from the tiniest Free Cities to the vast Lands of the Crown of Bohemia, have been left to determine their own destiny. It now falls to the German people to continue onwards into the future, without either the protection or the predation of Prague.
We shall rise from the Empire’s ruins!
The End of the Holy Roman Empire

Ever since the death of Henry the Venerable in 1002, Burgundy has felt the Imperial eagle breathing down her neck, always seeking to steal back our lands for the Empire. Never again! Today the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation was officially dissolved, marking the conclusion of the most brutal and savage war which Europe has seen in generations. As cheering crowds across Burgundy celebrate the conclusion of hostilities, the more farsighted ministers ponder the future of Europe. The end of the Empire leaves an unprecedented vacuum of power in Germany, after all, and nature abhors a vacuum. Perhaps the time is coming for Burgundy, not Bohemia, to claim a different type of imperial mantle. Whatever the case, let us celebrate the return of peace and the demise of our ancient rival!
Long live Burgundy!
The End of the Holy Roman Empire

Ever since the Middle Ages, when the Danes were forced to construct massive earthwork fortifications to deter a German invasion, Scandinavia has felt the Imperial eagle breathing down her neck, always seeking to pry away our southern lands. Never again! Today the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation was officially dissolved, marking the conclusion of the most brutal and savage war which Europe has seen in generations. As cheering crowds across Scandinavia celebrate the conclusion of hostilities, the more farsighted ministers ponder the future of Europe. The end of the Empire leaves an unprecedented vacuum of power in Germany, after all, and nature abhors a vacuum. Perhaps the time is coming for Scandinavia, not Bohemia, to claim a different type of imperial mantle. Whatever the case, let us celebrate the return of peace and the demise of our ancient rival!
Long live Scandinavia!
The End of the Holy Roman Empire

For almost a millennium, the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation has been a constant fixture in European politics, its power waxing and waning through the ages. No longer. Today the Empire was officially dissolved after failing to overcome the anti-Imperial coalition led by Burgundy and Scandinavia, marking the conclusion of the Second Great German War. As tales of horrific carnage across the heart of Europe make their way to our headlines, we are left to ponder the future of Europe. The end of the Empire leaves an unprecedented vacuum of power in Germany, one which the victorious powers shall no doubt seek to fill. The Empire may not have endeared herself to us, but the disruption of the balance of European power raises the question of whether we were better off with her than without her.
Rest in peace.
Revocation of the Privilegia

Nobody thought it possible, but somehow, against all expectations, the Emperor has defeated all challengers and restored his role as unquestioned leader of the Empire. His first order of business after the guns of Europe were once again silenced was to immediately force a mind-bending series of laws through the Reichstag, which has been filled with sycophantic representatives, that have effectively reduced us to mere puppets of Prague. The days of our autonomy beneath the Imperial banner are at an end.
We are all Imperial subjects now more than ever…
Our Greatest Failure

Nobody thought it possible, but somehow, against all expectations, we have been defeated by the forces of the Empire. There will be no respite for us, not after Sigismund and his pompous band dragged our ministers to Prague to sign a disgraceful peace treaty. The Jagiellons are now free to centralize the realm back under one ruler as it once was under Wenceslaus V, and our citizens are irate at the level of carnage and privation which we subjected them to only to suffer defeat. The Burgundian project in Germany is at an end, for now the Imperial eagle rises…
Ni saint ni romain, mais un empire.
Our Greatest Failure

Nobody thought it possible, but somehow, against all expectations, we have been defeated by the forces of the Empire. There will be no respite for us, not after Sigismund and his pompous band dragged our ministers to Prague to sign a disgraceful peace treaty. The Jagiellons are now free to centralize the realm back under one ruler as it once was under Wenceslaus V, and our citizens are irate at the level of carnage and privation which we subjected them to only to suffer defeat. The Scandinavian project in Germany is at an end, for now the Imperial eagle rises…
What is to become of us? Of Europe?
The Eastern Menace

It has been almost six hundred years since the Holy Roman Empire was unified - ignoring Wenceslaus V’s experiment - but in its prime it was the undisputed greatest power of Europe. Now that era does not feel so remote, as Emperor Sigismund V has done what both Marinus Dahlke and his father Wenceslaus V could not, curtailing the autonomy of all Imperial Estates and centralizing the Empire into a true nation-state. We have been the historical friends of the Jagiellons, but the so-called “Renovatio Imperii” has destroyed the balance of power in Europe. Where, our ministers speculate, will the reborn Empire’s ambitions end? Their frontiers once stretched as far west as the Rhône River and as far south as the Papal States, after all. Even Marinus Dahlke claimed the entire Kingdom of Burgundy! If we are to preserve our natural role as the arbitrator of the European order, then we must regard the Empire as our newest, most dangerous rival.
