Liberals of all types have decried the Wittelsbach monarchy as a fetter upon the Bavarian nation, and radicals are now calling for the establishment of a republic! The situation has provoked the Duke-Elector into finalizing the draft our our new constitution and preparing for its immediate publication to restore stability.
We must persevere!
The Electoral Proclamation

After years of consultation and labor by the Duke-Elector and his staff, the constitutional proclamation is ready. In this document is infused not merely the efforts of a collection of individuals, but the fate and the future of Bavaria. Crowds flock to Munich for a chance to witness the most historic event of their generation, flooding the streets surrounding the Imperial Palace. At noon sharp, the Duke-Elector appears at the front balcony of the palace, and begins to read…
Well? What is he saying?
The Affirmation of Absolutism

”...The person of the Duke-Elector is sacred, inviolable, and domestically sovereign in responsibility. The Duke-Elector makes war or peace. Throughout the realm, justice is administered in the name of the Duke-Elector…”\nThe new “constitution” of the Electorate of Bavaria is not really a constitution at all. It has not advanced any new rights for the people, and in fact has curtailed political liberties to a degree not seen since the eighteenth century. When the assembled crowd began to grow unruly at this revelation, they were dispersed - not by the Munich city guard, but by the ducal Bavarian army. Liberal organizations across Bavaria have gone back underground, and the mood of the nation has dramatically soured. Some have made dark comparisons to the days of 1790, on the eve of the Imperial Revolution...
This was the only way to preserve public order.
A Limited Constitution

”We Wilhelm the Fourth, by God's grace, Duke and Elector of Bavaria, et cetera, et cetera, according to the urgent demands of public welfare, taking into account as possible those of the representatives of the people extensive preparatory work to issue the following constitutional document have decided, subject to the revision of the same in the final proper legislative routes. We therefore announce the constitution for the Bavarian state as follows…”\nThe new constitution has addressed the major demands of the liberals. Ducal power has been weakened and the Landtag empowered, but the nobility-aligned House of Councillors has been given the bulk of legislative power rather than the more open House of Representatives. Liberals remain dissatisfied but a significant amount of Bavarians are simply relieved that the monarch is willing to listen to the people.
Progress, nonetheless!
The People’s Constitution

”Bavarians are equal before the law, whatever may be their titles and ranks. They contribute, without distinction, in proportion to their fortunes, towards the expenses of the state. They are all equally admissible to civil and military employment. Their personal liberty is likewise guaranteed - no one can be prosecuted or arrested save in the cases provided by law and in the form which it prescribes. Everyone may profess his religion with equal freedom…The legislative power is exercised collectively by the Duke and Elector, and the Landtag, comprised of the House of Councillors and the House of Representatives…”\nThe Duke-Elector has surrendered almost all of his authority. The legislature has been empowered, universal male suffrage granted, censorship abolished - even independent trade unions are now legal! Needless to say the Empire is aghast at this sudden liberal resurgence, and we have effectively become a pariah state.
But, my God, how the people cheered!
Major Protests in Munich

Liberal anger at the shortcomings of the new constitution ran far deeper than the Duke-Elector or his ministers had believed. People who once considered themselves to be moderates and reformists are now gravitating towards republicanism, believing that the monarchy will never voluntarily devolve the entirety of its authority onto a democratic government. Across Bavaria, rumors are circulating of secret societies being formed by attendees of the Innsbruck Festival, societies whose goal is to lay the grounds for a republican revolution. Munich has been hit particularly hard by republican unrest, with regular protests in the city streets bringing day-to-day business to a halt. §RThe only reason that the violence might de-escalate is that the more moderate liberals wish to put their grievances aside in the name of pan-German nationalism. If German unification turns out to not address their problems, then liberal agitation may return with a vengeance.§
We must watch ourselves around the liberals going forwards…
The Passau Meeting, or the Second German Council

Following the end of the Council of the Nations of Germany in Munich and the Salzburg crisis that followed, the Bavarian and Austrian governments agreed on a future meeting in Passau, a city both important to the Archduke and the Duke-Elector. Expectations are high on both sides, even though many wonder what the Austrians will think of the Electoral Proclamation and the events that followed. While romanticists have described this prospective summit as a “Second German Council,” it is in truth a more bilateral affair between ourselves. Yet its importance still cannot be understated : success here may open the way for the peaceful unification of our states within a joint confederation. §REven if we succeed, the Jagiellons will not be pleased by the formation of a nationalist state on their border. But, the plight of Germany demands action!§
And Passau is always nice to visit!
The Passau Meeting, or the Second German Council

Following the end of the Council of the Nations of Germany in Munich and the Salzburg crisis that followed, the Bavarian and Austrian governments agreed on a future meeting in Passau, a city both important to the Archduke and the Duke-Elector. Expectations are high on both sides, even though the Austrian government has yet to comment on the recent Bavarian Proclamation and the Electorate’s new administration. While romanticists have described this prospective summit as a “Second German Council,” it is in truth a more bilateral affair between ourselves. Yet its importance still cannot be understated : success here may open the way for the peaceful unification of our states within a joint confederation.  §REven if we succeed, the Jagiellons will not be pleased by the formation of a nationalist state on their border. But, the plight of Germany demands action!§
And Passau is always nice to visit!
Failure of the Second German Council

Bavaria has become astonishingly liberal since the First German Council, a fact that went neither unnoticed nor unremarked upon by the Austrian delegation. In fact the new Bavarian government - and the conditions which it attempted to put forth for the unification of the Danube - proved to be totally unreasonable. Much of the Austrian entourage has already departed for Vienna, and it is likely that Passau will stand as a monument to yet another failure by the pan-German nationalist movement. It is rumored that our head of state is planning to personally meet with his opposite Austrian number in the name of German unity. If this rumor is false then the only option to unite the Danubian Circle may be through iron and blood - if true, then the German people may yet snatch victory from the jaws of defeat.
Our collective fatherland hangs in the balance.
Negotiations Proceed in Passau

We have maintained stability in the Danubian Circle since the First German Council, a fact positively remarked upon by the Austrian delegation. So far it seems that both of our nations have recognized our common ground in the name of building German unity and resisting both the Jagiellons and foreign powers such as Burgundy and Scandinavia. However all the good will in the world cannot determine whether or not the Austrians will accept our proposal for unification within a single confederation. Now we can only try our best to convince them of the honesty of our intentions, and that the benefits of unity outweigh the risks.
Austria, Germany’s hope is in your hands!
The Bavarian Plea

The Bavarian head of state has made an appearance at the temporary residence of our own leader in Passau. There the two men engaged in a passionate conversation regarding Austria, Bavaria, the Danube region, and Germany at large. The thrust of his argument is that German unity is so important that we both must moderate our negotiating positions and accept that neither Austria or Bavaria will be able to completely arbitrate the future constitution of our prospective confederation. He has expressed empathy with Austria’s unique political position and culture, and sworn that the Bavarians desire an equal, equitable, and fair system, “just as your people, just as all of the German people, do.” Eventually, our head of state stood up from his chair, and said…
§R”Even in the face of Armageddon, I shall never compromise.”§
§d”Sir, henceforth I shall call you my friend and my brother!”§
Negotiations in Nassau Come to a Head

We have now largely determined the prospective constitution of the unified Danubian nation which we seek to construct. If adopted, it would establish a confederation reserving significant powers to local governments, but still placing essential powers of legislation in the hands of the confederal legislature. The mood amongst the whole Austrian delegation is that we have reached the point of no return. If we do not withdraw from negotiations now then we will be committing ourselves to unification with Bavaria. Given that the prospective confederation would be a stepping stone to the consolidation of all of Germany, we would also face a Reichsexekution - an official Imperial judgment by the Imperial Aulic Council, the highest court in the Empire, against us. And though the Treaty of Paris ostensibly forbids it, we could even face a Reichsexekutionkrieg, a sanctioned war by the Emperor against us…
§REnough! This was madness from the beginning! Withdraw at once!§
§hOne people we shall be, one band of brothers!§
Failure of the Second German Council

The governments and desires of Austria and Bavaria have proved irreconcilable. To the horror of pan-German nationalists everywhere, the meeting in Passau has ended in failure, with both of our delegations departing with nothing to show for their efforts except for bitterness. However, the collapse of the council by no means marks the end of pro-unification sentiment. If anything, it has cemented it in the minds of the Austrian and the Bavarian people. The difference is that, now, the unity of both the Danubian Circle and of Germany is spoken of in darker tones, in tones of iron and blood, of manifest destiny. §RA military confrontation between Austria and Bavaria is now inevitable.§
The Bavarians have nobody to blame but themselves!
Failure of the Second German Council

The Austrian government has steadfastly refused to make any political compromises for the sake of German unity, demanding instead that our government realign towards their own regime. Therefore we have been left with no choice but to depart from Passau in anger and plan our next move. One way or another, the people of the Danubian Circle must be united. We had hoped that this could be done through diplomacy, but the failure of our negotiations means that only force shall be able to settle the issue.
We must look for an opportunity…
Success of the Second German Council

The day long awaited by pan-German nationalists everywhere is closer than ever, as Austria and Bavaria concluded a series of negotiations in Passau resulting in the groundwork for the unification of the Danubian Circle under a confederal structure. Both nations have agreed to create a united government which will oversee matters such as foreign policy, taxation, and infrastructure development, and the transformation of the Danubian Circle Diet into a proper national Landtag. The formation of a “Danubian Confederation,” a country which may very well be the cornerstone of a future German nation-state, is no longer a theoretical possibility, but instead an imminent reality. For the first time since the days of Marinus Dahlke, a new power may soon arise within the Empire itself to challenge the Jagiellons for the destiny of Germany.
The German people are standing up at last!
The Second Salzburg Incident

Our rule in Salzburg has become unstable. Despite the annexation of the principality, liberal revolutionaries began to regroup. They have demanded either the adoption of a constitution so radical that it would end the monarch’s influence in politics, or the outright abolition of the monarchy. After a recent Mass in which the Archbishop of Salzburg severely criticized the liberal movement, a protest occurred outside of St. Peter’s Abbey during a meeting of Salzburg religious authorities. The Archbishop summoned the city guards, but this time several revolutionaries in the crowd came armed and engaged in a shootout with the police, with several priests caught in the crossfire. In the aftermath, guns seized from the rebels were found to be of Austrian manufacture! The military insists that this is proof of Austrian sponsorship of the ongoing liberal agitation. We must assume the worst, and prepare for immediate confrontation with Vienna.
The Austrians have gone too far this time!
The Second Salzburg Incident

Austria’s rule in Salzburg has become unstable. Despite the annexation of the principality, liberal revolutionaries began to regroup. They demanded either the adoption of a constitution so radical that it would end the monarch’s influence in politics, or the outright abolition of the monarchy. After a recent Mass in which the Archbishop of Salzburg severely criticized the liberal movement, a protest occurred outside of St. Peter’s Abbey during a meeting of Salzburger religious authorities. The archbishop summoned the city guards, but this time several revolutionaries in the crowd came armed and engaged in a shootout with the police, with several priests caught in the crossfire. In the aftermath, guns seized from the rebels were reportedly found to be of Bavarian manufacture. Austria has made the outlandish accusation that this proves we were behind the unrest! We must now prepare for immediate confrontation with Vienna.
What a preposterous accusation!
The Salzburg Revolution

With the recent tensions in both Bavaria and Austria, liberal revolutionaries have flocked to Salzburg, spreading their rhetoric and demanding either massive reform or outright republican revolution. Now these radicals have sprung into action. After a recent Mass in which the Prince-Archbishop of Salzburg lambasted the liberal movement, a protest occurred outside of the Residenz palace during a meeting of Salzburger religious authorities. Before the Prince-Archbishop could summon the city guards, several revolutionaries - who, having learned from past street battles, came armed - overpowered the local security and let the crowd into the Residenz. The Prince-Archbishop was soon lynched in front of his own palace and the rest of the clergy have been imprisoned within the Hohensalzburg Fortress, while revolutionaries have declared a new republican city-state. Both Austrian and Bavarian authorities have accused one another of supporting the rebels, and a confrontation between our nations over the Salzburg crisis is now imminent.
We did not want this war, but we did not start it.
The Salzburg Revolution

With the recent tensions in both Bavaria and Austria, liberal revolutionaries have flocked to Salzburg, spreading their rhetoric and demanding either massive reform or outright republican revolution. Now these radicals have sprung into action. After a recent Mass in which the Prince-Archbishop of Salzburg lambasted the liberal movement, a protest occurred outside of the Residenz palace during a meeting of Salzburger religious authorities. Before the Prince-Archbishop could summon the city guards, several revolutionaries - who, having learned from past street battles, came armed - overpowered the local security and let the crowd into the Residenz. The Prince-Archbishop was soon lynched in front of his own palace and the rest of the clergy have been imprisoned within the Hohensalzburg Fortress, while revolutionaries have declared a new republican city-state. Both Austrian and Bavarian authorities have accused one another of supporting the rebels, and a confrontation between our nations over the Salzburg crisis is now imminent.
We did not want this war, but we did not start it.
The Second Salzburg Incident

Our rule in Salzburg has become unstable. Despite the annexation of the principality, liberal revolutionaries began to regroup. They demanded either the adoption of a constitution so radical that it would end the monarch’s influence in politics, or the outright abolition of the monarchy. After a recent Mass in which the Archbishop of Salzburg severely criticized the liberal movement, a protest occurred outside of St. Peter’s Abbey during a meeting of Salzburger religious authorities. The archbishop summoned the city guards, but this time several revolutionaries in the crowd had come armed and engaged in a shootout with the police, and several priests were caught in the crossfire. In the aftermath, several guns seized from the rebels were found to be of Bavarian manufacture! The military insists that this is proof of Bavarian sponsorship of the unrest. We must assume the worst and prepare for immediate confrontation with Munich.
The Bavarians have gone too far this time!
Der Donau Bruderkrieg

”And Cain talked with Abel his brother : and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him. And the Lord said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not : Am I my brother's keeper? And He said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto me from the ground.” - Genesis 4 : 8-10\n\nAustria and Bavaria have long been regarded as the greatest hope for German unification, but only on the condition of learning to overcome their differences. That has now become impossible. Both powers have accused each other of fomenting unrest in the disputed city of Salzburg, and today both the Austrian and the Bavarian armies attempted to occupy it. This led to a skirmish that has spiraled into a full-blown war. At stake is not merely the right to unify the Danubian Circle, but the prime candidacy for uniting Germany. One shall stand, one shall fall.
Bayern, Bayern über alles!
Der Donau Bruderkrieg

The recent unrest in Salzburg forced us to take action. We had deployed a division of the Austrian Army to occupy the city and put down the liberal insurrection, but Bavaria had the same idea. Our forces engaged in a running battle throughout the city streets, and now we have been drawn into a direct confrontation with the Bavarians! The time has come to fight, not simply for the fate of Austria, but for the fate of the people of the Danube, and for Germany!
Osterreich, Osterreich über alles!
The Last Danubian Standing

The guns have fallen silent across the Danube, and Bavaria lies defeated. The question of Danubian leadership has been permanently answered in favor of Austria. Vienna has become the one true center of gravity for German nationalism, and shall serve as the foundation for the new Danubian German state. That state is already on unsteady footing, as we prepare to absorb a resentful Bavarian population who will not soon forget the circumstances by which we struck their nation from the map of Europe. The city of Ulm, which chafed under Bavaria and has even less loyalty to ourselves, has wasted no time in taking advantage of the chaos to secede to Wurtemberg. Far more pressing, however, is the threat of retaliation from Emperor Sigismund V. Therefore we cannot spend any time smoothing over the last details. We must press ahead with the unification at once!
Fortune smiles upon us at last.
The Unification of the Danubian Confederation

”To save all we must risk all.” - Friedrich Wilhelm Küng, Ulmer poet\n\nIn 1820, the Congress of Vienna re-drew the borders of Germany with two goals in mind : erase any trace of Marinus Dahlke’s attempt to dethrone the Emperor and establish an Imperial Republic, and keep Germany weak. They failed on both counts. Austria has forced Bavaria into submission and established a united Danubian Confederation. In a proclamation from Vienna, the Austrian head of state declared the unification of the Danubian Circle, before making an even more shocking announcement : the immediate secession of the Confederation from the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation. The Danubian German state of today may become the unified German state of tomorrow - if it survives Prague’s wrath.
Das ganze Deutschland soll es sein!
The Last Danubian Standing

The guns have fallen silent across the Danube, and Austria lies defeated. The question of Danubian leadership has been permanently answered in favor of Bavaria. Munich has become the one true center of gravity for German nationalism, and shall serve as the foundation for the new Danubian German state. That state is already on unsteady footing, as we prepare to absorb a resentful Austrian population who will not soon forget the circumstances by which we struck their nation from the map of Europe. Furthermore, the peculiar situation of Carinthia may require our attention. Far more pressing, however, is the threat of retaliation from Emperor Sigismund V. Therefore we cannot spend any time smoothing over the last details. We must press ahead with the unification at once!
Fortune smiles upon us at last.
The Unification of the Danubian Confederation

”To save all we must risk all.” - Friedrich Wilhelm Küng, Ulmer poet\n\nIn 1820, the Congress of Vienna re-drew the borders of Germany with one goal in mind - erase any trace of Marinus Dahlke’s attempt to dethrone the Emperor and establish an Imperial Republic, and keep Germany weak. They failed on both counts. Bavaria has forced Austria into submission and established a united Danubian Confederation. In a proclamation from Munich, the Bavarian head of state declared the unification of the Danubian Circle, before making an even more shocking announcement : the immediate secession of the Confederation from the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation. The Danubian German state of today may become the unified German state of tomorrow - if it survives Prague’s wrath.
Das ganze Deutschland soll es sein!
The Danubian Stalemate

The conflict between Bavaria and Austria has exhausted both sides who have been unable to dominate the Danubian river valley. At this point there seems to be no end to our conflict and this lack of resolution is not unnoticed by Prague. We cannot allow foreign intervention to destroy us, not when we are so close to realizing our mutual destiny! Therefore an armistice has been negotiated pending further discussions of peace terms. A meeting is planned in Salzburg between the leaders of Austria and Bavaria to determine the terms by which we can end this fratricidal bloodshed. Upon them is pinned not merely the hope of the Danubians but of Germans everywhere.
Redemption?
The Peace over the Salzach

”You ask which form of government is the best? Whichever teaches us to govern ourselves.” - Ludwig von Goethe\n\nThe so-called “Bruderkrieg” between Austria and Bavaria has ground to a standstill. Now, in an ironic twist of fate, the leaders of both Bavaria and Austria have met on the famous bridge over the Salzach built by Anglois funds to celebrate a meeting between the Bohemian King and the King of France and England in Salzburg. There the two Danubians have publicly shaken hands to end their fratricidal war and put their differences aside in the name of the German cause. A new Danubian Confederation, with its capital in Salzburg to accommodate both Bavaria and Austria, has been born today. In a most daring move, the President of the Confederation, the Archbishop of Salzburg, in accord with each of its member states, has proclaimed that all territories of the Confederation renounce all allegiance to the Emperor in Prague.
Das ganze Deutschland soll es sein!
The Petition from Klagenfurst

Over the last few years, Slovenian nationalism has coalesced behind a push to make the Landtag more reflective of the population and curtail the power of the German (including the Germanized Slovene) nobility. It was hoped that we could circumvent the Carinthian issue through German nationalism. However, the prospect of becoming a minority in a pan-German (and possibly even officially Catholic) state has sent alarm bells ringing throughout Carinthia, and this fear has manifested in the Landtag. Now a group of notable Carinthian Slovene politicians have arrived in the capital to present a request for a conference between Austrian and Carinthian officials to arrive at what they call an Ausgleich, or “Compromise.” It is feared that the Carinthians will demand significant cultural and political protections as a condition for supporting the unification of the Danube, but all things considered this is a rather polite request and refusal could cause Carinthian separatism and Slovenian nationalism to merge.
Absolutely not! The mere suggestion is treasonous!
We’ll meet them, they came in peace after all.
The Carinthian War of Independence

Our refusal to negotiate with the Carinthian Landtag confirmed the worst fears of Slovenian nationalists. They have become obsessed with the idea that we will reduce them to an internal colony and suppress their cultural and religious identity. A call to action was recently published in the Slovenian newspaper Celovški casi (Klagenfurt Times) by Protestant priest and Slovenian nationalist Father Aleksandar Kozler, and this morning he gave an inflammatory sermon in which he called upon the Slovenes of Carinthia to rise up against “the German Babylon.” The result was a mass mutiny of ethnic Slovenian soldiers in the Carinthian militia, who arrested their own German officers and then converged on the Carinthian capital to swear loyalty to Kozler! He has now been proclaimed the provisional president of a republican regime, and declared full independence from both Austria and the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation.
Carinthia was, is, and will be GERMAN!
The Ausgleich Conference of $YEAR$

The conference between Austrian and Carinthian politicians, the latter headed by Carinthian politician Peter Miklosich, has been convened. After multiple rounds of heated negotiations, where we were able to convince the Carinthians that independence was off the table, it appears that they want one of two concessions : either autonomy, or the disavowal by Vienna of pan-German projects. The Carinthians have absolutely refused to accept any sort of internal status within a future pan-German state that would not allow their own Landtag to legislate matters within Carinthia. Many of our own politicians believe that these negotiations are a waste of time, though a handful of isolationists have raised the point that a pan-German state could very well subsume the Austrian identity as well. Therefore, they say, the idea of abandoning Danubian unification is not unthinkable. Bavaria would of course be infuriated if we abandon them now for the sake of Carinthia.
We must accept the compromise.
The Carinthians are right, Austria should remain Austrian!
This was a waste of time! A few Slavs cannot stop the German destiny!
The Austrian Betrayal

Discord reigns in Munich, as we have received news that Austria has terminated their involvement in the unification of the Danubian Circle. It seems that a wave of isolationist sentiment swept Vienna after a conference with representatives from the Austrian-controlled Duchy of Carinthia, who had pleaded with the Austrians to protect their autonomy. Few had expected Austria to go so far as to abandon pan-Germanism just to maintain control over Carinthia. As difficult as it is to believe, if we wish to press ahead with unification, then force may be our only remaining option.
What were they thinking!?
The Ausgleich of $YEAR$

Negotiations in Vienna have been successful. While we were unable to press for full independence from Austria, we have forced the Austrians into granting and guaranteeing our autonomy no matter what sort of pan-German state they participate in going forwards.
A victory nonetheless!
The Salzburg Meeting, or the Third German Council

We are on the precipice of forming a united Danubian state with Austria, but several matters remain to be ironed out. The location of the capital, the matter of the head of state, and most importantly, the prospect of war with Emperor Sigismund V upon the formation of our confederation, all require further discussion. However, some members of our cabinet have raised a fourth possible issue : the situation of Carinthia relative to Austria. Carinthia enjoys a complex arrangement of privileges dating back to the Middle Ages and many of us are still unclear as to how this will function under a new pan-German state. Therefore we have arranged a third and hopefully final meeting in Salzburg between our government and that of Austria to put these matters to rest and prepare for the imminent unification of the Danubian Circle.
Glory is within our reach!
The Salzburg Meeting, or the Third German Council

We are on the precipice of forming a united Danubian state with Austria, but several matters remain to be ironed out. The location of the capital, the matter of the head of state, and most importantly, the prospect of war with Emperor Sigismund V upon the formation of our confederation, all require further discussion. Furthermore, some members of our cabinet believe that Munich has caught wind of brewing trouble with the Carinthians. While we had hoped to keep the matter off the table until after unification had been settled, we must not allow the Carinthians to force a more public confrontation with our government. Therefore a meeting has been arranged with the Bavarian government in Salzburg to finalize the terms of the unification of the Danubian Circle.
Let’s hope that they don’t mention it.
The Carinthian Problem

The “Third German Council,” as romanticists have dramatically referred to it, has immediately run into the issue of Carinthia.The Austrians repeatedly refused to elaborate on the matter, saying only that it was irrelevant. We were forced to send an agent to Klagenfurt, where he obtained several German- and Slovene-language newspapers on recent disputes between Vienna and the Carinthian Landtag. He brought this evidence back to Salzburg, where the Austrian delegation, confronted with irrefutable evidence of the crisis, finally confessed that Carinthia is fearful of losing its cultural and religious identity. They therefore had petitioned Austria for independence, which was denied, before negotiations became bogged down and collapsed. The Austrians have warned us that they do not want to reopen the issue but the Carinthians are distressed by the prospect of German unification and could resort to force if they feel that their needs will not be addressed.
We must attempt mediation to solve this crisis.
Bavaria Proposes to Mediate the Carinthian Situation

At the Salzburg meeting, Bavaria repeatedly inquired into Carinthia, and our delegation tried to avoid the matter. Unfortunately, the Bavarians went so far as to procure several German- and Slovene-language newspapers discussing ongoing disputes between our government and the Carinthian Landtag, forcing us to elaborate on the autonomy question. The Bavarians have been sympathetic to our desire to keep matters calm on the eve of unification, but have insisted that if the matter is not addressed, Carinthia may become destabilized and could even rise up in revolt. Therefore they have proposed to convene a joint Austro-Bavaro-Carinthian council to mediate the matter. It is likely that the Bavarians will eventually propose a modified form of the original autonomy agreement, which will still prevent us from fully incorporating Carinthia. §RHowever if we refuse then it would amount to forsaking Danubian unification.§
They may try.
§RNEIN! WAS FÄLLT IHNEN EIN!? DAS IST EMPÖREND!§R
Collapse of the Third German Council

Bavaria’s underhanded actions to attempt to force us to cave in to the Carinthian separatists were too offensive for us to tolerate. This must have been a sign of things to come, of Bavaria seeking to pit the peoples of a prospective pan-German state against one another for their own ends! We shall have no part in it. Our delegation has already departed Salzburg. Let this be a lesson for those who attempt to dictate terms to the Austrian people!
We will not be pawns!
Failure of the Third German Council

The Austrians absolutely refused to entertain any discussion of Carinthia. To the horror of pan-German nationalists everywhere, they went so far as to abandon the meeting entirely in protest of our “interference.” However, the collapse of the council by no means marks the end of pro-unification sentiment. If anything, it has cemented it in the minds of the Austrian and the Bavarian people. The difference is that, now, the unity of both the Danubian Circle and of Germany is spoken of in darker tones, in tones of iron and blood, of manifest destiny. §RA military confrontation between Austria and Bavaria is now inevitable.§
The Austrian mind is ruled by hatred of others and love of themselves!
The Carinthian Mediation

An agreement has been reached with the Carinthians. They will fully support German unification and will allow the prospective confederal government to have authority over their foreign and military policy, in exchange for the Carinthian Landtag being given the power to pass domestic legislation and control taxes within Carinthia. The Austrians remain bitter at the lost opportunity to curtail Carinthia’s autonomy, but the threat of an upcoming Carinthian uprising has for the moment been dealt with. §dThis agreement will not fully come into effect until unification is complete.§
A compromise is better than nothing.
The Question of the Capital

We are on the verge of unifying the Danubian Circle, but one last pressing question remains - the location of the capital. No matter how much we stress the equality of the confederal system, whichever city is made the capital of the confederation will inevitably allow that region to exert special influence upon the rest of the country. As we have taken a leading role in the negotiations and in advancing pan-German nationalism in general, Munich is the natural candidate. We could put forth Vienna instead, but at this point doing so would be seen as forfeiting our leadership of the German cause. Whatever we decide, it is clear that a Danubian Confederation shall soon be born.
Munich shall be the new heart of the German people!
Why not Vienna?
Vienna is Chosen as the Confederation’s Capital!

The final deliberations in Salzburg have revolved around the question of our confederation’s capital city. It has been decided, by a vote of all of the delegates - including the Austrian and the Bavarian heads of state - that Vienna shall claim the honor! This is a great day for the Austrian people, as it confirms that the heart of legal and cultural authority shall always lie within our homeland. With this last matter settled, the time has come to organize the new confederal government, and merge our economies, militaries, and infrastructure into one single body. The German destiny is at hand!
Arise, Germania! Vienna waits for you!
The Unification of the Danubian Confederation

”One people we will be, a band of brothers : no danger, no distress shall sunder us. We will be freemen as our fathers were, and sooner welcome death than live as slaves.” - Friedrich Wilhelm Küng, Ulmer poet\n\nIn 1820, the Congress of Vienna re-drew the borders of Germany with two goals in mind : erase any trace of Marinus Dahlke’s Imperial Republic, and keep Germany weak. They failed on both counts. Austria and Bavaria have come together in peace to turn the Danubian Circle, once an abstract Imperial administrative region, into a united Danubian Confederation. In a proclamation from Vienna, the leaders of the two nations declared the unification of the Danubian states, before making an even more shocking announcement : the immediate secession of the Confederation from the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation. The Danubian German state of today may become the unified German state of tomorrow - if it survives Prague’s wrath.
Das ganze Deutschland soll es sein!
Munich is Chosen as the Confederation’s Capital!

The final deliberations in Salzburg have revolved around the question of our confederation’s capital city. It has been decided, by a vote of all of the delegates - including the Bavarian and the Austrian heads of state - that Munich shall claim the honor! This is a great day for the Bavarian people, as it confirms that the heart of legal and cultural authority shall always lie within our homeland. With this last matter settled, the time has come to organize the new confederal government, and merge our economies, militaries, and infrastructure into one single body. The Danubian German destiny is at hand!
Arise, Germania! Munich waits for you!
The Unification of the Danubian Confederation

”One people we will be, a band of brothers : no danger, no distress shall sunder us. We will be freemen as our fathers were, and sooner welcome death than live as slaves.” - Friedrich Wilhelm Küng, Ulmer poet\n\nIn 1820, the Congress of Vienna re-drew the borders of Germany with two goals in mind : erase any trace of Marinus Dahlke’s Imperial Republic, and keep Germany weak. They failed on both counts. Bavaria and Austria have come together in peace to turn the Danubian Circle, once a mere Imperial administrative region, into a united Danubian Confederation. In a proclamation from Munich, the leaders of the two nations declared the unification of the Danubian states, before making an even more shocking announcement : the immediate secession of the Confederation from the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation. The Danubian German state of today may become the unified German state of tomorrow - if it survives Prague’s wrath.
Das ganze Deutschland soll es sein!
The Rise of the Danubian Confederation

The Danube has been unified under the banner of a single government founded in the spirit of pan-Germanism. This same spirit is rapidly spreading throughout our own people and if we do not take immediate action to suppress it then we will find ourselves absorbed into the new state.
We, too, are Danubians!
This is not our fate.
The Rulers’ Conference

The Danubian Federation has emerged united and strong from the collapse of the Holy Roman Empire.Taking inspiration from the Fürstlichkonferenz of Ducal Saxony, the Konferenz der Bundesherrscher, consisting of the head of states of each federal member,  elects the President of the Federation every 5 years from candidates of the hereditary heads of states. Following the negotiations, Wilhelm IV von Wittelsbach was elected President and Munich was chosen as the permanent capital of the Federation. However the gentleman’s agreement between Willy and Archduke Joseph promised the Habsburg the position of leader in 5 years, helping quell the dissensions between the two Danubian foremost princes. This system has been heavily criticized by the radicals who see it as a reactionary system to preserve the power of the aristocracy, but moderates see it as the best model to further German Unity.
Bundespräsidium Willy will build the foundations of future Germany!
The Rulers’ Conference

The Danubian Federation has emerged united and strong from the collapse of the Holy Roman Empire. Taking inspiration from the Fürstlichkonferenz of Ducal Saxony, the Konferenz der Bundesherrscher, consisting of the head of states of each federal member,  elects the President of the Federation every 5 years from candidates of the hereditary heads of states. Following the negotiations, Joseph II von Habsburg was elected President and Vienna was chosen as the permanent capital of the Federation. The gentleman’s agreement between Archduke Joseph and Wilhelm IV of Bavaria promised the Wittesbach the position of leader in 5 years, helping quell the dissensions between the two Danubian foremost princes. This system has been heavily criticized by the radicals who see it as a reactionary system to preserve the power of the aristocracy, but moderates see it as the best model to further German Unity.
Bundespräsidium Joseph will build the foundations of future Germany!
The Rulers’ Conference

The Danubian Federation has remained united and survived the collapse of the Holy Roman Empire. Taking inspiration from the Fürstlichkonferenz of Ducal Saxony, the Konferenz der Bundesherrscher, consisting of the head of states of each federal member,  elects the President of the Federation every 5 years from candidates of the hereditary heads of states. Following the Salzburg agreement that ended the Austro-Bavarian war, Johan von Thun, Archbishop of Salzburg was elected President and Salzburg ended up as the permanent capital of the Federation. This interim election was meant to avoid further dissensions between Munich and VIenna but tensions have hardly calmed down. Johan as archbishop is demonized by the radicals who see his rule as the proof of the reactionary nature of the Federation and he is hardly supported by the houses of Wittelsbach and Habsburg who are already plotting for the next election.
Gott schütze den Bundespräsidium…
The Habsburg Federation

The War with Bavaria has seen the victory of the House of Habsburg, with Joseph II forming the Danubian Federation in the aftermath. Ruling as the hereditary President of the Federation, Joseph II can now rebuild the Danubian Plain as he wishes. Many in the private council urge him to end the interim governments in Tyrol and Bavaria and crown himself Count of Tyrol and Duke of Bavaria : this will show the rest of the German princes that Germany will be united around the house of Habsburg, by force if needed. More moderate figures urge him to build a true Federal State which will not be seen as an Habsburg ploy but a true German Federation. The Leopoldian-Tyrol cadet branch of the Habsburg house ruled Tyrol until 1814 and Franz-Joseph could easily placed back in Innsbruck while numerous Wittelsbach princes could easily be manipulated to further Austrian interests in Bavaria.
A sham Federation, for a Machtpolitik
A true Federation, to heal the wounds of the Bruderkrieg
The return of the Tyrol-Habsburgs in Innsbruck

Following the plans drafted by Joseph II, his distant cousin, Franz-Joseph von Habsburg, direct heir of the last prince-count of Tyrol, Ferdinand IV who had been deposed by the Bavarian army in the Great German Wars because of his support of Wenceslaus has come back to Innsbruck. The county had been annexed formally in 1814 and confirmed during the Treaty of Paris but Tyroleans remained staunch legitimists with several revolts and general discontent toward Bavarian authorities. At least, that’s the narrative Franz-Joseph has decided to push forward to his speech from the Innsbruck from the balcony of the Hofburg, accompanied by the Federal President Joseph II of Austria. Already Tyrol seems to see the Federation as not just the instrument of the Vienna Court but also a promise of better times and the resentment against Vienna is rapidly fading in the Alps.
We have freed Tyrol from Bavarian occupation!
The Bavarian inheritance

With the Tyrol issue dealt with, the Bavarian interim was the next issue to deal with. Wilhelm IV of Bavaria did not have any children, and the succession was always quite clear with his nephew, prince Ludwig, designated Crown Prince of the Wittelsbach demesne before the war. However Ludwig had been married to Maria-Louise von Habsburg, one of the Austrian heirs that Joseph II had bypassed when he accessed the throne, and thus the Vienna circle fears that if they are allowed on the Bavarian throne, the power of Joseph II be challenged within the Federation. The other solution is to crown Joseph Duke of Bavaria and have Munich ruled by Bavarian elites in personal union with Austria. This action would strengthen Joseph II's position in Germany but also embolden the opponents to Austrian rule who had hoped Bavaria would regain a true Duke following the Tyrol example.
Crown Ludwig as Duke of Bavaria and let the wounds heal!
Crown Joseph as Duke of Bavaria, for the unity of the German nation!
The Wittelsbach Federation

The War with Austria has seen the victory of the House of Wittelsbach, with Wilhelm IV forming the Danubian Federation in the aftermath. Ruling as the hereditary President of the Federation, Willy can now rebuild the Danubian Plain as he wishes. Many in the private council urge him to end the interim governments in Carinthia and Austria by crowning himself Duke of Carinthia and Archduke of Austria : this will show the rest of the German princes that Germany will be united around the house of Wittelsbach, by force if needed. More moderate figures urge him to build a true Federal State which will not be seen as a Bavarian ploy but a true German Federation. Recent developments in Carinthia around the bypassed heiress Clementina has strengthened the idea of having a different ruler from VIenna and there are also potential successors for Vienna that Bavaria could manipulate to further the union.
A sham federation for a strong Germany
A true federation to strengthen the Danubian peoples
The Enthroning of Clementina I of Carinthia

Clementina von Habsburg was the second eldest grand-daughter of Charles IV of Austria by his first son Ferdinand, but she was denied the succession by the Vienna Court and saw her cousin Joseph II ascend instead of her sister. In an act of defiance against Vienna she later married Georg Khevenhüller, a prominent Carinthian noble and converted to Protestantism becoming the champion of the Carinthians in Austria. Thanks to an arrangement with Wilhelm IV of Bavaria, Carinthia has been definitely separated from Austria and Clementina has become Duchess, establishing her court in Klagenfurt where she and her husband were crowned in the presence of the President of the Federation. Because of the troubles between Klagenfurt and Vienna because of the religious divide alongside the language issue between the Slovenes and the Germans, the news of the separation with Austria has been met with joy throughout the Duchy and their integration within the Federation is already a success by all reports!
Let Carinthia flourish without Vienna’s interference!
The Austrian Problem

Contrary to Carinthia, Austrian succession is another problem. Joseph II has gone into exile following his defeat, but his wife has stayed in Vienna to clamor for the rights of their son Ferdinand and has appealed to Wilhelm IV and her cousin-in-law Maria-Louise directly to champion her cause. However the Munich court has also entertained the idea of supporting the claim of Maria-Louise, the eldest granddaughter of Charles IV, who is married to Ludwig of Bavaria, nephew and presumed heir of Wilhelm IV. Like Clementina, her claim is strong but this would likely be seen by Austrians as a power grab by Bavarians hoping to later unify the Archduchy with the Duchy in a few decades.
Maria Louise will rule as Regent for her nephew Ferdinand
Maria Louise will become Archduchess and Ludwig Archduke!
Demonstrations in Munich

The failure of the new Bavarian constitution to address the demands of the liberals has been a known fact for some time, but we had assumed that their anger had burned itself out. We thought wrong - they were biding their time, waiting for an opportune moment to strike. The spread of new notions of militant, radical republicanism has caused Munich to catch fire with liberal agitation, as all of the grievances of the past are recalled, and multiplied by the fear that the government will use the confederation’s consolidation to silence demands for political rights. The prospect of a future German nation-state built not on the principles of egalitarianism and democracy but instead on monarchism and tradition has outraged those who now realize that the Danubian Confederation will not necessarily lead to the end of monarchism in Germany, but may in fact protect it. Ongoing protests in Munich have demanded that the government either introduce comprehensive reforms to return power to the people…or step aside.
This mood will pass.
Demonstrations Spread to Vienna!

The unrest in the Danubian Confederation continues to mount. Protests have also broken out in Vienna, revolving around similar liberal and republican rhetoric. The two revolutionary strains appear to be merging, with the republicans taking the lead in the current discourse. Martial law has been declared across the nation, but multiple officers have remarked with concern that the rank-and-file troops are some of the most sympathetic to radical rhetoric. If enough of the army mutinies and joins the protestors, then it could spark a revolution which we would be unable to oppose. The current unrest means that the confederal Landtag cannot be convened due to the risk to the legislators’ lives, rendering us unable to ratify any reforms to calm the masses. Something is going to give.
How could the people betray us, after all we’ve done for them!?
The Danubian Revolution

The rulers of the Danubian Confederation assumed that unification of the Danube would be enough to quiet liberal demands. Instead the opposite occurred - it exposed just how many political issues went unsolved by unification. A group of liberals led a crowd to the Landtag to seize it and vote in a new, radical constitution to abolish the monarchy and form a radical republican federation. There they were met by soldiers, and a tense standoff ensued. However, their commander, Harold Merkel, recognized a close personal friend in the crowd and abandoned his post to join him. His men followed, and the rebels stormed both the Landtag and the royal palace. After the monarch was executed by Fallschwertmaschine in front of the Landtag, the revolutionary leaders appeared at its balcony and asked the crowd to “vote” on the new constitution, and the people roared their approval. Europe watches in horror as their worst fears are realized - a revolutionary pan-German republic has arisen like a phoenix, and Marinus Dahlke is young again.
Einigkeit und Recht und Freiheit für das deutsche Vaterland!
The Danubian Revolution

It had been assumed that the Danubian Federation’s democracy would satisfy the liberals. Instead it exposed just how many political issues the mainstream parties refused to address. After members of more than one liberal party joined with conservatives to block yet another radical republican bill, the radicals staged a walkout from the Landtag. Word spread of a massive rally to be held at Innsbruck, site of the famous liberal festival. Fearing rebellion, an army was sent to keep watch, but when the order was received from the capital to form a security cordon around the thousands of demonstrators, the officers led their men straight to the ringleaders and swore fealty to them “in the name of a free and united Germany!” The radicals returned to the capital in triumph at the head of a new army, quickly seizing it and proclaiming a new, neo-Dahlkist regime. Europe watches in horror as their worst fears are realized - a revolutionary pan-German republic has arisen like a phoenix, and Marinus Dahlke is young again.:
Einigkeit und Recht und Freiheit für das deutsche Vaterland!
A Transalpine Pact with the Danubians?

Tensions have been building amongst $COUNTRY_ADJ$ nationalists regarding the eastern Alps, which they see as our natural frontier. It was feared that this might lead us into conflict with the Danubian Germans of the north, yet now the Danubian ambassador has approached us to propose a treaty. Its terms state that if $COUNTRY$ forms an alliance with the Danubians, then they shall transfer the Italian city of Trent and its surrounding environs to us in ten years, if we maintain the alliance. The latter term shall for reasons of political necessity remain secret. While the proposal also stipulates that we would be compelled to disavow the old Tridentine claim to the Tyrolean cities of Bolzano and Bressanone, this may be our best chance of solving the Alpine border dispute without force of arms.
In the name of peace, we accept.
In the name of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ honor, we refuse.
The Transalpine Pact

The eastern Alpine border between the German and Italian peoples has been in contention since the days when both groups were still part of the Holy Roman Empire. It was feared that nationalists from both $FROM_COUNTRY$ and $COUNTRY$ would provoke war over the disputed Tyrol region, yet instead these powers have found common ground. They have formed a military alliance, pledging not only mutual defense but to join one another in “maintaining security in Central Europe.” Rumors are swirling that some provisions of the treaty have been withheld from publication, which would explain why two nations with seemingly opposite territorial goals became allies in such a short time. Regardless the Danubians have once again shifted the balance of power in Europe.
Shoulder to shoulder, marching together into the future!
$FROM_COUNTRY$ has Refused

It seems that nationalist sentiment has prevailed in $FROM_COUNTRY$ as they have refused our offer of a trans-Alpine pact or to disavow Trent’s old northern territorial claims. This is a clear statement of intent and we should make ready for conflict in the Tyrol with them in the near future.
What a shame.
The Fulfillment of the Transalpine Pact

Ten years ago we met with Italian representatives to come to a peaceful solution regarding the Tyrol. The resulting treaty formed a military alliance between us but also secretly promised the city of Trent and its surroundings to our southern neighbors if the alliance was maintained for at least a decade. They have honored the terms and now we should expect them to demand Trent before long.
Very well…
The Fulfillment of the Transalpine Pact

Ten years ago we met with Danubian representatives to come to a peaceful solution regarding the Tyrol. The resulting treaty formed a military alliance between us but also secretly promised the city of Trentino and its surroundings to our southern neighbors if the alliance was maintained for at least a decade. We have honored the terms and now it is time to demand that the Germans honor their own side of the treaty and cede Trentino to us. If they dare to refuse then we shall take…appropriate measures.
We deserve Trentino!
The $FROM_ADJ$ Demand Trent

As expected, the $FROM_ADJ$ ambassador has delivered a note to our government this morning reminding us of the terms of the Transalpine Pact and demanding the immediate turnover of Trent to $FROM_COUNTRY$. As we were the ones to propose this arrangement it would reflect poorly on our international reputation to refuse, not to mention giving $FROM_COUNTRY$ more than enough of a justification to declare war upon us. On the other hand, Trent IS a valuable city, the gateway between Italy and Germany, and one with a notable Danubian population.
We must honor the terms.
After all, why not? §RWhy shouldn’t I keep it? My PRECIOUS…!§
The Tyrolean Border Treaty of $YEAR$

Foreign suspicions of secret provisions of the Transalpine Pact were correct, it seems. This morning representatives from both sides of the eastern Alps met in Trent to mark the official handover of the city from Danubian control and the public delineation of the two nations’ resulting Alpine borders. All German-speaking citizens of the area have been offered to either exchange their citizenship for that of their new ruler or move to Danubian lands. While Danubian reactionaries are outraged by this voluntary reduction of the Danubian sphere of influence, Italians are quite pleased by the recovery of Trentino, and the Danubian government has shown itself to be truly magnanimous.
May the Italian and German peoples prosper together!
The Danubian Betrayal

We had made an agreement with the Danubians in good faith to recover Trentino. However when the time came to transfer the city to our control, they refused! All sorts of excuses were made for this backstab but none bear repeating. This is now a question of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ honor! We must avenge ourselves upon them and liberate Trentino, and perhaps all of Alto Adige, from their illegitimate rule.
As expected of tyrannical German savages!
Annulment of the Transalpine Pact

The recent shifts in the political landscape of Danubia and northeastern Italy have invalidated the Transalpine Pact. Therefore there is no longer any reason for us not to annex Trent and assume full control over the city and its surroundings.
Make it so.
The Collapse of the Confederation

We have entered a period of irreversible decline. Whether through total political paralysis, catastrophic military defeat, or the loss of a critical population center, $COUNTRY$ no longer has legs to stand upon. The German people have lost faith in our leadership, and the once-united front of pan-German nationalists is splintering into countless rival groups. Even our own provincial governors are drawing away from the capital, gathering their own authority in anticipation of a national collapse which their actions shall surely hasten. §RThis is the end of $COUNTRY$.§
Failure demands punishment.
The Restoration of the Danubian Circle

The formation of a truly unified Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation has sounded the death knell of our government. With Prague restored to full power, they have sent us an ultimatum demanding the immediate restoration of "full Imperial authority over the Danubian Circle." As the rest of Europe has recognized their legitimacy we have no means to resist that would not be suicidal gestures. This is the end of the Danubian experiment.
Hasta la vista, baby.
The Abolition of the Illegal German Union

”I once declared that there was only one sovereign of this Empire and that I would not tolerate any other. I have stood by this statement and shall continue to do so. The unlawful insurrection of the Danubian estates has at last been ended, thanks be to God, as the forces of the Empire restore order and stability to the Danubian Circle. Let it be known that I am disposed towards the peoples of the Danube with a heart filled with mercy. I shall at once bring this occupation to a close and raise up the ancient realms which once ruled in the lands taken by the criminal rebellion. It is my earnest hope that when next I receive the Archduke of Austria and the Duke of Bavaria, it shall be in conditions of eternal peace.” - Emperor Sigismund V
Let them never again forget their master.
The Subjugation of the Danubians

The restoration of Imperial control over the Danubian Circle has restored the old states of the region under tight control from Prague. Any hope of regional integration to resist the Jagiellons has been lost.
But what happens to a dream deferred?
Renovate Munich

Munich was the crown jewel of Bavaria ever since the reunification of the Duchy, with each monarch adding new buildings and monuments to the heart of Bavaria. However, industrialization and the unification of the Danubian Plain have both rendered the capital obsolete and investments are needed to make Munich the representative of German culture throughout Europe and the world. Furthermore, the amount of German intellectuals who have taken up residence in Munich over the years gives us unparalleled access to the most innovative architectural and artistic minds of our generation. Let us assemble these brilliant men and hardy workers and transform Munich into the new heart of Germany!
Renovate Vienna

Vienna suffered greatly in the past centuries and many chroniclers have commented that she never regained the status she had before the Turks took the city and burnt it following their retreat into Hungary more than a century ago. Now that Vienna is the capital of the true single German State, investments have poured to make it a worthy capital and a center of the arts and German culture, but a new era demands a new vision. Furthermore, the amount of German intellectuals who have taken up residence in Vienna due to our rising international prominence gives us unparalleled access to the most innovative architectural and artistic minds of our generation. Let us assemble these brilliant men and hardy workers and transform Vienna into the new heart of Germany!
Bundesstadt Salzburg

Salzburg became capital more by accident than by choice but it offers a perfect opportunity for Danubian architects. The Right Bank of the Salzach remains mostly empty beside a few buildings behind the fortifications. Official architects in charge of the renovation and the embellishment of the city have drafted a plan to tear down the forts, dam the Salzach and build a complete new city for the ministries, Parliament and justice of the Federation. The plan is so ambitious that some are already calling this brand new Federal Quarter, Neu Salzburg!
End Austrian Resentment

The Brothers’ War has left scars throughout Austrian lands and it is our first order of business to make the Austrians accept the unification and their German destiny. For that to happen we must demonstrate our appreciation of their needs and of their unique culture. Infrastructure must be built and renovated across Austria to bring it up to the national standard, Austrian cultural institutions must be supported, and the government must make a sincere and ongoing effort to hire Austrians for prominent administrative positions. The work will not be accomplished overnight but eventually the Austrians will come to accept their role within the greater German future.
End Bavarian Nostalgia
