For that to happen we must demonstrate our appreciation of their needs and of their unique culture. Infrastructure must be built and renovated across Bavaria to bring it up to the national standard, Bavarian cultural institutions must be supported, and the government must make a sincere and ongoing effort to hire Bavarians for prominent administrative positions. The work will not be accomplished overnight but eventually the Bavarians will come to accept their role within the greater German future.

column2: A More Perfect Union

We have weathered the storm. $COUNTRY$ has flourished following the Unification. Now, the scars of conflicts between Germans are healing and our nation can advance as one into the future and start the struggle for a united Germany.
Recover Istria

Austria held large parts of Istria since the Late Middle Ages, with the Free City of Trieste acting as the main port of the Habsburg holdings in stark rivalry with Venice. However, our loss in the Great German War allowed Venice to acquire the city alongside the margraviate of Istria and the county of Gorizia, only leaving us with the smaller and less connected Fiume to access the Mediterranean. However, Venice is not as bound to the German order as the states of the Holy Roman Empire, and should the old Austrian littoral be retaken by force, we could abolish the farce that is the Imperial city of Fiume and rule again over the whole of Istria
Recover Istria

Austria held large parts of Istria since the Late Middle Ages, with the Free City of Trieste acting as the main port of the Habsburg holdings in stark rivalry with Venice. However, the Habsburg’s loss in the Great German War allowed Venice to acquire the city alongside the margraviate of Istria and the county of Gorizia, leaving Austria with the smaller and less connected Fiume to access the Mediterranean. However, Venice is not as bound to the German order as the states of the Holy Roman Empire, and should the old Austrian littoral be retaken by force, we could abolish the farce that is the Imperial city of Fiume and rule again over the whole of Istria.
Claim Istria

Austria held large parts of Istria since the Late Middle Ages, with the Free City of Trieste acting as the main port of the Habsburg holdings in stark rivalry with Venice. However, the Habsburg’s loss in the Great German War allowed Venice to acquire the city alongside the margraviate of Istria and the county of Gorizia, leaving Austria with the smaller and less connected Fiume to access the Mediterranean. Even Fiume has by now  been lost to foreign intrigues. With the consolidation of the Danubian Circle into one nation we can now leverage the old Austrian claim to press for control of not just Fiume but all of Istria.
Claim Carinthia

The Duchy of Carinthia was held by the Archduchy of Austria for centuries until its untimely loss. Now that we have consolidated leadership of the Danubian Germans we can strike south and reclaim the natural southern frontier of Germany…and open the way for further power projection into the Balkans.
End the Carinthian Ausgleich

Many years ago an Ausgleich was established with Carinthia whereby their regional Landtag would gain authority over all local laws, in exchange for Carinthia remaining under personal union with Austria. The ungrateful Slovenes have, rather than showing gratitude for our generosity, used this to agitate for even more independence! Furthermore, Carinthian autonomy greatly restricts our power projection in the Balkans. Now that we have shorn up our own institutions the time has come to proclaim a state of emergency in Carinthia and annul the Augsleich. By the time said state of emergency is lifted we will have truly reintegrated Carinthia.
Include Ansbach in the Federation

The duchy of Ansbach, held by the esteemed line of the Hohenzollern did not join the Confederation at its founding, but they could easily be convinced to integrate into our government now that we influence them.
Include Bayreuth in the Federation

The Duchy of Brandenburg-Bayreuth, held by the esteemed line of Hohenzollern, did not join the Confederation at its founding. Yet they could easily be convinced to integrate into our government now that we influence them, especially since the Burning of Nuremberg enshrined pan-Germanist and anti-Jagiellon sentiments amongst their people.
Demand Brandenburg-Bayreuth!

Brandenburg-Bayreuth has for decades been held as a fief by the Bohemians, who have jealously guarded it from its natural liberation. No longer! We hear the cries for freedom amongst the Franconians and they shall not go unanswered. Let us issue an ultimatum to Prague : Release Brandenburg-Bayreuth at once or face war! Surely they shall see reason…
Integrate Brandenburg-Bayreuth

We have taken possession of Brandenburg-Bayreuth, but its communities are still quite disorganized, ruled by a patchwork of local governors. Let us introduce a modern and efficient administration into the area.
Annex Trent

Trent is one of the last vestiges of the Holy Roman Empire’s presence in Italy, long ruled by a Prince-Bishop. Nowadays it has passed into our control. Trent’s German-speaking population is small but it guards a major route between Italy and Germany. If we do not annex it promptly then a pro-Italian rebellion could pry it away from us.
Propose the Tridentine Agreement

Trent is one of the last vestiges of the Holy Roman Empire’s presence in Italy, long ruled by a Prince-Bishop. Nowadays it has passed into our control, yet the government of Trent still maintains its old claims to Brixen and Bozen. If the city-state was seized by a pan-Italian power then they could leverage these claims against us. Let us instead propose a treaty to our southern neighbors : if they form a military alliance with us, and waive Trent’s northern claims, then we shall secretly agree to cede Trent to them in ten years, assuming that the alliance is maintained for a full decade.
Claim Alto Adige

Alto Adige, or South Tyrol, has been disputed between Italian and German states since the early days of the Holy Roman Empire. Many speakers of Western Romance languages, Italian or otherwise, call it home, and the old Bishopric of Trentino - which obviously belongs to the Italian cultural world - never officially relinquished its claims to Bolzano and Bressanone. If we are to keep our frontiers secure and maintain our reputation as the defender of all Italians then Alto Adige must be ours!
A Centralized Union of Danubians

Now that our capital is fit to be the nerve center of our entire nation, and we have regained our stability, the time has come to redraw the internal administrative divisions of our country. The old states which built it - Austria, Bavaria, Salzburg, and the rest - must pass into history. May our people never again be divided!
End German Claims on Trentino

The Italians living in Tyrol have been under our protection for years now. We have not contented ourselves with just the city of Trentino, but pushed back the Germans to the Brenner Pass, securing our frontier and country from the Teutons. With our might proven, it seems that the international community and the Germans themselves acknowledge that our claim is true, and hopefully there should be no more wars for Trentino and the Alto-Adige
Bohemia is Czech
Greater Germany Enabled
Bohemia’s Uncertain Future

With the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire, our country now finds itself in an awkward position. Unlike the other members of the former empire, our country was never fully German, and the only thing that seemed to tie the various peoples of our country together was the Crown of the Holy Roman Empire. With the loss of the Crown, many in our lands question if our country will hold together, and some are even plotting to try and break the country apart along ethnic lines. The future of Bohemia is in dire straits and a balance will have to be struck to ensure that all sides are placated. If we are unsuccessful then Bohemia may find itself consigned to the ash heap of history.
We exist and shall work to persist.
The Establishment of the Bohemian Empire

”We have therefore resolved, after mature reflection, to assume and to establish for us and for our successors and forever tie the unalterable possession of our lands, and states under the title and dignity of Hereditary Emperor of Bohemia.” - Sigismund I’s Proclamation of the Bohemian Empire\n\nIn order to better bind the lands of our country, Karl von Schwarzenberg has arranged for Sigismund to take on a new royal title that will now supersede his other titles. This title of Emperor or, more accurately, Kaiser is directly modeled on the old Holy Roman Emperor and should serve as a unifying force for our various subjects. As this is a new title Sigismund has also been crowned Sigismund I to illustrate the break from the old Empire. The only threat to this plan would be Sigismund’s tendencies, however after everything that has happened we hope that Sigismund has grown wiser and more reserved.
Gott erhalte Sigismund den Kaiser!
The Bohemian Constitution of $YEAR$

It has become clear that the autocracy of the Emperor has only been a destabilizing force, especially with the rise in liberal sentiment. In order to placate these groups a new constitution has been personally crafted by Karl von Schwarzenberg and promulgated over Sigismund’s reservations. This constitution limits the power of the Emperor and grants free and open elections to propertied adult men. Von Schwarzenberg for his part has been naturally selected to lead this new government and will serve in this position so long as he has the Emperor’s grace.
A constitution guarantees stability, at least…
Our Influence in Southern Germany Collapses.

Another effect from the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire that we should have expected was the weakening of our influence in Germany. However, it seems that the South German states have taken this opportunity to completely break relations with us leaving the region open to exploitation by other powers. In order to salvage whatever influence Bohemia still had in Germany, Schwarzenberg has been sending letters and diplomats all throughout the Elbian German states. So far it looks as though Schwarzenberg has been successful and the Elbian states appear willingly to remain by our side. Nevertheless our diplomatic situation is dire and it will be a challenge to keep our sphere of influence together, let alone expand it.
The south is lost, but the north still holds promise.
The Collapse of the Reichsarmee

The end of the Holy Roman Empire has now left the many former member states without the de jure protection of the Emperor. Many German states have thus begun to expand their armies to protect themselves and to try to secure their borders as best they can. This has resulted in an opportunity for many members of our Reichsarmee to seek high ranking positions in these new armies as officers, drill instructors, or even just as well paid recruits. Unfortunately, the result has been the gutting of our own Reichsarmee - it is now a shadow of its former self, kept together only by a vague sense of loyalty among those who remain. For now we must accept the fractured state of our army until we are in a better position to enact reforms.
The army of Wenceslaus now laid to ruin.
The Ersatz Kaiser

”We think ourselves authorized after the example which has been given to us by the court of Anvers and the Scandinavian realm to confer onto our house as far as relates to our lands, the hereditary title of Emperor.”-Sigismund I’s Announcement of the Bohemian Empire\n\nWith the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire by the hands of Burgundy and Scandinavia, it was decided for the sake of stability to grant Sigismund the title of Emperor of Bohemia and crown him as Sigismund I. During the coronation, Sigismund was forced to sit through speeches given by the ambassadors of Burgundy and Scandinavia as they talked about how magnanimous they were to Bohemia. This humiliation has bonded some of the more conservative elements of our country together while more liberal elements mockingly deride the new title. Since this title is seen as a substitution for that of Holy Roman Emperor, many are referring to the title as Ersatz Kaiser.
This is all a bad joke.
The Liberal Constitution of $YEAR$

Not content with the humiliating coronation, the victorious powers have also enforced a constitution of their own making onto us. This constitution looks more like a checklist for all the demands the liberals in our country have made over the years. While the constitution does guarantee free and fair elections to properted adult men, it also creates a byzantine system of checks and balances that can result in the paralysis of the entire governmental apparatus by a minority of elected officials. Nevertheless the liberals in our country seemed pleased by this, while Sigismund can only look in horror as he is forced to promulgate this constitution.
The insults never end.
Our Diplomats in Southern Germany Have Been Expelled

Sensing our weakened state, the Southern German states have expelled our diplomats from their countries and removed all influence we had in the region. While many feared the complete collapse of our sphere of influence, we have been able to keep some of the Elbian German states under our hold due to our long shared history with them. Still our diplomatic situation is dire and it will be a challenge to keep our sphere of influence together, let alone expand it.
At least we were able to salvage something from this.
The Great Bohemian Reforms

The end of the Holy Roman Empire has continued to haunt Bohemia and the aftershocks have constantly stunted our attempts to reassert ourselves. To combat this malaise, Karl von Schwarzenberg has called for a series of reforms to be debated and approved by a special consul. This consul will tackle the largest issues in our country. Those being army reforms, the state of religion in the Empire, and the power of the Emperor. There is no doubt that Sigismund himself will try and swing these reforms in his favor, however Schwarzenberg feels comfortable that regardless whatever tomfoolery Sigismund gets into that the end result will still be beneficial to Bohemia.
Now begins a period of national rejuvenation!
The Czech National Revival

With the announcement of the Great Reforms there suddenly came a new voice that demands the recognition and protection of a separate Czech identity. Already this has seemed to spark a renaissance of the Czech language with many books, plays, and speeches being created. This movement appears to have been long in the making and some  have even begun advocating for an independent Czech state to exist outside of Germany. It appears now that the reforms will have to manage the considerations of both the Germans and Czechs in order to ensure Bohemia’s survival. Favoring the Czechs too much may result in the German lands seceding from the Empire. However, favoring the Germans too much may anger some powerful Czech figures who may support a change of government.
We are walking a tightrope and there is no safety net.
The New Bohemian Army

The first target of our reforms is naturally going to be what has long been the pride of our nation, the army. The army has long been in need of reform even before the Second Great German War, however because of that war we never had a chance to pursue such reforms. Now we must choose the direction of how we should reform the army and three ideas have presented themselves. First is to follow the advice of the German officers and focus on a high quality, well trained army with German as the operating language. The second plan is just to restaff and retrain the army along more conventional lines, however this will most likely only result in an army that while serviceable will not be exceptionable. Finally some veteran soldiers have advocated for a general expansion of the army, bringing in more Czechs and overwhelming our enemies by sheer numbers. No matter what option we choose it will make someone angry. The German option will anger the Czechs, the Czech option will anger the Germans, and the conventional one will anger both.
Go with German Quality.
Build around conventional lines.
Overwhelm with Czech quantity!
The New Bohemian Army

The first target of our reforms is naturally going to be what has long been the pride of our nation, the army. The army previously had been reformed under the advice of the German officers with a focus on a high quality, well trained army with German as the operating language. Now we must choose whether to restore the army under this direction or reform the army under two new ideas. The first new plan is just to restaff and retrain the army along more conventional lines, however this will most likely only result in an army that while serviceable will not be exceptionable. Secondly some veteran soldiers have advocated for a general expansion of the army, bringing in more Czechs and overwhelming our enemies by sheer numbers. Moving away from the previous German idea will surely anger the Germans, however sticking with the German method will anger the Czechs. Whatever we choose will be the the form of our nation’s army takes for the next 50 years.
Stick with German Quality
Build around conventional lines
Overwhelm with Czech quantity.
The New Bohemian Army

The first target of our reforms is naturally going to be what has long been the pride of our nation, the army. The army previously had been reformed under the advice of veteran soldiers who advocated for a general expansion of the army, bringing in more of what are now Czechs, and aim towards overwhelming our enemies by sheer numbers. Now we must choose whether to restore the army under this direction or reform the army under two new ideas. The first new plan comes from the advice of the German officers with a focus on a high quality, well trained army with German as the operating language. The Second new plan is just to restaff and retrain the army along more conventional lines, however this will most likely only result in an army that while serviceable will not be exceptionable. Moving away from the previous Czech idea will surely anger the Czechs, however sticking with the Czech method will anger the Germans. Whatever we choose will be the the form of our nation’s army takes for the next 50 years.
Go with German Quality
Build around conventional lines
Stick with Czech quantity.
The New Bohemian Army

The first target of our reforms is naturally going to be what has long been the pride of our nation, the army. The army previously had been reformed under conventional lines, which resulted in an army that while serviceable was not exceptionable. Now we must choose whether to restore the army under this direction or reform the army under two new ideas. The first new plan comes from the advice of the German officers with a focus on a high quality, well trained army with German as the operating language. Secondly some veteran soldiers have advocated for a general expansion of the army, bringing in more Czechs and overwhelming our enemies by sheer numbers. Moving towards either idea will anger the other group whose idea we reject. If we stick to the previous reform neither side will be angered but the army will be rather subpar as a result. Whatever we choose will be the the form of our nation’s army takes for the next 50 years.
Go with German Quality
Stick with conventional lines
Overwhelm with Czech quantity.
The Status of Religion in Bohemia

In the latter days of the Holy Roman Empire the matter of religion was based around the idea of “Cuius regio, eius religio” - whose realm, his religion. This was true in Bohemia as while most Germans are Catholics, a large number of the Czechs are Utraquists. These followers of Jan Hus have been in communion with Rome since the end of the Hussite Wars, affording them special religious protections. Even though the Empire is gone we have continued to follow the pluralistic ideal that whatever religion is the majority for that region will be the commanding religion there, especially among the Utraquists in particular. However, this still produces friction between the two groups as both can be prosecuted if they are in an opposing religion’s region, and hardline Catholics see Utraquists as Protestants while Utraquists insist they that are essentially Catholic. This religious divide, if handled poorly, may call into question the delicate balance of Bohemia's identity that has lain dormant for centuries under the Empire.
Grant more rights and protections to all religions in the realm.
Maintain Cuius regio, eius religio for our country
It’s time to fix this mistake. Only true Catholics belong here.
Scale Back the Constitution?

Our constitution, while popular with many people, has been much maligned by both the nobility and our Emperor Sigismund I. It is no surprise that the nobles, most likely under the direction of Sigismund, have begun campaigning for the removal of certain aspects of the constitution. The nobles propose dissolving the lower house while leaving the Land Diet as the only legislative body in Bohemia which would disenfranchise many voters. Not only that, the proposal would also remove some of the restrictions on Emperor Sigismund’s power and allow him to act independent of the legislature in regards to diplomatic, military, and economic matters.. While the Germans couldn’t care less about what happens to the constitution, the constitution is popular among the Czechs as they feel that it has given them a voice in government they have never had before. For his part Karl von Schwarzenberg has been trying to rally the council in keeping the constitution, and after a long debate the council reached a decision.
Leave the Constitution as it is.
Repeal some parts and increase the power of the Emperor.
Fate of the Constitution

Our constitution, while popular with many people, has been much maligned by both the nobility and our Emperor Sigismund I. It is no surprise that the nobles, most likely under the direction of Sigismund, have begun campaigning for the removal of the entire constitution. This would remove all elections in the Empire and restore the autocracy that was present at the start of Sigismund’s rule. While the Germans couldn’t care less about what happens to the constitution, the constitution is popular among the Czechs as they feel that it has given them a voice in government they have never had before. For his part Karl von Schwarzenberg has been actively trying to rally the council in keeping the constitution, and after a long debate the council reached a decision.
Leave the Constitution as it is
Repeal the Constitution and restore the Emperor’s autocracy
Fate of the German Diet

After gutting the constitution it was assumed that the Emperor’s political goals were satiated. However, the nobles have approached the reform council with one more proposal, dissolving the German led Diet entirely. This would remove all elections in the Empire and restore the autocracy that was present at the start of Sigismund’s rule. To say that this proposal is unpopular is an understatement as both Germans, and even the Czechs, have spoken out against this idea. Karl von Schwarzenberg has been frantically working to prevent this from happening knowing that this can only cause more problems down the line. Yet perhaps we might be able to cause an upset and surpass both powers…but only if we play our cards right. At the moment Scandinavia has by far more to lose in this contest than Bohemia, and is also in a more vulnerable position. If we want to assume leadership of the German people in the future then we must take an active role in defending them now. §RIf we fail to support Bohemia in this contest and they defeat Scandinavia, then garnering opposition to them in the future shall become much more difficult.§
Scandinavia shall get what it so richly deserves!
All we want is to protect our own people.
The Treaty of Prague

Fortune has not favored Scandinavia. Bohemia has driven us out of Germany in its entirety and we have been unable to reclaim our lands, forcing us to sue for peace. The resulting treaty has stripped us of all German-speaking lands in the former Holy Roman Empire. Bohemia has consolidated her position within Germany towards her own interest, bringing more and more of the Elbe beneath a single leadership. The announcement of this treaty has provoked apocalyptic fury towards the government across Scandinavian society. Many are calling not merely for the current administration’s resignation, but for its overthrow, in the face of this unmitigated disaster. The military is particularly irate at our failure and blames political interference from the civilian leadership for “stabbing Scandinavia in the back.” Revolution from the left or right could come at any moment and any possibility of advancing Scandinavian rule over Germany has been irrevocably lost.
God help us all.
The Treaty of Copenhagen

Fortune has not favored Bohemia. Scandinavia has shattered our offensive and brought the breadth of the Elbe Basin under its control, forcing us to sue for peace. The resulting treaty has stripped us of all German-speaking lands outside of the Bohemian territorial core. The Nordics have consolidated their position within Germany towards their own interest, bringing more and more of the Elbe under their influence. The announcement of this treaty has provoked apocalyptic fury towards the government across Bohemian society. Many are calling not merely for the current administration’s resignation, but for its overthrow, in the face of this unmitigated disaster. The military is particularly irate at our failure and blames political interference from the civilian leadership for “stabbing Bohemia in the back.” Revolution from the left or right could come at any moment and the advancement of Bohemian rule over Germany is now more improbable than ever.
God help us all.
The Treaty of Barcelona

Fortune has scowled upon Central Europe. Neither Bohemia nor Scandinavia could achieve a convincing victory, fighting one another to a stalemate. As a result the two powers were forced to sign a peace treaty in the neutral city of Barcelona. The resulting treaty has consolidated northern Germany within a united Elbian German state, not beholden to either nation. The announcement of this treaty has provoked apocalyptic fury towards the government across Bohemian society. Many are calling not merely for the current administration’s resignation, but for its overthrow, in the face of this unmitigated disaster. The military is particularly irate at our failure and blames political interference from the civilian leadership for “stabbing Bohemia in the back.” Revolution from the left or right could come at any moment and the advancement of Bohemian rule over Germany is now more improbable than ever.
We have damned ourselves.
The Treaty of Barcelona

Fortune has scowled upon Central Europe. Neither Bohemia nor Scandinavia could achieve a convincing victory, fighting one another to a stalemate. As a result the two powers were forced to sign a peace treaty in the neutral city of Barcelona. The resulting treaty has consolidated northern Germany within a united Elbian German state, not beholden to either nation. The announcement of this treaty has provoked apocalyptic fury towards the government across Scandinavian society. Many are calling not merely for the current administration’s resignation, but for its overthrow, in the face of this unmitigated disaster. The military is particularly irate at our failure and blames political interference from the civilian leadership for “stabbing Scandinavia in the back.” Revolution from the left or right could come at any moment and any possibility of advancing Scandinavian rule over Germany has been irrevocably lost.
We have damned ourselves.
The End of the Great Northern War
Scandinavia won and now we’ll probably get annexed someday soon.
Huh.
The End of the Great Northern War
Scandinavia lost and now Bohemia will take control of us. We shouldn’t have supported them.
My bad.
The End of the Great Northern War
We successfully betrayed Scandinavia but Bohemia’s victory was so great that they are going to take us over now.
My bad.
The End of the Great Northern War
Our failure to successfully betray Scandinavia and exploit their disorder during the Great Northern War has resulted in the restoration of the Scandinavian regime.
Damn.
The Restoration of Order across the Elbe

With our victory in the Great Northern War, we have once again taken control of $FROM$. Now that the most vehement anti-Scandinavian groups have given us a reason to eliminate their influence, we can prepare the region for closer integration into Scandinavia.
About time.
The Second Elbian Revolution

We have thrown off Scandinavia’s yoke, but that has not been enough to secure our liberty. Bohemia replaced them and, with the end of the war, has attempted to increase their own control in the region. This cannot be tolerated! No more shall the Elbian German people bend our knees for distant masters! We have ordered the expulsion of all Bohemian personnel from our nation, and interned their garrisons. The Junkers have reclaimed their rightful position as stewards of Germany, and shall lead us to battle against our ancient Bohemian oppressors.
Onwards, to a purified Germany!
The Second Elbian Revolution

There is an old saying : Never trust anyone who boasts to you of having lied to someone else. It is an adage which we ought to have heeded regarding the Elbians. Having been freed from Scandinavian oppression, they have now had the gall to turn upon us! The Junkers have executed a coup to consolidate state power within the hands of the nobility and have proclaimed the independence of $FROM$. All Bohemian officials within $FROM$ have been expelled and the few Bohemian soldiers stationed there interned. We have reason to believe that they do not merely desire to carve out a nation for themselves, but that they wish to challenge us for the mantle of the leading candidate to unify Germany!
THIS WILL NOT STAND.
The Second Elbian Revolution

It was hoped that the power of the Junkers would keep foreign influences out of $FROM$ and preserve our independence. Yet the nobles have instead turned their resources towards the oppression of our own citizens, and failed to leverage our nation’s strength in the cause of German unity. Now the time has come for the people to take matters into their own hands. Yesterday an outspoken liberal lawyer named Helmuth Oppler led a crowd of radical demonstrators to the National Landtag, demanding extensive reforms. Instead the city guards fired upon them to prevent them from storming the building, setting off a night of rioting. The violence continued into the morning and Oppler rallied the republicans to come out in force and seize the city! The Fallschwertmaschienen have been raised throughout the capital, and Oppler has been proclaimed Chairman of the League of Magdeburg. He has proclaimed that the League shall become the foundation of a unified German republic..
Freiheit, Gleichheit, Brüderlichkeit! (Liberty, Equality, Fraternity!)
The Second Elbian Revolution

Chaos has erupted across northern Germany. The Junkers have been assaulted by hordes of radical republicans, who have overthrown the government and installed a new regime under liberal lawyer Helmuth Oppler. Fallschwertmaschienen have been erected in all the major communities of the nation, and revolutionary tribunals have been instituted to formally deliver the Junkers unto them. Worst of all, Oppler and his cohorts have sworn that their “League of Magdeburg” shall adopt German unification as their official foreign policy! This represents an extreme danger to Bohemia, one which cannot be allowed to persist.
Crush them AT ONCE!
The Matter of Saxony

The continued existence of an independent Saxony presents an obstacle to our consolidation of northern Germany. So long as it persists, we will be unable to fully consolidate the Elbe beneath our leadership. However, a few members of the foreign office have arrived at a solution. They have proposed that we offer Saxony membership within a united Elbian Federation under our authority, in exchange for giving Saxony and its elites the leading role within said government. While it is possible that the Saxons will defy us, this is a quite generous offer considering the present condition of Germany and so they are likely to accept.
Make it so.
The Saxon Situation

The division of northern Germany can no longer be tolerated if we are to preserve our control of the region. The foreign office has proposed that we create a united Elbian Federation under our authority, until such time as we can more properly integrate the region. This would also aid our dismantlement of the traditional Junker manorial system in the area. While it is possible that a united Elbian state could chafe beneath our control, if the past has shown us anything it is that allowing multiple separate Elbian governments to exist unsupervised is not a wise idea.
We must consolidate our position.
The Elbian Consolidation
Scandinavia has now used its overwhelming influence across northern Germany to force all of the nations of the Elbian basin into a single state, and we shall be its foundation.
Very well.
The Elbian Consolidation
Scandinavia has now used its overwhelming influence across northern Germany to force all of the nations of the Elbian basin into a single state.
column16: #Hanover, Thurigina, and Bohemian Saxony gets forced to join the NGF

column2: If we must…
Scandinavian Offers Us Leadership of an Elbian Federation

It is an unfortunate fact that we remain beneath the shadow of Scandinavia. Yet our nation is far from impotent, a fact of which even Copenhagen is conscious. They have now proposed to make our nation the foundation of a new Elbian Federation beneath their protection. They argue that this consolidation of the Elbian Germans is to the region’s economic interest, but it is clear they also want to have a more efficient space within which to wield their influence. Yet such a nation could, when Scandinavia is vulnerable, be used as a weapon against their hegemony…They have left the final decision up to us, but it is clear that if we refuse then they shall force us into this new nation.
Perhaps we can turn this to our advantage…
We shall sooner welcome death than live as slaves!
The Formation of the Elbian Federation

The heads of state of the realms of northern Germany met in Lubeck to sign the treaty establishing a unified Elbian Federation. This government shall coordinate all matters of taxation, internal development, and other matters of domestic policy. However Scandinavia shall be the arbiter of its foreign policy and shall have the right during wartime to assume control of its armed forces. Many challenges lie ahead : the Elbian basin has yet to recover from the Hollowing, its economy is underdeveloped compared to other parts of Germany, and the peoples of this new Elbian state, despite sharing the same language, do not at all think of themselves as one nation. If we are to remain within northern Germany then we must labor to make the Elbian Federation a truly prosperous land.
They deserve no less.
The Second Elbian Revolution

Scandinavia’s attempt to maintain control of northern Germany has failed. The Junkers, long opposed to Scandinavia’s disruptive so-called “reforms,” have decided to strike back and defend their fatherland. This morning the government ordered the army into the streets to place all Scandinavian civil and military officials within the nation under arrest! After a brief struggle in the capital, the Scandinavian garrison was forcibly disarmed and locked in the city prison under armed guard along with all non-diplomatic Scandinavian personnel. No more shall the Elbian German people bend our knees for distant masters! The Junkers have reclaimed their rightful position as stewards of Germany, and shall lead us to battle against the Scandinavian invaders.
Alles fur Deutschland!
The Second Elbian Revolution

In retrospect, the establishment of a unified Elbian German nation may have been a fool’s errand. The consolidation of the region has, rather than making it easier to control, allowed the treacherous Junkers to combine their strength against us. This morning we received word of a reactionary coup d’etat in the Elbian Federation against us! The nobles of the realm have organized an anti-Scandinavian coalition under the banner of the League of Magdeburg, and have declared their intention to fight for their independence.
They WILL regret this.
The Second Elbian Revolution

Bohemia’s rapidly growing power in northern Germany threatens to allow them to completely consolidate the Elbian basin under their control. This cannot be permitted! The Elbian Germans cannot pass into the night without one final, glorious struggle for our liberty. We have made contact with anti-Bohemian elements across the region who are willing to join forces with ourselves to fight against Prague’s dominion. At our signal they shall rise up and pledge allegiance, allowing us to lead the coalition against the Bohemians. The risk of this endeavor is tremendous, but in the face of Bohemia’s resurgence throughout northern Germany, we have no other choice.
We must fight for our freedom!
The Second Elbian Revolution

”Desperate? Of course we are desperate. Everything in a revolution is desperate : it is always a choice between desperation now and safety later, or safety now and liberty never.” - Marinus Dahlke\n\nThe consolidation of Bohemia’s influence across northern Germany has caused more and more Elbians to chafe under their renewed authority. Saxony has now taken up the banner of insurrection, rallying the Elbian German people beneath the banner of a united Elbian state. Despite nationalist rebels rising up across northeastern Germany to bring the region under Saxony’s control, few international observers expect the revolution to succeed. If there is to be any chance of Bohemia’s restoration of its control over Germany being thwarted, then it shall be decided here.
A noble but futile gesture.
The Second Elbian Revolution

We have allowed a foreign power to gain economic hegemony in our Elbian protectorate. This has cut the legs out from underneath its institutions, and allowed Elbian nationalists to move back into the public eye. This morning they struck, with cells of nationalist militias assaulting government strongholds across the realm before seizing the administrative center and declaring independence! Bohemia has wasted no time in declaring their new nation an illegitimate state and they will almost certainly invade them as soon as they are able. We have lost control of northern Germany, perhaps this time forever.
Damn, damn, damn, damn!
Die Katastrophe

”Death is not worse than a dishonorable life which destroys its own soul as well as that of its neighbor.” - Vaclav Dvorák, Czech author and nationalist\n\nThe legitimacy of the Bohemian government has hinged upon its determination to prove its worth as a defender of the German people. The failure of successive Bohemian administrations to liberate the Germans of the Baltic coast put the lie to that notion. The radical opponents of the Bohemian government, sensing its weakness, have now seized upon the unrest created in Prague by a protest about high bread prices to marshall their supporters. Across the city, liberals, socialists, and both German and Czech nationalists are now brawling. The government is paralyzed between those who wish to court the reformists and those who wish to summon the Bohemian Army to cleanse the city of dissent. Nobody can predict what will happen next but the future of Bohemia has never looked worse.
God have mercy upon us!
Die Katastrophe

”Death is not worse than a dishonorable life which destroys its own soul as well as that of its neighbor.” - Vaclav Dvorák, Czech author and nationalist\n\nBohemian leadership over the German people is now a dead letter, as the German heartland has sprung from Prague's grasp, be it through war or intrigue. The radical opponents of the Bohemian government, sensing its weakness, have now seized upon the unrest created in Prague by a protest about high bread prices to marshal their supporters. Across the city, liberals, socialists, and both German and Czech nationalists are now brawling. The government is paralyzed between those who wish to court the reformists and those who wish to summon the Bohemian Army to cleanse the city of dissent. Nobody can predict what will happen next but the future of Bohemia has never looked worse.
God have mercy upon us!
Die Katastrophe

”Death is not worse than a dishonorable life which destroys its own soul as well as that of its neighbor.” - Vaclav Dvorák, Czech author and nationalist\n\nThe legitimacy of the Bohemian government has been founded upon the prestige of the House of Jagiellon and its support of the German-speaking elites against the Slavic lower classes. Now this delicate balance has been destroyed. The trouble began when Chancellor Franz Watzlawik, von Schwartzenberg’s successor, attempted to flee Prague to avoid anti-government riots over high bread prices, only to be caught by an angry mob of republicans and strung up from a streetlamp. Emperor Sigismund V barricaded himself inside of Prague Castle for his own safety, paralyzing the government. Now liberals, socialists, and both German and Czech nationalists have taken to brawling through the streets in the midst of this anarchy. Nobody can predict what will happen next but the future of Bohemia has never looked worse.
God have mercy upon us!
The $YEAR$ Constitution

The government was forced to make massive concessions to the rebels in order to avert a revolution. A new constitution has been quickly drafted and adopted whose terms include a universal male franchise, more equitable composition of the Diet, the right to public assembly, and the right to freedom of the press. The powers of the head of state have also been greatly curtailed. The most significant proviso was the establishment of Czech as the second national language of Bohemia alongside German, and that the government must strive for bilingualism going forwards. Time will tell if these provisions will actually be honored but for the time being most liberals in Bohemia have been satisfied.
We shall do what we must to survive…
The Ossification of Bohemia

We have managed to ride out the worst of the unrest. The extremists have been contained, and the moderates have reconciled with our government. The placating of the Czechs especially has bought our government a new lease on life. Yet a general sense of malaise is slowly creeping into the Bohemian spirit. Nobody can place a finger on the exact cause, but the national mood is becoming distinctly sour. There is a sense that we have missed our chance to make our mark upon history, that the fate of our nation will never be as great now as it may have been. Perhaps this is all just the prattle of pessimists, but we cannot ignore the possibility that, in choosing the path of safety, we have turned our back upon our destiny.
Peace in our time…?
The Prague Commune

The government’s promises of reforms failed to calm the masses. They remembered well how many times in the past the government had made similar assurances, only to take advantage of a lull in rebel activity to crush them. The socialists have convinced enough of the liberals to defect to their ranks to prevail in the street fighting, and seized control of most of Prague just after the head of state and his family were able to escape. The rebel leaders, led by half-Czech socialist ideologue and Chairman of the National Ironworkers’ Union Klement Dressler, declared the Prague Commune! “Premier” Dressler has called upon “the Bohemian proletariat” to launch a general strike to “cast down the bourgeois edifice of the old Bohemian order.” The military is clamoring for a brutal crackdown to purge Bohemian of Blanquist elements, but the interior minister insists that we can snip the revolt in the bud by capturing the national labor leadership outside of Prague.
§RFIAT IUSTITIA, ET PEREAT MUNDUS!§
Arrest every union leader that you can find!
The Bohemian Revolution

In the end the final actions of the old Bohemian regime did nothing but hasten its end. Arresting major labor leaders only ensured that there was nobody for the government to negotiate with to end the general strike or to order the unions to stand down, and attacks against labor unions and village self-defense collectives only pushed urban workers and rural farmers into one another's’ arms. Soon the military read the writing on the wall and scores of junior officers defected to the Commune, taking their soldiers with them. Within days, the old government had been dismantled, its remaining loyalists either driven into exile or given their eternal reward. A referendum was organized by the revolutionaries to authenticate their popular mandate, and with overwhelming support, the Blanquists have prevailed over all rivals. The time of $COUNTRY$ is over. The glorious age of the Bohemian Socialist Republic has begun!
Die Wahrheit siegt!
Der weiße Terror

”After receiving information about the Socialists, the commander of the captured detachment was shot. Under Colonel Engelbert Radetzky, there was some especially painful cruelty. I know of many cases when under the influence of hatred for the Socialists, the officers assumed the duties of shooting the captured volunteers. The executions were necessary because under the conditions in which the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Army had to move with the utmost speed, prisoners could not be taken…Hermsdorf we left a graveyard. The wives of the dead searched constantly for bodies, unaware of the horror behind the walls of Schloss Kynast. At least 2500 people were killed. Entire carts of bodies were carried there, like winter lamb and pork carcasses…” - Alois Brod, Bohemian veteran\n\nWe have suppressed the Blanquist menace. All major figures connected to left-wing organizations are being hunted down, and excessively leftist trade unions have been liquidated.
Pure necessity.
The Dissolution of Bohemia

”The motto of the old Empire : ‘Fiat iustitia, et pereat mundus’ - Let justice prevail, though the world perish. The motto of modern Bohemia : ‘Fiat iustitia, aut pereat mundus’ - Let both justice and the world perish.” - Silesian satirist Antonin Havel\n\nThe struggle to crush both the liberals and the socialists left us open to the Czech nationalists. Summoning reinforcements from the countryside, they seized control of Prague with the help of ethnic Czech military defectors. Their first act was to proclaim the establishment of a new, truly Czech state, launching brutal purges of German-speaking nobles and intellectuals throughout the nation. In light of this revolutionary bloodshed, the old Bohemian realm has broken apart, with regional elites in the north declaring independence. The last remnant of the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation has signed its own death warrant : Bohemia has erased itself from the face of Europe.
Dobré zbavení se špatného odpadu! (Good riddance to bad rubbish!)
A New King?

With the true stewards of Germany now once more in control of the Bohemians and the Elbians, we must decide upon a Head of State. There is an attraction in maintaining the "military state" as a law unto itself, but if we want recognition from the rest of Europe then we should at least put up a figurehead monarch to legitimize ourselves. There are two main candidates now that the Jagiellons have been cast out. The first is the House of Reuss, an obscure Saxon dynasty which would surely be grateful to us if the Diet were to nominate their Prince Heinrich XXIII as sovereign. The second is the House of Piast in southern Silesia, which maintains an old claim to the Bohemian throne. The Piasts were the first kings of Poland in ages past but now seem estranged from that land. While they understand that the new monarch would be a mere symbol for our regime they have insisted upon the candidacy of their Prince Leszek III to be the next ruler. A Piast puppet king might keep the Slavs quiet but some wonder if they have secret aspirations...
Wir sind der Staat!
Heinrich XXIII will serve our purposes.
What harm could come from Leszek III?
The Rise of Elbian German Nationalism

Our leadership of the Germans is once again in doubt. The northerners put their trust in us with the expectation that we would make definitive progress towards the unification of Germany. Yet this has not occurred : Bohemia remains as it was when the Empire fell. This situation is becoming untenable, as the Elbian Germans question whether they might be better off with a state for themselves. Time is running out to keep Elbian German separatist nationalism in check. §RIf we have not consolidated northern Germany under a more unified government in the near future, then this process may become irreversible.§
We WILL bring unity to the Elbe!
The Elbian Referendum

The Elbian Germans have lost their patience with us. Deploring the lack of progress towards German unification by Bohemia, they have taken matters into their own hands. Several German nationalist parties had for some time been advocating for an independence referendum for the north, a measure repeatedly declared illegal by our government. But it did not matter : loyalty to Prague in the north has fallen to such lows that not even the authorities were willing to stop them. The referendum was held, despite our attempts to quash it, and passed with overwhelming support. All Elbian German territories have now proclaimed themselves sovereign and separate from Bohemia. With no other option, we have declared martial law in the north and are mustering the army to restore order.
THESE CRIMINALS WILL PAY!
The Elbian Divorce

The Elbian German territories’ sudden independence from Bohemia in the aftermath of an independence referendum which Prague continuously denounced as illegal was feared to be the start of a civil war. However the Bohemian military, dominated as it is by Czech soldiers, became paralyzed with mutinies and insubordination when it was ordered north to crush the separatists. Many units refused to leave their barracks. As a result the democratic parties of the Diet - many of whom are dominated by Czech interests - were able to join forces with a handful of German defectors from the conservative parties to force through a bill recognizing Elbian German independence. Civil war has been avoided but any hope of Bohemia claiming a renewed position of leadership of the German people may now have been lost forever.
It had to be this way.
The Czech Revolution
The $YEAR$ Conference of Stuttgart - Conclusion

The Conference of Stuttgart was brought to a close with beset Danubian diplomats and statesmen leaving Stuttgart and the Burgundian delegation rejoicing in festivities commemorating this occasion well through the night. The Conference has stood out with a resounding victory for Burgundy, effectively making the states of Swabia into one country under Burgundian guidance. The Swabian dream is finally fulfilled - not through sweat or blood, but in an undignified manner, in the halls filled with sniveling diplomats engaging in debauchery, rendering it a dream cursed to its doom -  nowhere else for it to flower up and bloom in the death-ridden forests of Germania.
The pen has proven itself mightier to the sword for another time.
The Future of Swabia

The Conference of Stuttgart was favorable to the Swabian cause, in a way. Celebrations held all around the country commemorating the foundation of a new Swabian Kingdom, but were beset by the fact that the country is essentially deprived of its ambitions set by the agreements formulated by Burgundy and the Danubian Confederation in Stuttgart. Amidst the busy streets, the Landtag convenes once more (under Burgundian guidance) to deal with the matter of Swabian sovereignty: The radical remnants and the liberal faction have together settled for a wholly neutral Swabia while the conservative and pro-business Rheintreu have appealed for a “special status” within the Burgundian crown which would deprive us of all sovereignty and render us subservient to Anvers. After an intense day of debate, the Landtag finally settles on the one bill that would mean life or death for our country:
The Rheintreue succeed in their plans!
The vote is passed - Neutrality is upheld.
The Future of Swabia

The Conference of Stuttgart was favorable to the Swabian cause, in a way. Celebrations held all around the country commemorating the foundation of a new Swabian Kingdom, but were beset by the fact that the country is essentially deprived of its ambitions set by the agreements formulated by Burgundy and the Danubian Confederation in Stuttgart. Amidst the busy streets, the Landtag convenes once more (under Burgundian guidance) to deal with the matter of Swabian sovereignty: The radical remnants and the liberal faction have together settled for a wholly neutral Swabia while the conservative and pro-business Rheintreue have appealed for a “special status” within the Burgundian crown which would deprive us of all sovereignty and render us subservient to Anvers. After an intense day of debate, the Landtag finally settles on the one bill that would mean life or death for our country.:
Sûreté de l'État and Rheintreue operatives subvert the vote!
The vote is passed - Neutrality is upheld
The Burgundian Ultimatum

Sûreté de l'État and Rheintreue have managed - in all likelihood through bribery and blackmail - to compel the Landtag to seek Burgundian “protection.” Naturally this has outraged Swabian isolationists who see such measures as little more than deferred annexation. Yet Burgundy has wasted no time in “accepting” the results of the vote. Now a column of Burgundian soldiers is massing on the western border and their commander has requested permission to “expand defensive positions” within our nation. If we permit this then it will mean the end of our sovereignty. If we refuse then it shall mean war.
We have no choice…
If a single Burgundian soldier sets foot in Swabia, we will shoot him dead!
The Stuttgart Conference - The Swabian Partition

Our efforts in the Congress have been fruitful: Our delegation, along with the Danubians and Swabians, have agreed on the prospect of partitioning the former lands of the Swabian Circle. Many observers have seen this development as an unprecedented yet brief “lull” between German and Burgundian relations never seen before in the region for almost hundreds of years. Many critics of Burgundian foreign policy begged to differ, stating that the Burgundians still have “definite” sway over the course of the negotiations, speculating that the agreement is not entirely fool-proof - furthermore going on to say that “one misstep may lead to war”. Hopefully this will bring lasting peace along the Rhine?
A ‘compromise’ has been reached?!
The Danubians Dominant in the Stuttgart Conference!

Our efforts in the Congress have been met with despair: Our delegation was  shocked to see that the Danubian and Swabian circles have agreed to “collaborate” with each other. “Patriotic” pundits in Anvers have stated this as a provocation for war - as a revitalized German Confederation could lead to a shattering “domino effect” in Germany, urging our people to war and to stop the German threat once more as the fabled “mediators” of Europe. As a response, our delegation has demanded the Danubians to come to terms and agree to a “Swabian Partition” that would ensure the balance of affairs in Swabia and Central Europe. We must expect the Danubians to uphold their bargains!
They must agree or else…
The Stuttgart Conference - Burgundy Demands Partition!

Gottlob! Our efforts in the Congress have been met with success! In a fortunate stroke of luck, the Danubian and Swabian delegations have agreed to “collaborate” with each other. Most Danubians welcomed the news warmly - some even going further describing the occasion as an “ideal step for the German dream”. The Burgundians, aghast by the news, were quick to approach us with a ‘compromise’ -  to “partition” the Swabian territories. The Burgundians highly trust us to uphold our bargains - boasting their preeminent weal in mediating European affairs. §RDeclining, on the other hand, would not be a viable option for us as it will irrevocably lead to an open conflict with the Burgundians that will cost us dearly! §!
We abide by these terms.
The Danubian Ambition shall not be stopped by mere “compromises”!
The Stuttgart Conference - $FROM_COUNTRY$ Demands Annexation!

The $FROM_COUNTRY_ADJ$ government demands that we uphold the treaties and agreements stipulated in the Stuttgart Conference and relinquish our sovereignty to the said state, effective from this date forward.
We abide by these terms
Auf meinen Arsch!
The $YEAR$ Stuttgart Conference - The Swabian Partition

The status of the territories of the former Swabian Circle have been subject to countless conflicts throughout its history, dating back to Roman times. Years later, the former Reich under Wenceslaus V attempted to mediate the issue, to no avail, leaving it to be torn apart by the Wars of the coalition in the early XIXth Century.\nThe most recent Stuttgart Conference concluded with an interesting outcome: the Swabian Partition. Under the terms, Burgundy was to assume lordship over the Duchy of Baden. The Swiss Confederation, furthermore, was to be granted “indefinite neutrality” in foreign affairs. Lastly, The Danubian Confederation was to receive direct control over territories on the ‘east’ of Baden, notably the former Duchy of Wurttemberg, the Free City of Ulm and the lone canton of Graubünden. The tense situation in Europe has entered a thaw, and many hope that this development shall enshrine a new age of mutual respect between powers in Europe!
Our borders on the Neckar to the Alps are now secure!
The Stuttgart Conference - An Intervention in Swabia?

The situation in Swabia has rendered itself untenable. With Bedingung A.II of the Stuttgart Conference in full effect both Burgundian and Danubian delegations have agreed on the restoration of order to the rogue Revolutionary Republic of Swabia. Our Burgundian counterparts have demanded us their “full and unwavering cooperation” in this endeavor - demanding that we partition Swabia upon the war’s conclusion in order to maintain the balance of power in European affairs. §RBe forewarned, refusal would lead to another massive European war with Burgundy and Swabia outright§!
Agree to the terms.
No compromise with the Burgundians - We’re fine on our own.
La guerre Souabe

The region of the former Swabian Circle has been subject to countless conflicts throughout its history, dating back to Roman times. Years ago, Wenceslaus V attempted to mediate the issue as part of his centralization and consolidation of the Imperial Estates. This failed and Swabia was left to be torn apart by the early 19th century Wars of the Coalition.\n\nBurgundy and the Danubians, deeming the Swabian situation untenable and refusing negotiations with the “rogue state” of the revolutionary Swabian Republic, have concluded that the Swabian Problem can only be solved by the sword out of fear that the Swabians might otherwise sow the seeds of revolution that ravaged Europe in the early 19th century once more. The revolutionaries in Swabia now prepare to “wave the flag of revolution honorably to the death.” Hopefully this conflict shall end the thousand year struggle in the lands of the Alemanni and settle the matter of Swabia at last!
No quarter shall be given for revolutionary scum.
Der Große Vaterländische Krieg

Our country has entered a point of no return. With the perfidious Kingdom of Burgundy and treasonous Danubian Confederation both plotting our demise we have been left with no choice. This is not an excuse to back down, however. The Swabian people, after all, have fulfilled their dream, a dream that they will not relinquish over a mere “Bedingung”. We have achieved freedom!\n\nAll able men are now at arms to the hills and trenches dotting the entire country, bidding farewell to their maidens and mothers, probably for the last time. The rest are at the factories and gunsmiths, or digging the trenches necessary for the Fatherland’s defense. If these “powers” dare take our inviolable liberty than us, then it shall be paid for tremendously in blood!
Fear not, Fatherland! Your stalwart sons shall be loyal to the grave!
The Great Swabian War - Picking A Side???

With war between Burgundy and the Danubian Confederation on the horizon, our country is split despite our explicit stances of “neutrality” in the impending conflict. Knowing well that they shall not restrain themselves to fulfill their ambitions in the lands of Swabia, we are left with no choice but to pick a side.
Ally with the Danubian Confederation
Ally with the Kingdom of Burgundy
La guerre Souabe

The status of the territories of the former Swabian Circle have been subject to countless conflicts of varying degrees throughout its history, dating as far back to Roman times. Years later, Wenceslaus V attempted to mediate the issue with his attempts to centralize and consolidate the various holdings of the Reich to no avail only leaving it to be torn apart by the early XIXth century Wars of the Coalition.\n\nWith the recent failure of the Stuttgart Conference, which had sought to resolve the Swabian Question, the mighty Burgundians and the resurgent Danubians have instead chosen to draw blood. Hopefully this conflict shall bring upon the end of a thousand year struggle in the lands of the Alemanni, settling the matter of the Swabian lands once and for all,
The Forêt Noire shall be bathed in blood.
Der Großer Schwabenkrieg

”Black Forest, at midnight,
A pioneer stands on guard.
A star sparkles high up in the sky,
Bringing greetings far from home.”
- Excerpt from a Danubian army song of the Swabian War
The status of the lands of the former Swabian Circle have been subject to countless conflicts throughout its history, dating back to Roman times. Years ago, Wenceslaus V attempted to mediate the issue with his attempts to centralize and consolidate the various holdings of the Reich to no avail only leaving it to be torn apart by the early 19th century Wars of the Coalition. With the recent failures of the Stuttgart Conference in resolving the Swabian Question the mighty Burgundians have instead chosen to draw blood. Ww could intervene against both Burgundians and Swabians and, hopefully this conflict shall bring upon the end of a thousand year struggle in the lands of the Alemanni, settling the matter of the Swabian lands once and for all.
The Schwarzwald shall be bathed in blood.
Is this gamble really worth it?
The Stuttgart Conference - The Danubians Defy Us!

It appears that the Danubians have failed to see the light. All negotiations had broken down earlier at the conference due to the “tense” and “uneasy” situation that soon followed over the matter of “dividing” the Swabian territories. This is a clear sign that the Danubians government has their own ambitions and machinations for Swabia. Conservatives and Paternalists at the Chamber of Deputies have rebuked this situation, acknowledging that the use of force is preferential to “punish” the Danubians for their “insolence”. The anti-war liberals moderate however have urged restraint, preferring to remain neutral in the conflict and instead focus the governments’ energies on reviving the country from its war-torn state brought upon by the Civil War rather than being involved in a “ potentially costly” and “useless'' war in Swabia.
Prenez vos armes, messieurs, direction la Souabe! - Forward to Swabia!
”Mais les chagrin des veuves ! L'angoisse des endeuillés...”
Victory in the Große Vaterländische Krieg

We have witnessed the miracle of miracles! Our soldiers, despite their weariness over the tremendous cost of life and the dreary conditions on the front, have erupted in jubilation with the news of an armistice effective at 12:30 in the afternoon. Many have already taken to the streets in many cities, greeting marching columns of Swabian regulars and Waldjäger militias with flowers, hugs and even kisses! The Danubians and the Burgundians were aghast at this development, outright dumbfounded. The Treaty of Baden-Baden was signed on this day, with the defeated powers recognizing the Revolutionary State of Alemannia and allowing trade to be conducted through the lifting of border controls from each respective country. The Swabian people will now sleep easy knowing that they have proven themselves worthy of the title of being the new beacon of freedom in Southern Germany!.
The sons of the Alemanni have remained true to their duty.
Defeat in the Große Vaterländische Krieg

Fortune continues to elude us. The Swabian regulars and Waldjäger militias were cut down in the forests and mountains of our homeland by the enemy, and now we all must pay the price of failure. The Treaty of Stuttgart, imposed by the Danubians and the Burgundians, has dismantled our nation. Baden, Wurttemberg, and the Graubund have all been restored, and the resurrected Swiss Confederacy, forced into official neutrality, is the last remnant of our once-revolutionary nation. Swabia returns to what it has been for centuries : a patchwork of buffer states between greater powers.
The sons of the Alemanni are divided once more.
The Treaty of Stuttgart

With the Alemannian state smashed to pieces, we have met the Burgundians in Stuttgart to formalize its partition. Ulm Wurttemberg, and the Graubund have all been restored and placed under our influence. Some German nationalists have called our actions treasonous but for now the threat of a Dahlkist resurgence has been ended.
It had to be done.
The Treaty of Stuttgart

With the Alemannian state smashed to pieces, we have met the Danubians in Stuttgart to formalize its partition. Baden and the Swiss Confederacy have both been restored, the former placed under our control and the latter made officially neutral as a buffer state. Some expansionists have criticized the government for not taking full control of the Swiss as well, but for now the threat of a Dahlkist resurgence has been ended.
An acceptable conclusion.
Le Miracle de la Forêt Noire

After a fierce fight with the Swabians we have finally achieved victory. Swabian forces put up a commendable fight with one memorable battle taking place in la Forêt Noire  - the Black Forest. A Burgundian division had to march through the forest, but during the march three regiments got lost. These regiments were then accosted by Waldjäger militias who constantly harassed them and seemed poised to eliminate them. However instead of a repeat of the Battle of the Teutoburg Forest these regiments stuck together and found their way back to Burgundy after a week in the forest. This event has encapsulated the spirit of the war in our popular culture and has become known as ‘Le Miracle de la Forêt Noire’. Regardless of what happened we must now handle the Swabian state. Since we are not conquers, the Swabians will have a responsible government installed with us as their protectors against those who would seek their destruction. With this we can secure the southern Rhine border and deny those perfidious Danubians the lands of the Alemanni.
Au revoir, Danubiens!
The Conclusion of the Schwabenkrieg

Despite the veracity of the Swabians and the might of the Burgundians we have triumphed over both of them. The Swabia’s Revolutionary Republic has been dismantled and incorporated into our country and the people of the former Swabia shall be equal citizens to the Danubians. Burgundy on the other hand will receive a lighter punishment and will be forced to recognize this new order in Southern Germany and renounce any interest in the former Swabian lands. With the lands of the Alemanni now under our control, our dream of a united Germany appears to be halfway done, it is only a matter of time before the North joins us as well.
Servus, Burgunder!
Defeat in the Große Vaterländische Krieg

The hills and the forests of the Schwarzwald are riddled with the blood of patriotic Swabians and those of our enemies. Yet all of our efforts were in vain and we have lost the war for our independence. However, neither the Burgundians nor the Danubians were able to achieve a decisive victory and have instead seen fit to divide our country amongst themselves. We have no choice but to adhere to their demands and dissolve the Swabian union once and for all. At least we ourselves will maintain  some independence in the Alpines, but our chance to become something greater has now passed.
A dark day for our cause.
The Stuttgart Conference - The Danubians Defy Us!

It appears that the Danubians have failed to see the light. All negotiations had broken down earlier at the conference due to the “tense” and “uneasy” situation that soon followed over the matter of “dividing” the Swabian territories. This is a clear sign that the Danubians government has their own ambitions and machinations for Swabia. Conservatives and Paternaists at the Chamber of Deputies have rebuked this situation, acknowledging that the use of force is preferential to “punish” the Danubians for their “insolence”. The anti-war liberals moderate however have urged restraint, preferring to remain neutral in the conflict and instead focus the governments’ energies on reviving the country from its war-torn state brought upon by the Civil War rather than a “costly and useless” war in Swabia.
À partir de! A la Souabe !
”Mais les chagrin des veuves ! L'angoisse des endeuillés...”
Burgundy Folds Over Swabia

Despite Burgundy being considered one of the most powerful nations, they have apparently considered the effort of going against us too great and will let us have a free hand in Swabia. Crowds have gathered in $CAPITAL$ to celebrate our victory and plans are already being made to incorporate Swabia into our country. We have shown to all of Europe and especially the Germans what a united German state is capable of. All the remains is extending our hand out to the Swabians and politely, yet firmly, ask them to join their brothers.
column16: #SGF- Burgundy backs down lets eat the Swabians

column2: Give Swabia the ‘offer’ to join our union
$FROM_COUNTRY$ Demands We Join Their Union

The debate between the Burgundians and the Danubians over us has finally reached a conclusion and that is to let the Danubians have a free hand in our country. The Danubians have decided that our future best lies with us joining their union. With Burgundy out of the picture there is no one who will stand with us against the Danubians if we should refuse. Honestly, most of the population seems excited at the prospects of joining the Danubians and working towards the dream of a united Germany. However we need to ask ourselves is our future a German one or a Swabian one?
column16: #Swabians have to decide if they want to be eaten by Swabian or put up a pointless defense

column2: For the sake of Germany we submit. §R(ANNEXATION)§!
Swabia will not go without a fight!
Burgundy Threatens Us Over Swabia

When we pulled out of the Stuttgart Conference we knew doing so would incur the ire of Burgundy. Unsurprisingly Burgundy has issued us an ultimatum demanding that we renounce any interest over Swabia and recognize them as being a part of the Burgundian sphere of influence. Crowds have gathered in $CAPITAL$ demanding that we confront Burgundy and fight over the future of Swabia. Burgundy may have the stronger army, however the terrain of Swabia favors the defenders, and even if we can stalemate the Burgundian army we may still be able to leverage a favorable peace deal out of it. Granted that all depends on if our military is up for the task.
The Schwarzwald shall be bathed in blood.
Is this gamble really worth it?
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Backs Down over Swabia

The Danubians have come to their senses and have finally backed down over Swabia in the face of our might. With the Danubians out of the picture we can now extend our influence over the region and ensure that the Swabian government becomes our loyal vassal. We have already sent an envoy with our demands to Swabia, if they are like the Danubians they should also fold to our demands. Otherwise we shall teach them a lesson in what happens when you go against us.
We must demand Swabian submission.
Burgundy Demands our Submission

The debate between the Burgundians and the Danubians over us has finally reached a conclusion and that is to let the Burgundians extend their influence over us. A Burgundian envoy has already arrived with a treaty for us that will tie our economic, political, and military under them, effectively making us a vassal of the Burgundians. At the very least we still have some form of self governance, but we will always have to put Burgundian interests first and abandon any hope for further integration with the German region. What shall our reply be to the Burgundian envoy?
We agree to all demands…
We will meet you on the field of battle!
War Looms in Swabia

The Danubians have ended any attempt to settle the fate of our region through diplomacy. Many fear that they will attempt the outright conquest of Swabia, and thus we must seek Burgundian protection. For now this faction has prevailed and we are bracing for a coming struggle with the Danubians.
We will stand our ground!
War Looms in Swabia

The Burgundians have issued an ultimatum to the Danubians, demanding total control of Swabia. Many fear that they will attempt the outright conquest of Swabia, and thus we must seek Danubian protection. For now this faction has prevailed and we are bracing for a coming struggle with the Burgundians.
We will stand our ground!
War Looms in Swabia

The Danubians have ended any attempt to settle the fate of our region through diplomacy, and in response the Burgundians have issued a proclamation that Swabia is under their protection. Many fear that war between both powers is imminent, and that we must side with one power or the other for the sake of national defense. While the Burgundians have the stronger legal argument for their actions, German nationalists abhor the thought of placing our faith in the hands of a foreign, non-German state. Burgundy also has the larger military, but the territory of our land would favor an eastern defender like the Danubians.
We must stand with our fellow Germans!
Burgundy will keep us free!
War Looms in Swabia

The Danubians have ended any attempt to settle the fate of Swabia through diplomacy. Many fear that they will attempt the outright conquest of our nation, and thus we must seek Burgundian protection. Anvers has pledged to defend our independence against any pan-nationalists aggression from the easterners.
We will stand our ground!
The Great Swabian War

”To abandon your shield is the basest of crimes.” - Tacitus, ‘Germania’\n\nSwabia has been divided against itself for centuries, long coveted by surrounding empires. What began as an attempt to unite the region has ended in acrimony, with the Burgundians in the west and the Danubians in the east drawing swords against one another for the fate of the region. The repercussions of the war to come stretch far beyond the Alps or the Schwartzwald. The momentum of German pan-nationalism shall either be accelerated or arrested. While many observers see the war as an inevitable Burgundian victory, the Danubians hold a strong position and may not be easily bested. The future of Germany remains unknown but the next omen of its fate shall be discerned when Swabia once more emerges from the tumult of battle.
Onwards, through the Schwartzwald and to the Danube!
The Treaty of Stuttgart

We have been forced out of Swabia by the Burgundians and to avoid further destruction a peace treaty has been imposed upon us. Swabia as a whole now lies beneath Burgundian influence and our star among the German states has begun to fall. The people of our nation are irate at our failure to advance the cause of German unification, none more so than our military, whose officers have taken to dark statements about being “stabbed in the back” by the civilian leadership. This defeat bodes ill for our national stability, to say nothing of our candidacy as the unifier of Germany.
Disastrous!
The Treaty of Ulm

To the shock not only of our nation but of Europe as a whole, the Danubians have forced us out of Swabia! With the Burgundian heartland under threat, a peace treaty has been imposed upon us. Swabia as a whole now lies beneath Danubian influence and our eastern policy has been dealt a terrible blow. The people of our nation are irate at our failure to check the advance of German unification, none more so than our military, whose officers have taken to dark statements about being “stabbed in the back” by the civilian leadership. This defeat bodes ill for our national stability.
Damnation!
The Treaty of Konstanz

While we were able to keep the Danubians from seizing total control of Swabia, we have been unable to break their defensive lines in entirety. Thus we have met in Konstanz to negotiate an end to our war. The terms of the treaty have ratified the partition of Swabia between Danubian and Burgundian spheres of influence. While this represents an unfortunate setback to our eastern policy we have at least managed to assert our control of the southwestern states.
It could have been worse…
The Treaty of Konstanz

While we were able to keep the Danubians from seizing total control of Swabia, we have been unable to break their defensive lines in entirety. Thus we have met in Konstanz to negotiate an end to our war. The terms of the treaty have ratified Swabian neutrality, to be mutually upheld by both ourselves and by the Danubians. While this represents an unfortunate setback to our eastern policy we have at least managed to keep the region both consolidated and out of Danubian hands.
It could have been worse…
The Baden Compromise

Despite our best efforts we could not defeat the Danubians in the field of battle. Likewise the Danubians could not break our army and we have been forced into a stalemate. With tensions over the Swabian lands still high we have been forced to compromise with the Danubians as to what that future should be. After a long debate in the Swabian city of Baden we have finally reached a compromise. The Former lands of Swabia are to be divided between Burgundy and Danubia. The Württemberg region of Swabia is to be governed directly by Swabia, while the Baden region is to be under the guidance of Burgundy. The remaining Swabian territory shall become a neutral and independent country confined to the Alpine mountains. While we may not have achieved all of our goals at least we have gained something from this terrible war.
At least we have secured the upper right bank of the Rhine.
The Zürich Compromise

Despite our best efforts we could not defeat the Danubians in the field of battle. Likewise the Danubians could not break our army and we have been forced into a stalemate. With tensions over the future of Swabia still high we have been forced to compromise with the Danubians as to what shall happen with Swabia.
