After a long debate in the Swabian city of Zürich we have finally reached a compromise. Swabia shall remain independent and more importantly neutral on the world stage. This will create a large buffer between the Burgundians and the Danubians which should prevent any direct conflict over the upper bank of the Rhine. This isn’t an ideal outcome for us, but at least it gives us some security along our borders for now.
A buffer state at least gives us some protection.
Jean’s Rhenish Project

Recently King Jean has had regular meetings with the Duke of Berg, Frédéric-Guillaume de Jülich. Given that the Duke is Jean’s uncle on his father’s side and the Duke was accompanied by his very young son, Guillaume, it was assumed they were just meeting to talk about family matters. However, word has gotten out that Jean has been pressuring Frédéric-Guillaume to unify the Rhenish states under a loose confederation with Jean assuring the Duke that Burgundy will support the creation of this confederation. This has angered the Parliament as it is the job of the Prime Minister to direct the foreign policy for the country. When confronted about this Jean was reported to say “Correct, the Prime Minister does direct foreign policy, but whatever the Duke does is of his own violation, and we only ask that the Prime Minister supports him.” Unfortunately the Duke is back in Berg and there is nothing that can be done to stop Jean’s Rhenish project. We can only hope they stay pro-Burgundian in the end.
What’s the point of even having a Prime Minister?
Jean Demands we Unify the Rhein

After what should have been a simple family visit between our Duke, Frédéric-Guillaume, and his nephew the King of Burgundy, Jean VI, our Duke has now come back with plans for a Confederation of Rhenish States. Apparently Jean has pressured our Duke to unify all the Rhenish states under our control as a means to create an effective buffer state in the wake of the fall of the Holy Roman Empire. Jean has also made it clear that while Burgundy will give passive support to the Rhenish project it will not intervene for us and for the sake of Rhenish unity this is something we will have to do for ourselves. For his part at least, Jean’s Confederation might actually be enticing enough to unify the Rhenish territories, but the hard part will be getting everyone together to actually talk about this idea. We will draw up plans to try and present these ideas to our neighbors and hopefully Burgundy will stop interfering with us in these matters.
We are just a cork in the maelstrom of German politics.
The Western Threat

The demolition of the Burgundian monarchy and its replacement by a republican regime is a dire threat to our nation. It is feared that the new Burgundian government may attempt to spread its republican ideas across the Rhenish lands. Fortunately the Duke of Berg has a plan. He will convene a conference of the Rhenish German states in Düsseldorf with the goal of forming a united confederation - not to oppose Burgundy, but to cooperate with them. By presenting himself as the leader of the Rhenish Germans it is hoped that the Burgundians can be convinced to accept him as their ally. It may be a desperate plan but it is better than waiting for Anvers to strike us down.
It’s worth a shot…
Announcement of the Conference of Düsseldorf

This morning Duke Frédéric-Guillaume of Berg has formally announced that a conference will be held in $CAPITAL$ to address “questions of grave economic and political importance for the states of the Rhine.” While the announcement was loaded with lofty language, all who are familiar with the recent track of Rhenish politics can see that this is a clear attempt to orchestrate the confederation of the Rhenish states under one unified government. Burgundy has noted this declaration with approval, and will be keeping a close eye on its proceedings. Now we can only hope that the other states of the Rhine are willing to entertain their - our? - plans.
We shall see.
Berg Announces a Conference on Rhenish Union in Düsseldorf

We have received a letter from the Duke of Berg, Frédéric-Guillaume inviting our $MONARCHTITLE$ to attend a conference at Düsseldorf Castle in regards to the creation of a unified Rhenish State. The Duke also makes it clear that anyone attending the conference will adhere to the final result and as proof Frédéric-Guillaume personally offers his word that he will adhere to whatever the conference decides. The letter also contains some…let’s just call it powerful persuasive evidence as to why it is in our best interest to attend this conference which we cannot refute. It appears that a new era of Rhenish unity may be upon us, hopefully its under a government we can agree with.
Fine, we shall go, but we don’t have to like it.
Announcement of the Conference of Düsseldorf

This morning Duke Frédéric-Guillaume of Berg has formally announced that a conference will be held in $CAPITAL$ to address “questions of grave economic and political importance for the states of the Rhine.” While the announcement was loaded with lofty language, all who are familiar with the recent track of Rhenish politics can see that this is a clear attempt to orchestrate the confederation of the Rhenish states under one unified government. Burgundy has noted this declaration with approval, and will be keeping a close eye on its proceedings. Now we can only hope that the other states of the Rhine are willing to entertain their - our? - plans.
We shall see.
Berg Announces a Conference on Rhenish Union in Düsseldorf

We have received a letter from the Duke of Berg, Frédéric-Guillaume inviting our $MONARCHTITLE$ to attend a conference at Düsseldorf Castle in regards to the creation of a unified Rhenish State. The Duke also makes it clear that anyone attending the conference will adhere to the final result and as proof Frédéric-Guillaume personally offers his word that he will adhere to whatever the conference decides. The letter also contains some…let’s just call it powerful persuasive evidence as to why it is in our best interest to attend this conference which we cannot refute. It appears that a new era of Rhenish unity may be upon us, hopefully its under a government we can agree with.
Fine, we shall go, but we don’t have to like it.
The Duke’s Speech

”Our goal must be to avoid becoming a community of dreadful fear and hate, and be, instead, a proud confederation of mutual trust and respect” - Frédéric-Guillaume\n\nWith the Duke’s opening speech out of the way he begun laying out the preliminary outline of the proposed Rhenish Confederation. After much debate, and many amendments, it is time for the members to vote on adopting the new Rhenish Constitution. The only roadblock remaining is the vote for the leader of the union, the Prince-Primate. Münster is influential enough that they could run for the position of Prince-Primate, or even try to make their own version of a Rhenish Confederation. However our one ace in the hole hopefully should be Hesse-Nassau as the dynastic relations of the Hesse-Nassau should influence the other states and guarantee us our rightful position. At this point all we can do is wait and see what the members choose.
We’ve done our part, and now it's time to wait.
We Agree with Berg’s Confederation Plan
Only a fool would think that this Conference was Berg’s idea
column3: Burgundy is clearly the mastermind behind this plan. However, considering the overwhelming Burgundian influence in our country we do not see an issue with going along with the Rhenish Confederation. This arrangement will provide us with both protection from other foreign powers and stability that has been lacking since the fall of the Holy Roman Empire. While this will place Berg above us in terms of power, we will have to recognize this as a cost of joining the Confederation. While we would like to be the Prince-Primate of the confederation there is no way we can overcome the Burgundian influence to become the leader of this Confederation.

column2: Stability above all.
We Announce our Candidacy to Lead the Rhenish Confederation

It’s blindly obvious that this conference to make a Rhenish Confederation is just a Burgundian plot to solidify their influence over the region. Berg and Burgundy think that we are just puppets that they can toy with, then they’ve got another thing coming. At this point there is nothing we can do to stop the conference, but we can try to rob Burgundy of their influence over the region by announcing our candidacy to the leading position of the Confederation, the Prince-Primate. We will use our Elbian ties to Bohemia as an alternative to Burgundian influence and if there is enough support then we can take the title of Prince-Primate and bring us under protection of Bohemia.
A German Presence for a German Country.
The Birth of Westphalia

If Berg believes that we shall blindly follow this Burgundian scheme then they are sorely mistaken. The only reason we were invited is because we lie in the Rhenish area of Germany, otherwise culturally we have more in common with the Northern, Elbian Germans. We have reached out to our friends in Copenhagen and they have informed us that if we were to create our own competing union in the Rhenish area then they will support us. Instead of creating a country with an artificial name like ‘The Confederation of the Rhine’ we shall look to the past and name our union after the old Duchy of Westphalia. Our influence over the greater Rhenish states may be limited, and chances are only Osnabrück may join us, but our existence will at least be a constant annoyance to both Berg and Burgundy.
We’ll create our own Union with Blindhuhn and Himmel und Erde!
The Birth of Westphalia

If Berg believes that we shall blindly follow this Burgundian scheme then they are sorely mistaken. The only reason we were invited is because we lie in the Rhenish area of Germany, otherwise culturally we have more in common with the Northern, Elbian Germans. With the sudden loss of Burgundian influence within our nation we now have the freedom to create our own competing union in the Rhenish area. Instead of creating a country with an artificial name like ‘The Confederation of the Rhine’ we shall look to the past and name our union after the old Duchy of Westphalia. Our influence over the greater Rhenish states may be limited, and chances are only Osnabrück may join us, but our existence will at least be a constant annoyance to both Berg and Burgundy.
We’ll create our own Union with Blindhuhn and Himmel und Erde!
Exporting the Revolution

When we received notice about this farce of a conference we had no desire to actually partake in this Burgundian ploy. However, this conference does give us a once in a lifetime opportunity. Almost all the leaders of the Rhenish states are cooped up in one place and if we were to capture most, if not all of them, we could bring the revolution to completion and create a unified Republic of the Rhine. With that in mind we have both smuggled in our revolutionaries as diplomatic aides and have made contact with revolutionary groups inside of Berg. During the next meeting our revolutionaries and their allies will launch an attack on the conference in Düsseldorf Castle with the goal of overwhelming both the Duchy of Berg and capturing as many heads of state as we can. This is a risky plan, but by doing this we can seize control of this unification of the Rheinland and repurpose to fit our own plan.
Delightfully devilish, Münster.
Revolutionaries Besiege the Conference!

Düsseldorf Castle has come under siege by revolutionaries while the Conference was having a debate on the legislative matters of the Rhenish Confederation. To make matters worse members of the Münster delegation are actively sabotaging the defense of the castle and have even opened the gates to the revolutionaries. At this point the conference members are trapped in the banquet hall while Duke Frédéric-Guillaume tries to organize his royal guard to either fight back the revolutionaries while keeping an escape route open for himself. If the Conference falls, almost all of the heads of state of the Rhenish states will be captured and we will most likely see the rise of a liberal republic instead of our Confederation. Ultimately after a long fought battle the end result was…
The Royal Guard fends off the Revolutionaries!
The Revolutionaries seize the Conference as the Duke flees!
Münster Announces their Westphalian Alternative

In an upsetting turn of events Münster has decided to not only withdraw from The Conference of Düsseldorf, but also create their own Rhenish union that they call Westphalia under the protection of Scandinavia. While this may seem like a blow to Rhenish unity the only member that has joined the Westphalian state was the small state of Osnabrück and considering the regions were mostly populated by Elbian Germans, no Rhenish majority areas were lost to us. Not only that but without Münster’s influence, our ascendance to the role of Prince-Primate is now assured. While Burgundy may not be too pleased by these turn of events they should be happy that at least they retain some influence in this region.
Annoying but, we don’t need Münster.
Should We Join Westphalia?

Münster has decided to create their own Rhenish Union and has asked us to join them. Münster has made it clear that even if we refuse they will still claim our lands as their own. We could try to hold out and see of we can join Berg’s Confederation, however there does not seem to be a viable way for us to remain independent and any attempt to do so may only delay the inevitable.
We shall join Westphalia §R(ANNEXATION)§!
We refuse.
The Vote for the Rhenish Grand Prince

With the The Conference of Düsseldorf wrapping up the only thing that remains is the vote for who will lead the Rhenish Confederation. Due to our dynastic ties we can easily influence the vote to lean towards one side or the other. Many expect that Berg will win and many also expect that we will vote for them. However we could throw a curveball and vote for Münster instead. Doing this would favor Bohemian interests over the Burgundian interests that are backing Berg, however this will only work if Münster is also pro-Bohemian. If we do vote for Münster and they are not pro-Bohemian then our vote will be for naught and whatever happens next is out of our control.
We vote for Berg and Burgundy.
We vote for Münster and the hope of Bohemia
The Westphalian Ambition

The Duchy of Berg had once entertained plans to promote itself as the locus for the unification of the Rhenish German states, but the ousting of the House of Jülich from its ancestral lands has put an end to that project. Yet we remain under threat from the Burgundian republican regime, one which shares an interest in spreading its influence eastwards throughout the Rhine. We have reached out to our friends in Copenhagen and they have informed us that if we were to create our own union of the Rhine then they will support us. Instead of creating a country with an artificial name like ‘The Confederation of the Rhine’ we shall look to the past and name our union after the old Duchy of Westphalia. Our influence over the greater Rhenish states may be limited, and chances are only Osnabrück may join us, but our existence will at least be a constant annoyance to both Berg and Burgundy.
Lang lebe Westfalen!
Frédéric-Guillaume Wins the Vote for Grand Prince

As we have expected, Frédéric-Guillaume has won the vote to become the Grand Prince of the new Rhenish Confederation. The overwhelming influence of Burgundy in the Rhenish region has carried us to this position and with it we shall affirm our loyalty to Burgundy for all the work they have done. All that is left is for the members of the conference to ascend to membership with the Confederation.
As was expected.
Duke Dietrich VI of Münster Wins the Vote for Grand Prince

To our shock and horror the Duke of Münster has won the vote for Grand Prince of the Rhenish Confederation. This can only be the result of a calculated diplomatic play by Bohemia, to influence both Münster and the Hesse-Nassau to their side through what we can only assume was by exceptional foresight. However, there is nothing we can do to stop Münster from taking control of the Confederation as we have bound ourselves towards the creation of the Confederation. Bohemia is already exerting their influence over the new Confederation and any Burgundian influence that was once present in the region is now gone and we are now solidly in Bohemia’s sphere of influence.
Oh, Jean will hate this bitterly...
The Rise of the Rhenish Union

With the success of the revolution in seizing the Conference of Düsseldorf we can now pronounce the creation of a liberal Rhenish Republic independent of both Anvers and Prague. With the capture of so many heads of state we can either strong-arm the remaining Rhenish states to join us or encourage revolutionaries to create governments loyal to us. As for German politics we shall lean on our brothers in Danubia for defense against the old powers and for the hopeful unification of all Germans under one representative government.
Einigkeit und Recht und Freiheit!
Shall We Join the Rhenish Union?

For better or for ill, the Conference of Düsseldorf has come to an end and a new Rhenish country has come into existence. As we were a participant in the conference we must now decide whether or not we fulfill our obligations and join this new country. Düsseldorf has made it clear that if we will not join freely then they legally will have every right to incorporate us by force.
It’s time to be a part of something bigger.§R(RGAME OVER)§!
I’d rather not be a part of this monstrosity
The Burgundian Invasion

We have tried to remain steadfast in our support of the Jagiellons, but the decline of their power within Germany has made this commitment moot. Now it has placed us in grave danger. The Burgundians no longer seek to merely support us - they only desire our submission under their absolute rule! This morning the Burgundian parliament seized upon a minor border incident to declare war, with the intent of transforming $COUNTRY$ into an autonomous part of their nation! We now must fight for our freedom.
Zum Krieg!
The Rhenish Germans Reject our Ultimatum

It appears that the $FROM_COUNTRY$ government has failed to see the light. In hopes that the European Concert would recognize their pleas for independence, they have resisted our generous demands and have chosen to draw swords with us instead!
Then there is only one course of action…
The $YEAR$ Affair

The Burgundians and the Bohemians have fought for control of the Rhenish German lands for years. Now matters are coming to a head. This morning we received word of an attempt by a group of Rhenish Protestant fanatics to help the Burgundian Army stage a border incident to justify an invasion! When questioned these delusional men railed against the “Satanic” Bohemians and the Catholic Church, arguing that they wanted to “save the Rhenish people from Papal slavery.” News of this incident has inflamed political tensions across the country, and the Elbian Confederation has already announced its intent to send additional civil and military aid to $COUNTRY$ to shore up our defenses. However Duke Frédéric-Guillaume de Jülich of Berg has publicly accused the government of framing “these brave patriots” and has threatened to lead the secession of Berg proper if the Bohemians attempt to use this as an excuse to take control of $COUNTRY$.
What a mess…
The Rhenish Crisis

Duke Frédéric-Guillaume de Jülich of Berg’s flair for drama is once again causing headaches. We have received word that a group of Rhenish German Protestant zealots dressed in fake Rhenish Army uniforms were recently apprehended by the Rhenish border guard. It seems that they intended to stage a mock battle against several Burgundian soldiers to give our government a pretext to invade the east! We believe that the Duke somehow organized this scheme in an attempt to curtail Bohemian influence within the Rhenish Confederation. Instead the whole affair has outraged the common Rhenish people, with multiple Rhenish newspapers denouncing the Burgundian sympathizers amongst them as anti-Catholic bigots and foreign agents. The Elbian Confederation has announced that it shall increase its military presence in the Rhine region as a result of this affair. Our only option to preserve any Rhenish influence is to force the Duke of Berg to lead the secession of his homeland to keep it out of Bohemian hands.
Berg is better than nothing…
The Bohemians Assume Control of $COUNTRY$

The Elbian Confederation has stationed scores of civil and military personnel within our lands in the aftermath of the recent fiasco with the Burgundians. As we feared, the Duke of Berg led the secession of his homeland into Burgundian control. In response the Bohemians have declared that they shall be taking control of our administration for “reasons of security.” With the growth of pan-Germanism and Catholic fervor amongst our people in reaction to the Burgundian loyalists’ subterfuge, there is little chance of resisting them.
Perhaps this was inevitable.
The Rhenish German Submission

Our efforts to apply annexationist pressure upon the Rhenish Confederation have borne fruit. A sympathetic majority has prevailed within the Rhenish Landtag, where they have passed several measures soliciting further civil and military support from $COUNTRY$. This has given us an opportunity to station sufficient personnel within their nation to peacefully install a satellite government in the Confederation. §GOnce the German political arena grows more stable, we will be able to fully integrate the Rhenish Confederation into our own nation.§
Excellent news!
The Crisis of $YEAR$

Jean de Bouillon’s Rhenish project seems to be coming to a head. A recent report on the Elbian Confederation’s military has stirred up a wave of anti-Bohemian panic across the Rhenish political elite. More and more people are becoming convinced of two things : first, that the Elbian Confederation is preparing to subjugate us by force, and second, that we shall not be treated as equals within a prospective German nation-state, but instead disempowered and punished for perceived lack of obedience to Prague. Whether or not these concerns are based in reality, a radical pro-Burgundian faction is now attempting to push a bill through the Landtag that would reorganize much of the military along Burgundian lines and court Burgundian investment. If the measure passes then we will likely find ourselves transformed into a Burgundian client state.
The piper is about to be paid…
The Rhenish Submission

Anti-Bohemian sentiment is reaching a fever pitch in the Rhenish Confederation due to several alarmist publications on the rising power and belligerence of the Bohemian military. Many Rhenish citizens have lost faith in Bohemian leadership of Germany and fear the loss of their cultural identity should the Confederations merge. To that end a group of pro-Burgundian politicians have forced through a bill reshaping their military along Burgundian lines and soliciting major Burgundian investments in their economy and institutions. This combined with the general Burgundophile mood sweeping the Rhine will allow us to peacefully install a satellite regime in the Rhenish Confederation. It appears that Jean de Bouillon’s plan to subordinate both banks of the Rhine has finally paid off.
It…it actually worked? I mean, of COURSE it worked!
The Looming Crisis

We have successfully cast off the shackles of the Altes Regime and established a truly free nation, built upon the foundations laid by the First German Revolution in 1790. Yet unfortunately the Danubians, once hoped to be the beacon of liberal fervor within Germany, have instead succumbed to other political temptations. Thus we stand alone amidst the German people as the bearer of Marinus Dahlke’s legacy. The Burgundians are already marshalling their forces to attempt to force us back into servitude. Let us, then, recall the battle anthem of the German revolutionaries as they marched against the monarchists at Kassel so many years ago!\n\n”Lay the proud usurpers low! Tyrants fall in every foe! Liberty’s in every blow!
”Let us do or die!”
We Must Save $FROM_COUNTRY$!

All diplomatic contact has been broken off by the Rhenish government. They have declared our government to be a “den of reactionary vipers” and have stated that any further attempts by $COUNTRY$ to influence their politics will be taken as an act of war. Clearly the Rhenish institutions have been overrun by unchecked Dahlkism! We must free the Rhenish German people from their tyrannical regime.
They shall surely welcome us as liberators!
The Burgundian Invasion

Burgundy has been seeking to push all of the greater Rhenish basin into one confederation for years. Now they have deemed our existence an obstacle to that goal - one which they intend to remove. This morning a minor border incident occurred between a Burgundian patrol and some Westphalian militiamen. Such affairs have been swept under the rug by both of our governments in the past but this time the Burgundian government has seized upon the event to declare war! We must now fight to protect not just our independence but the future of Germany!
Zum krieg!
The End of Westphalia

With Westphalia defeated and occupied, we may now integrate its lands into the Rhenish Confederation. As Westphalia was a rather artificial nation to begin with it is hoped that there will not be much sentiment around seeking its revival.
Good riddance.
The Danubian Ultimatum

The Danubian government’s well-known raison d’etre is the unification of Germany, and they have for years been pressuring us to join their nation. Now they have presented a final ultimatum : Accede to annexation or face invasion!
We must bow to the inevitable and spare our people war.
Never! We shall fight for our freedom!
The Danubian Ultimatum

The Danubian government’s well-known raison d’etre is the unification of Germany, and they have for years been pressuring us to join their nation. Now they have presented a final ultimatum : Accede to annexation or face invasion!
We must bow to the inevitable and spare our people war.
Never! We shall fight for our freedom!
The Danubians Demand Bayreuth!

The dissolution of the Electorate of Bayreuth by Emperor Sigismund V, and the subsequent Burning of Nuremberg by the Reichsarmee, was always a bitterly unpopular action amongst the Danubian Germans, who saw it as a direct betrayal given their cultural connections to Bayreuth. Now that they have become united, they seem poised to seek revenge. After previously having sought to use agitators to foment a pan-German nationalist uprising against the Bohemian garrison in Bayreuth, they have now turned to more direct measures. We have received an ultimatum from the Danubian government : Evacuate all civil and military personnel from Bayreuth immediately, or else they will regard any attack upon Scandinavia by ourselves in the future as an attack upon $FROM_COUNTRY$ as well. We should seriously consider if Bayreuth is worth a prospective two-front war when the time comes to liberate Pomerania.
We cannot afford any distractions - remove all troops from Bayreuth.
Ignore this pathetic attempt at blackmail.
Bohemia has Refused!

The arrogant Bohemians have rejected our petition for the liberation of Bayreuth. We now know that only force will separate the despoilers of Nuremberg from their ill-gotten gains. It is thus fortunate that we have reason to believe that $FROM_COUNTRY$ will, in the near future, be drawn into a major war with Scandinavia, which should give us the opportunity to free Bayreuth from them while their attention is elsewhere. Of course, if for some reason the Czech sections of their citizenry were to seize control of the state, then we would also have a mandate to step in and safeguard Bayreuth. One way or another we will have our revenge.
There will be a reckoning.
A Golden Opportunity

Bohemia has become entangled in a war with Scandinavia, turning their attention northwards. This is the perfect chance to make good on our prior threats and liberate Bayreuth! If we do not strike now, while we have the chance and their guard in the south is lowered, then we may never have a suitable opportunity again. §RIf we hesitate now and Bohemia emerges from their war victorious then Bayreuth shall surely be out of our reach for the foreseeable future.§
Now comes the reckoning!
We are simply not ready to face Bohemia…
The Danubians Invade Bayreuth!

We had feared that we had not heard the last of the Danubian Germans when we rejected their impertinent demand for Bayreuth. Now the rogues have made good on their threat to plunge a knife into our back by invading the region during our war against Scandinavia! Sadly our prior political commitments to Bayreuth’s protection mean that we cannot temporarily evacuate the area and then reclaim it at a later date. We must face the Danubians here and now and remind them that, while the Empire may have passed away, we remain the sole master of Germany!
Death to traitors!
The Sorrow of Old Wurzburg

The Archbishopric of Wurzburg’s continued existence is due solely to the Congress of Paris in 1820. Its population is over two-thirds Protestant yet they are governed by a Catholic theocracy. In the past the Empire was able to provide enough support to keep order within Wurzburg but its dissolution has placed us in dire straits. Many are calling for the Archbishop to secularize the realm and appoint the Burgundian Count Emanuel de Montbéliard of Alsace, whose family holds an old claim to Wurzburg, as its new ruler. If the Archbishop does not end theocratic rule then the result will almost certainly be revolution, given the unrest which continues to simmer across Wurzburg.
It’s all because of that damned Zwingli!
The Wurzburg Riots

A group of Wurzburg City liberals recently organized a protest outside of the local tax office, declaring that they would no longer pay what amounted to a tithe to the church of a religion which neither they nor the bulk of the common Wurzburger people believe in. When the city guards were summoned to disperse the protest, dozens of citizens flocked to the liberals’ defense, inciting a much broader campaign of insurrection. Now the whole of the capital is awash with anti-clerical rioters and the only thing which might prevent the complete collapse of the nation, or worse, the establishment of a radical republic, is an immediate abdication by the Archbishop and the invitation of Count Emanuel to rule instead.
Death to the tyrant priest! Long live the free Wurzburger people!
We bow to no master but the Lord God and His Holiness the Pope!
The time has come to cede all temporal authority to a secular government.
Looming Disaster

The presence of a powerful, pan-German state on our borders has driven the republican coalition into a terrible division. All government business after the abolition of the theocratic regime has ground to a halt due to rancorous debates between pan-Germanists and Wurzburger nationalists. It is all but guaranteed that said neighbor is boosting their supporters within Wurzburg to promote annexationist sentiments. Our government cannot hold itself together for much longer.
Calamity!
Loss of Burgundian Support

The cession of Burgundian aid and assistance to our government has opened the door to political chaos. Duke Emanuel I has proven to be a rather aloof sovereign, far more ignorant of German culture than expected and caring little for the day-to-day governance of the nation. Without Burgundian support to keep the government humming along, this lack of direction by the sovereign and his administration has allowed local governments to claim more and more power. At this rate our nation may well disintegrate before long.
Calamity!
The Frankish Ultimatum
The Frankish state has turned its sights upon us. They have demand our annexation to “secure the unity of all Franks.” Whatever their excuses we have little means of resisting them.
So be it…
The Collapse of Wurzburg

Wurzburg, one of the Congress of Paris’ many aberrations, has crumbled beneath the weight of modern political movements and its own contradictions. The power of the Catholic Church has been smashed yet no viable secular government has arisen in its place - attempts to install Count Emanuel of Alsace as Duke of Wurzburg had foundered on the rocks of the Count’s own apathy towards our culture and our administration. In light of the government’s escalating paralysis, local communities have turned to neighboring realms for support, and the inevitable conclusion of this process is our disintegration.
Wurzburg is Wurzburg no more.
The Collapse of Wurzburg

The former Archbishopric of Wurzburg was a mistake of the Congress of Paris in 1820, a Catholic theocracy ruling over few Catholics and many Protestants. Anticlerical elements within Wurzburg attempted to court Burgundian support for its continued survival but this failed to check the erosion of its institutions. Now Wurzburg has collapsed and several communities formerly part of its territory have turned to us for guidance, petitioning us for annexation.
We won’t leave them helpless - of course we accept.
An Ultimatum from $FROM_COUNTRY$

The nation of $FROM_COUNTRY$ has refused to recognize our independence, instead demanding that we submit to their rule! Sympathetic pan-German nationalists have already begun to agitate for our annexation into their own country. If we do not fight for our liberty then we shall surely lose it.
It is futile, we must accept our role within the greater German destiny.
We will defend our freedom to the last breath!
An Ultimatum from $FROM_COUNTRY$

Scandinavia’s presence within our nation has declined precipitously, in part due to their loss of Hamburg. Now $FROM_COUNTRY$ has refused to recognize our independence, instead demanding that we submit to their rule! Sympathetic pan-German nationalists have already begun to agitate for our annexation into their own country. If we do not fight for our liberty then we shall surely lose it.
It is futile, we must accept our role within the greater German destiny.
We will defend our freedom to the last breath!
The Shifting Winds in Bremen

Our loss of Hamburg has drastically reduced our power projection within northwestern Germany. Nowhere is this felt more acutely than in Bremen. While we have occupied the city-state for years, the cost of maintaining our garrison within Bremen has now risen too high for our government to be able to justify. Furthermore the old Nordic loyalists whom we once leaned on for Bremener political support have steadily lost ground, either to local-minded politicians or to pan-German nationalists. As a result we have been forced to shutter our Bremener barracks and withdraw all Scandinavian military personnel. It is likely that a larger German power will seek to fill the resulting political vacuum…
Damn.
Pacifying the Rhineland

Our Rhenish territories remain in disorder. They are clinging to outdated laws and customs which are deplorable relics of a bygone era. If we want to preserve the stability of our eastern frontier then we must take a stronger role in their governance. A new bill has been drawn up to officially designate the eastern Rhineland as a special region within $COUNTRY$ proper, annexed on paper but maintaining a closely monitored “autonomous” government to prevent unnecessary disruptions. The only question is whether such directives are necessary or if we should focus on preparing them for eventual full annexation.
A necessary step on our path to glory.
A waste of time, we will absorb them soon enough.
Pacifying Swabia

Our Swabian territories remain in disorder. They are clinging to outdated laws and customs which are deplorable relics of a bygone era. If we want to preserve the stability of our eastern frontier then we must take a stronger role in their governance. A new bill has been drawn up to officially designate Swabia as a special region within $COUNTRY$ proper, annexed on paper but maintaining a closely monitored “autonomous” government to prevent unnecessary disruptions. The only question is whether such directives are necessary or if we should focus on preparing them for eventual full annexation.
A necessary step on our path to glory.
A waste of time, we will absorb them soon enough.
The New Burgundian Order
The Burgundian government has reorganized our nation to better suit their interests.
Very well.
Lingering Concerns in Swabia

Swabia remains unaligned with our own institutions. While few doubt the wisdom of our leader, growing voices within the ruling party are questioning our laxity regarding Swabia’s state of affairs. The excuse used by the leaders’ loyalists, that the international situation was too delicate to make such aggressive moves in the eastern frontier, has quietly but consistently been questioned by our nation’s elites. §RIt would be wise to take action to subordinate Swabia, sooner rather than later.§
Some people are never satisfied…
Lingering Concerns in the Rhineland

The eastern Rhineland remains unaligned with our own institutions. While few doubt the wisdom of our leader, growing voices within the ruling party are questioning our laxity regarding the Rhineland’s state of affairs. The excuse used by the leaders’ loyalists, that the international situation was too delicate to make such aggressive moves in the eastern frontier, has quietly but consistently been questioned by our nation’s elites. §RIt would be wise to take action to subordinate the eastern Rhineland, sooner rather than later.§
Some people are never satisfied…
The German Question

Western Germany is ostensibly under our protection but its current status is unsuitable for continued peace and prosperity in the region. The situation is delicate enough that the administration has decided not to heed the demands of jingoists who demanded the overthrow of the current Rhenish or Swabian governments and their replacement with autonomous Burgundian governors. While we have not abandoned our goal of securing our eastern border, we must seek other solutions beyond that of pure force.
Honey, not vinegar.
Burgundy Forces an Oldenburger Constitution

For years Duke Hans of Oldenburg has resisted pressure from Anvers to adopt a Burgundian-written constitution that would limit his authority and empower the Oldenburger Landtag. This was once possible by citing his obligations to the Emperor to preserve Imperial law from foreign disruption. However the Empire’s death now renders that excuse moot and so the Duke has no other option but to accept this constitution. While the Oldenburger people are excited by the expansion of civil rights and democracy, neither the Duke nor any of the Great Powers in this corner of Europe are pleased by Burgundy’s unilateral actions.
We do what we must…
Schloss Oldenburg under Siege!

For years Duke Hans of Oldenburg has resisted pressure from Anvers to adopt a Burgundian-written constitution that would limit his authority and empower the Oldenburger Landtag. However the consolidation of the Rhenish Confederation has sparked a wave of Burgundian-inspired reformism across northwestern Germany, and that tide has now reached us. The Duke awoke this morning to find crowds of angry Oldenburgers assembled outside of Schloss Oldenburg, demanding a constitution! Several nobles, who had been staying at the castle after a recent party, have demanded the Duke use this opportunity to purge the Burgundophile reformists. If the Duke caves in to the protestors then Burgundy is likely to assume control over Oldenburg in the future. Of course there is a third option : try to send a message to the Scandinavian garrison in Bremen and ask them to intervene. Yet this could lead to exchanging one potential master for another.
We must accept the constitution.
Summon the Ducal Guards! Oldenburg uber alles!
The Scandinavians will save us!
Schloss Oldenburg under Siege!

For years Duke Hans of Oldenburg has resisted pressure from Anvers to adopt a Burgundian-written constitution that would limit his authority and empower the Oldenburger Landtag. However the consolidation of the Rhenish Confederation and the rise of Westphalia has sparked a wave of liberalism across northwestern Germany, and that tide has now reached us. The Duke awoke this morning to find the city in the throes of a pro-Westphalian revolution seeking to join Oldenburg with the southern Radicalists! If the Duke rallies the monarchists to restore order then Burgundy’s growing power in the region will likely lead to them assuming control of us in the future, but might that be preferable to a meeting with the fallschwertmaschine?
Summon the Ducal Guards! God save the Duke!
Long live Oldenburg, long live Westphalia, long live the revolution!
Schloss Oldenburg under Siege!

For years Duke Hans of Oldenburg has resisted pressure from Anvers to adopt a Burgundian-written constitution that would limit his authority and empower the Oldenburger Landtag. However the consolidation of the Rhenish Confederation has sparked a wave of Burgundian-inspired reformism across northwestern Germany, and that tide has now reached us. The Duke awoke this morning to find crowds of angry Oldenburgers assembled outside of Schloss Oldenburg, demanding a constitution! Several nobles, who had been staying at the castle after a recent party, have demanded the Duke use this opportunity to purge the Burgundophile reformists. If the Duke caves in to the protestors then Burgundy is likely to assume control over Oldenburg in the future.
We must accept the constitution.
Summon the Ducal Guards! Oldenburg uber alles!
The End of Oldenburger Independence
With Burgundy’s consolidation of their rule in the Rhine, their influence in our nation is now overwhelming and they have forced us into the confederation.
Do I get to keep my castle?
The Annexation of Oldenburg
We have tried to maintain our neutrality. However $FROM_COUNTRY$ has consolidated their control of Bremen and now they have turned their sights upon us and demanded our annexation!
Only if I get to keep my castle.
Never! Long live Oldenburg!
Closure of the Oldenburg Garrison

With the loss of Hamburg, maintaining our presence in Oldenburg has become a difficult logistical feat, not to mention expensive. Our declining influence within northwestern Germany has given the Oldenburg head of state the opportunity to issue an edict closing the Scandinavian barracks in his realm and ordering all Scandinavian military personnel out of the country. We have no choice but to accept.
Ungrateful wretches.
A Strongly Worded Letter from Burgundy

The Burgundian ambassador delivered a disturbing memorandum to our head of government this morning. It opened by expressing its gratitude for Scandinavia’s “continued cooperation in our maintenance of peace and security in northern Europe,” but then diverted into a demand that we withdraw all forces from Oldenburg! Burgundy now regards the city-state as within their sphere of influence and feels threatened by our presence there. The memorandum has made it clear that if we refuse, it will mark the termination of our alliance. It closed by urging us to “understand the necessities imposed upon the Burgundian government due to reasons of national security.” If we accept then Oldenburg’s annexation into the Rhenish Confederation is all but certain.
Very well.
Anvers thinks that they can dictate our affairs to us? To Hell with them!
Thunder of a Danubian Revolution

Our defeat at the hands of the Radicalist regime in Alemannia has plunged our humble nation into turmoil. The people are outraged at the failure of the aristocracy and the other elites to lead the way to German unification as they had promised, and liberal sentiments are rising with feverish speed. Republicans throughout $COUNTRY$ have denounced the current government as doomed - if it cannot defeat Alemannia, they argue, how could it hope to stand up to the foreign powers keeping Germany divided? Therefore they are demanding unification with the Alemannian Radicalists and the abolition of the nobility…by force if necessary. The Danubian Army is already taking sides between republicans and monarchists and if we don’t order our loyalists to attack the traitors in their midst then a coup is certain.
Sweep the aristocracy into the ashbin of history!
We will fight these rebel scum in the streets, in the mountains, everywhere!
The Danubian People Plead for Our Leadership!

Our defeat of the decadent aristocrats in the Danubian Confederation have awakened its people to the light of republicanism. A revolution has broken out, with the old order torn from its throne and Radicalism elevated in its place. Given our previous victory, the new provisional Danubian government has offered to unify with us! They have made it clear that this would entail Alemannia taking the reins of the nation and not the other way around. This would place all of southern Germany under our authority! Shall we join in brotherhood with our eastern comrades?
Ja! We will unite Germany through liberty, equality, and fraternity!
Nein, we prefer to have good relations with the east.
The New Danubian Federation

Alemannia’s triumph over the Danubian Confederation has shattered the south-easterners’ confidence in their nobility and driven them to revolution. Radicals overthrew the monarchy and petitioned the Alemannian republicans to unite with their nation. A conference was quickly convened in the city of Ulm to draft a new constitution for the resulting state. The result was the emergence of a somewhat more centralized - and thoroughly republican - Danubian Federation, stretching across southern Germany with its new capital in Ulm as a compromise between the westerners and the easterners. The Alemannian Radicalists have now not only won their liberty but united the Hochdeutsche at the stroke of a pen. Crowned heads across Central Europe feel a pang of shock shoot through their hearts, as the bastion of Radicalism in Germany grows even stronger.
The German Phoenix is stirring from it slumber at last!
The Bohemian Solution

”Was ist des Deutschen Vaterland? So nenne mir das große Land! Gewiss, es ist das Böhmenreich, An Ehren und an Siegen reich? O nein, nein, nein! Sein Vaterland muss größer sein!”\n\nA fierce debate has arisen within German politics as to whether or not to lay claim to Bohemia. Many pan-nationalists see Bohemia as an unquestionably German state, a fact supported by the continued dominance of its German-speaking population over the Czechs. However there are those who fear international reaction from such an aggressive claim - not to mention the introduction of so many Slavs into Germany - and would prefer to only claim Upper Silesia. Still others see Bohemia as irreversibly corrupted by Slavic decadence and wish to focus on more pressing matters. §RSeveral neighboring states have declared that any attempts by Germany to completely annex Bohemia would be unacceptable.§
§RThe whole of Bohemia is, was, and will be German!§
Upper Silesia is, was, and will be German!
Such a tainted land has no place in the new Germany!

Sein Vaterland muss größer sein!”\n\nA fierce debate has arisen within German politics as to whether or not to lay claim to Bohemia. §RThe whole of Bohemia is, was, and will be German!§
Upper Silesia is, was, and will be German!
